Title: Data Analyst
Description:
You‚Äôre an important part of our future.

Hopefully, we're also a part of yours! At B. Braun, we protect and improve the health of people worldwide. This is also our vision for IT. You see technology as an opportunity, and you develop solutions that secure our business in the long term, we would like to implement the digital transformation of B. Braun with you. With fresh ideas, drive and team spirit, we are working to launch the medical technology of tomorrow and safeguard the healthcare of the future. Together. That's Sharing Expertise.

Data Analyst

Reference Code ES-COJ-DOI-XXXXXX

From Barcelona, you will join Germany-based Corporate Start-Up B. Braun New Ventures, which is taking a leading role in the digital transformation of healthcare. With a young and fast-growing team, we develop solutions to automate medical procedures across various business areas. Our goal is to augment caregivers‚Äô decision-making with data-driven insights, predictive analytics, and AI-powered solutions. Our cloud platform team is focused on creating corporate-wide solutions that will drive the next generation of B. Braun‚Äôs digital products and connected devices. The technologies and products we develop create new treatment possibilities, enable sharing of clinical experience, and result in better patient care. From our Barcelona location, you will be integrated into an international team that collaborates to achieve these goals.

Duties and responsibilities


You collect, analyze, and interpret complex healthcare and operational data to derive actionable insights that drive business decisions.
You design, build, and optimize data pipelines and workflows using Databricks, SQL, and other relevant technologies.
You create dashboards and reports using visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau) to communicate findings effectively to stakeholders.
You collaborate closely with data engineers, cloud architects, product managers, and software developers to integrate analytics into digital products and cloud-based solutions.
You develop and implement statistical models, machine learning algorithms, and predictive analytics to enhance data-driven decision-making.
You ensure data integrity, governance, and compliance with industry standards and regulatory requirements.
You work in an agile and cross-functional team, contributing to the continuous improvement of data analytics strategies and best practices.


Professional competencies


You have several years of experience as a Data Analyst, preferably in the healthcare, medical technology, or cloud-based product industry.
You have strong SQL skills and experience working with Databricks, Python, or R for data analysis and modeling.
You have experience with cloud data platforms (Azure, AWS, or GCP) and tools such as Delta Lake, Apache Spark, or Snowflake.
You are proficient in data visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or similar.
You have a strong understanding of data governance, ETL processes, and data warehousing concepts.
You have experience working in an agile environment with multidisciplinary teams.
You are familiar with machine learning techniques, statistical analysis, and predictive modeling (a plus).
You have experience in the healthcare industry or a comparable regulated environment (a plus).


Personal competencies


You are a proactive, results-oriented, and analytical thinker with problem-solving skills.
You work effectively in multidisciplinary teams, encourage collaboration (including virtual teams), and foster mutual support.
You have a hands-on mentality and a passion for transforming data into meaningful insights.
You stay productive and capable of acting in critical situations.
You communicate clearly and responsibly in English. Spanish and German are nice to have.


What we offer

Join a company that combines the innovation and agility of a start-up with the stability and global reach of a healthcare leader. By working with us, you'll be part of a team dedicated to improving people's health and healthcare services. Our corporate culture values accountability, diversity, and trust. Embrace a highly motivated international team, flat hierarchies, and fast decision-making. Barcelona, a vibrant city with a high quality of life, is an ideal location for you to grow professionally and personally.

Benefits


Flexible and family-oriented working hours and hybrid working between office and home.
Modern office optimized for concentration and collaboration, featuring an integrated high-tech simulation operating room, and generous social areas and creativity zones.
Experience the rich cultural offerings, architectural beauty, and warm climate of Barcelona.
Opportunities for professional development and continuous learning within an international team that fosters collaboration and innovation.
Attractive private healthcare insurance conditions.


B. Braun Medical, S.A. U. | Ver√≥nica Lerma Cabrera | +347231

Title: Data Analysis Internship
Description:
Our opportunity

Life is too short to just tick the box. Reimagine the box with Zurich!

Would you like to be part of a trainee program that helps you gain experience with newest technologies and build up the business knowhow in one of the biggest insurers in the world?

During this experience not only you will learn and boost your career but also you will build relationships and have fun with teams all over the world!

With us you will have a real opportunity to make a difference and be part of the team!

Your role

Are you enthusiastic about data analysis? Do you enjoy working with learning & development data? Do you excel in dynamic environments where your contributions can truly make a difference? If so, we have an exciting opportunity waiting for you!

As our Data Analysis Intern, you will have the chance to:


Assist in the crucial tasks of data cleaning and preparation to ensure our learning & development data is accurate and ready for analysis.
Utilize your advanced Excel skills to perform in-depth analysis and derive actionable insights from complex datasets.
Design and develop compelling Power BI dashboards that vividly illustrate key trends and metrics.
Play an essential role in the ongoing updates and maintenance of our data, ensuring its reliability and relevance.
Take the lead on a small data automation project, showcasing your ability to innovate and streamline our data processes.


Your Skills And Experience

We would like to give this opportunity to somebody who is:


Skilled in Data Analytics Tools & Techniques, and Data Modeling.
Has knowledge in Python, DAX, or/ and R
Proficient in Excel and Power BI
Experienced with Automation
Active student status with Spanish University/School is mandatory
University student interested in developing career in tech field
Looking for at least 9 months part-time/internship program
Tech savvy approach
An enthusiastic, capable, curious person craving to learn
A good team player with responsible and can-do attitude
Able to use English for daily communication with colleagues and managers from abroad


Additional Information

We offer benefits such as:


Paid Internship
Up to 30 hs weekly with Flexible schedule
LinkedIn, Coursera and internal training opportunities
Special discounts on different brands and products & great banking and insurance conditions.
Welcome pack that includes amazing gadgets.
A cool workspace with gaming, gym, and fun area!
A variety of clubs for you to get to know your colleagues and have fun, e.g. hiking, skiing, reading and many others!
Free coffee and fruit at the office.


Primary work location is Barcelona Poblenou.

Does it look like you have found your future job? Don‚Äôt wait anymore and apply sending your CV in English!

Who We Are

Looking for a challenging and inspiring work environment where you can make a difference? At Zurich millions of individuals and businesses place their trust in our products and services every day. Our 53,000 employees worldwide form the basis of our success, enabling, businesses and communities to face a world of risk with confidence. Imagine if you could help people do this all over the world. You‚Äôd give them confidence and reassurance by protecting what they love most. It‚Äôs a big challenge, but you will be supported by a world-class team who believe in helping you to reach your full potential and deliver on our promises.

Diversity & Inclusion

At Zurich we are an equal opportunity employer. We attract and retain the best qualified individuals available, without regard to race/ethnicity, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age or disability.

So be challenged. Be inspired. Help us make a difference.

You are the heart & soul of Zurich!

At Zurich, we like to think outside the box and challenge the status quo. We take an optimistic approach by focusing on the positives and constantly asking What can go right?

We highly value the experience and know-how of our employees and offer a wide range of opportunities across business areas to encourage you to apply for new opportunities within Zurich when you are ready for your next career step.

Let‚Äôs continue to grow together!


Location(s): ES - Barcelona
Schedule: Part Time
Recruiter name: Alba Marin Sola

  • Take the lead on a small data automation project, showcasing your ability to innovate and streamline our data processes.

Your Skills And Experience

We would like to give this opportunity to somebody who is:

  • Skilled in Data Analytics Tools & Techniques, and Data Modeling.
  • Has knowledge in Python, DAX, or/ and R
  • Proficient in Excel and Power BI
  • Experienced with Automation
  • Active student status with Spanish University/School is mandatory
  • University student interested in developing career in tech field
  • Looking for at least 9 months part-time/internship program
  • Tech savvy approach
  • An enthusiastic, capable, curious person craving to learn
  • A good team player with responsible and can-do attitude
  • Able to use English for daily communication with colleagues and managers from abroad

Additional Information

We offer benefits such as:

  • Paid Internship
  • Up to 30 hs weekly with Flexible schedule
  • LinkedIn, Coursera and internal training opportunities
  • Special discounts on different brands and products & great banking and insurance conditions.
  • Welcome pack that includes amazing gadgets.
  • A cool workspace with gaming, gym, and fun area!
  • A variety of clubs for you to get to know your colleagues and have fun, e.g. hiking, skiing, reading and many others!
  • Free coffee and fruit at the office.

Primary work location is Barcelona Poblenou.

Does it look like you have found your future job? Don‚Äôt wait anymore and apply sending your CV in English!

Who We Are

Looking for a challenging and inspiring work environment where you can make a difference? At Zurich millions of individuals and businesses place their trust in our products and services every day. Our 53,000 employees worldwide form the basis of our success, enabling, businesses and communities to face a world of risk with confidence. Imagine if you could help people do this all over the world. You‚Äôd give them confidence and reassurance by protecting what they love most. It‚Äôs a big challenge, but you will be supported by a world-class team who believe in helping you to reach your full potential and deliver on our promises.

Diversity & Inclusion

At Zurich we are an equal opportunity employer. We attract and retain the best qualified individuals available, without regard to race/ethnicity, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age or disability.

So be challenged. Be inspired. Help us make a difference.

You are the heart & soul of Zurich!

At Zurich, we like to think outside the box and challenge the status quo. We take an optimistic approach by focusing on the positives and constantly asking What can go right?

We highly value the experience and know-how of our employees and offer a wide range of opportunities across business areas to encourage you to apply for new opportunities within Zurich when you are ready for your next career step.

Let‚Äôs continue to grow together!

  • Location(s): ES - Barcelona
  • Schedule: Part Time
  • Recruiter name: Alba Marin Sola

Title: Data Analyst Trainee
Description:
Ecolab Company has an opening for an Data Analyst Trainee in our Procurement Analytics and Digital Solutions (ADS) team located in Barcelona, Spain. If you are a passionate professional that is seeking opportunity, advancement, and a rewarding learning chance and career we invite you to apply. This is a fantastic opportunity to join a highly recognized global growth company offering competitive compensation and benefits in addition to career growth.

Job Overview

As a part of the Data Operations team in the Global Supply Chain Analytics and Digital Solutions group you will be responsible for continuous improvements in digital capabilities and advanced analytics. You will lead the development of new digital products providing critical insights that help solve business challenges. The successful candidate will lead efforts to improve the chemical data understanding across the organization through improved process, governance, and data management.

Candidates must display a passion for systems, data, operational reporting & advanced analytics. The strong performer can expect further career advancement opportunities with Ecolab and will have the chance to move into other roles within Procurement or the organization, with increasing leadership opportunities. This is an exciting opportunity to advance your career with a stable growing company!

Main Responsibilities


Serve as a liaison among stakeholders to analyze, document, and validate requirements for reporting and changes to business processes
Develop and maintain data products
Develop, test, and operationalize new standardized reporting
Develop and maintain business intelligence dashboards
Lead automation of processes and analyses
Train other teams in systems, tools, and processes owned by ADS
Proactively make recommendations and identify opportunities to solve business problems through new business intelligence reporting
Interface with IT to specify and implement improvements to our data pipelines


Basic Qualifications


Masters in Data Science or Statistics or Computer Science or equivalent advance degree.
Interest in an Artificial Intelligence (AI) and business intelligence (BI) role
Experience with AI and BI data modeling and presenting insights to key stakeholders.
Exceptional analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Proficient in Python, PySpark, SQL, Azure AI, Tenserflow, Streamlit, Flask, Power Apps, Power BI, Snowflake, Azure SQL Database.
Intermediate SQL skills, or willingness to learn.
Fluent English
Full-time availability.
To be eligible for the Traineeship contract you must have completed your bachelor's or master's degree studies.
Work permit in Barcelona.


Preferred Qualifications


Experience designing and building standard reports and dashboards
History of managing and delivering projects, tasks, and initiatives
Ability to create, implement, document, and continuously improve processes in a changing environment
Training or experience in data science areas such as time series analysis, forecasting, classification, and regression analysis
Experience with data analytics tools such as Python, R, SPSS, MATLAB, Stata, and SAS
Experience working with global cross-functional teams and demonstrated ability to work well with people from different disciplines with varying degrees of technical expertise
Microsoft PowerBI experience
Project management experience
Experience in the petrochemical industry a plus
Enrolled in or recently completed degree with emphasis in Chemistry, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Information Technology, or Engineering preferred


Ecolab‚Äôs commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion (DE&I) reflects our longstanding value of working together to integrate diverse perspectives to challenge ourselves, reach our goals and do what‚Äôs right. Disability certificate will be an asset.

Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

Ecolab is committed to fair and equal treatment of associates and applicants and furthering the principles of Equal Opportunity to Employment. Our goal is to fully utilize minority, female, and disabled individuals at all levels of the workforce. We will recruit, hire, promote, transfer and provide opportunities for advancement based on individual qualifications and job performance. In all matters affecting employment, compensation, benefits, working conditions, and opportunities for advancement, Ecolab will not discriminate against any associate or applicant for employment because of race, religion, color, creed, national origin,‚ÄØcitizenship status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expressions, genetic‚ÄØinformation, marital status, age, or disability.

Title: Business Data Analyst - Pricing
Description:
About Ukio |

Ukio's mission is to empower individuals to live where they want, when they want üåé.

We do this by disrupting the traditional residential real estate market, providing fully furnished and artfully designed apartments for stays starting at one month. We remove all the hassle around finding a rental with no long-term contracts, moving/buying furniture, security deposits, broker fees, etc. giving choice and flexibility to allow people to live where and when they want. üí•

We are a Barcelona based startup with offices in Madrid, Lisbon, Berlin and Paris! and soon we will conquer some more cities across Europe üöÄ

Backed by Europe's best Venture Capital firms, the next year will be a critical phase in our growth as we look to further build out our team and expand into multiple new markets üî• . We have successfully raised a Series A investment round that will help propel our growth throughout Western Europe. ü•á

Our Culture |

We honor diversity, compassion, and honesty above all else in our team. We've already got a great mix of dedicated, collaborative, and results-driven people and are looking for more like minded folks to join our team. In true startup fashion, we always embrace the unknown and grant full autonomy to our team members to act as the owners of their projects and tasks. We are creators who embrace dynamic environments and take on and build up projects from scratch.

Our team is composed of everyone from foodies to athletes, adventure seekers to art buffs. We know fun, and we always have a team event on our calendars, so are you ready to join us?

Responsibilities |


Analyze strategies for real estate properties or hospitality services, including short-term rentals, hotels, and long-term leases
Analyze historical data, market trends, and competitor pricing to recommend optimal rates
Collaborate with the Revenue Team to align pricing strategies with business objectives
Build and maintain pricing models using advanced Excel techniques, business intelligence tools, and forecasting software
Generate daily, weekly, and monthly performance reports to track key metrics such as occupancy, average daily rate (ADR), and revenue per available unit (RevPAR)
Conduct scenario analyses to evaluate the impact of pricing changes on revenue and profitability


About you |


Bachelor's degree in Finance, Economics, Business, or a related field
2-4 years of experience in pricing, revenue management, or financial analysis within the real estate or hospitality industry
Proficiency in data analysis tools such as Excel, SQL, Power BI, or Tableau
Strong analytical and decision-making skills
Excellent communication and collaboration abilities


Ukio Life Benefits |


Private Health Insurance with ALAN
Flexible retribution with Payflow
UKIO Anniversary gift
Team buildings and office events
Transportation card (transportation coverage for role that have traveling needed for their work tasks according to the internal policy)
Breakfast at the office, fruits, nutrition bars, free coffee/tea and popcorn!
An amazing internal culture and no dress code!
International working environment with many different nationalities!


Ukio's culture promotes and values each individual's contribution. Diversity and inclusion, it's a big topic for us, as such we encourage applications from individuals of all backgrounds, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, socio-economic background, religion and/or belief.

Sky's the limit for us. We're here to revolutionize your life. Be part of this revolution üî•

We look forward to receiving your application!

For more information about Ukio, visit us at www.ukio.com and to keep up to date with UKIO's news, follow us on LinkedIn and Instagram!

Title: Data Analyst - Fraud & Payments
Description:
Who we are¬†




We simplify wealth creation. Founded in 2014 in Vienna, Austria by Eric Demuth, Paul Klanschek and Christian Trummer, we‚Äôre here to help people trust themselves enough to build their financial freedom ‚Äî for now and the future. Our user-friendly, trade-everything platform empowers both first-time investors and seasoned experts to invest in the cryptocurrencies, crypto indices, stocks*, precious metals and commodities* they want ‚Äî with any sized budget, 24/7. Our global team works across different cultures and time zones, bringing our products to more than 6 million customers, making us one of Europe‚Äôs safest and most secure platforms that powers modern investing.




Headquartered in Austria but operating across Europe, our products are built by fast-moving, talented, ‚Äúroll-up-your-sleeves-and-make-it-happen‚Äù kind of people. It‚Äôs these diverse perspectives and innovative minds operating as ONE TEAM that keep Bitpanda at the cutting edge of our industry. So if you‚Äôre someone who thinks big, moves fast and wants to make an impact right from day one, then get ready to join our industry-changing team. Let‚Äôs go!

Your Mission¬†


As a Data Analyst, you will be a key part of the Operational Excellence team, helping to enhance and streamline our processes to ensure efficiency, automation, and scalability at Bitpanda. In this role, you will play a strategic and collaborative role in monitoring, analyzing, and optimizing business operations‚Äîprimarily within Payments and Risk Operations. By generating valuable insights, identifying opportunities for improvement, and ensuring data integrity, you will help shape key decisions that drive real impact. This isn‚Äôt just a BI Analyst role focused on reporting‚Äîyou will be a trusted partner and problem-solver, working alongside teams to uncover trends, enhance performance, and create meaningful solutions.


What You‚Äôll Do¬†



Keep a pulse on key business metrics ‚Äì Develop and maintain reports that provide actionable insights to leadership (daily, weekly, and monthly).


Champion data integrity & accessibility ‚Äì Work closely with product and data engineering teams to enhance data quality and ensure seamless availability.


Implement smart alerts & anomaly detection ‚Äì Set up automated alerts to proactively detect any issues or trends impacting payment performance.


Drive strategic impact¬† ‚Äì Collaborate with the Payments team to develop and deliver data-driven recommendations that enhance performance and efficiency.



Who You Are¬†



Hold a Master‚Äôs degree in Engineering, Mathematics, Data Science, Finance, or a related field.


Relevant experience as a process/product analyst, ideally within Risk & Payments.


Skilled in SQL, Python, and visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Metabase, Power BI), with experience working with large datasets


A natural problem-solver who loves transforming complex data into clear, impactful insights through reports and dashboards.


Proactive and solutions-focused, always looking for ways to optimize processes and drive meaningful improvements.



What‚Äôs in it for you





We're proud of our flexible working model that includes 2 days (minimum) working from the local Hub, plus 60 Work From Anywhere days annually


Total compensation package including participation in our Bitpanda stock option plan


Competitive benefits programs and policies shaped by our flexibility-first philosophy


Company-wide and team events ‚Äî both in-person and virtually!


Bitpanda swag to keep you living the brand





And, above all, the opportunity to learn and grow as part of Bitpanda‚Äôs incredible journey towards being Europe‚Äôs future #1 investment platform.




Bitpanda is committed to fostering a fair and equal environment based on trust and mutual respect. We believe that a diverse and inclusive workplace is paramount to our success and we are committed to building a team that represents a wide variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills.

This isn‚Äôt just a BI Analyst role focused on reporting‚Äîyou will be a trusted partner and problem-solver, working alongside teams to uncover trends, enhance performance, and create meaningful solutions.


What You‚Äôll Do 

  • Keep a pulse on key business metrics ‚Äì Develop and maintain reports that provide actionable insights to leadership (daily, weekly, and monthly).

  • Champion data integrity & accessibility ‚Äì Work closely with product and data engineering teams to enhance data quality and ensure seamless availability.

  • Implement smart alerts & anomaly detection ‚Äì Set up automated alerts to proactively detect any issues or trends impacting payment performance.

  • Drive strategic impact  ‚Äì Collaborate with the Payments team to develop and deliver data-driven recommendations that enhance performance and efficiency.


Who You Are 

  • Hold a Master‚Äôs degree in Engineering, Mathematics, Data Science, Finance, or a related field.

  • Relevant experience as a process/product analyst, ideally within Risk & Payments.

  • Skilled in SQL, Python, and visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Metabase, Power BI), with experience working with large datasets

  • A natural problem-solver who loves transforming complex data into clear, impactful insights through reports and dashboards.

  • Proactive and solutions-focused, always looking for ways to optimize processes and drive meaningful improvements.

What‚Äôs in it for you



  • We're proud of our flexible working model that includes 2 days (minimum) working from the local Hub, plus 60 Work From Anywhere days annually

  • Total compensation package including participation in our Bitpanda stock option plan

  • Competitive benefits programs and policies shaped by our flexibility-first philosophy

  • Company-wide and team events ‚Äî both in-person and virtually!

  • Bitpanda swag to keep you living the brand


And, above all, the opportunity to learn and grow as part of Bitpanda‚Äôs incredible journey towards being Europe‚Äôs future #1 investment platform.


Bitpanda is committed to fostering a fair and equal environment based on trust and mutual respect. We believe that a diverse and inclusive workplace is paramount to our success and we are committed to building a team that represents a wide variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Overview

The Celergo Streamline Organization (CSL) is committed to providing World Class Service to clients by hiring, developing and retaining qualified service professionals; by treating each client contact as a service opportunity and by delivering outstanding customer care to clients and associates.

Within the CSL Implementation department we are looking for an experienced Business Intelligence Analyst to lead data analysis and reporting efforts within the department.

What will I be doing?


You will formulate analytical problems, extracting & analyzing data from multiple systems, summarizing critical findings/insights, and developing a compelling visual representation of analyses with actionable recommendations
You will work with multiple stakeholders to identify, design, develop and implement advanced analytics projects
You will acquire, clean and analyse large data sets and do exploratory analysis to understand our data and if it meets project requirements
You will design reports to help our management team make strategic decisions
You will be a champion for data-based decision making
You will drive the improvement in how we organise and classify our data across the Implementation department and beyond
You will help formulate our data analysis offering and produce new models to forecast future outcomes


What skills will I need?


You will have high ethical standards. You will understand the importance of keeping data safe and secure and ensure ADP and client data is safeguarded at all times
You will be able to extract data from core systems and understand how this data can be structured to make analysis more straightforward
You will be naturally analytical and will be able to see inconsistencies in data
You will be able to see through the numbers to spot trends in data and be able to model them to help plan for possible outcomes
You will be interested in discovering more about data patterns and automated decision making
You will be a born story teller. You will be able to make sense of large volumes of information. You will have a natural ability to find the useful information amongst reams of data and be able to translate this into simple charts or presentations to drive better decision making
You will be an Excel whizz. You will know your pivot tables from your data tables and will have macro programming abilities
You will have a keen attention to detail and the ability to produce highly accurate deliverables
You will be willing to roll up your sleeves and do the mundane work. Data will need to be cleansed; Master Data defined and taxonomies refined.
You will be a critical thinker who is able to see the bigger picture and challenge assumptions and established processes to improve productivity and efficiency
You will be a first rate communicator. You will be required to challenge teams and management in a polite but forceful manner. You will be expected to present your findings at Executive level
You will be able to manage demanding workloads including working to conflicting and changing deadlines.
You will be comfortable with uncertainty. Elements of your work will be new, and not everything will be defined precisely at the outset


How will I know that I am successful at it?


Data will be cleaner and more accurate as an outcome of the work you are performing
Your project reports will be the talk of the company. They will be clear and concise and will be used to support decision making at the highest levels
Your forecasts will be so accurate management may start to suspect you are a fortune teller


Qualifications And Experience


3 to 5 years of experience in reporting, business intelligence, data analysis or similar
Experience in project management and/or business improvement environments is a plus
Experience of working with BI tools and data visualization tools is required. Power BI will be a plus.
Expert Excel skills, include macro and Power Query. Dax, M, and SQL knowledge are a plus.
Proven ability to work within a team and independently.
You care curious, had expose to an international culture and ability to work in a multinational environment.
Efficient in at least English. Additional languages are pluses.
University degree or equivalent in education or experience.


A little about ADP: We are a comprehensive global provider of cloud-based human capital management (HCM) solutions that unite HR, payroll, talent, time, tax and benefits administration and a leader in business outsourcing services, analytics, and compliance expertise. We believe our people make all the difference in cultivating a down-to-earth culture that embraces our core values, welcomes ideas, encourages innovation, and values belonging. We've received recognition for our work by many esteemed organizations, learn more at ADP Awards and Recognition.

Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Equal Employment Opportunity at ADP: ADP is committed to an inclusive, diverse and equitable workplace, and is further committed to providing equal employment opportunities regardless of any protected characteristic including: race, color, genetic information, creed, national origin, religion, sex, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, lawful alien status, ancestry, age, marital status, protected veteran status or disability. Hiring decisions are based upon ADP‚Äôs operating needs, and applicant merit including, but not limited to, qualifications, experience, ability, availability, cooperation, and job performance.

Ethics at ADP: ADP has a long, proud history of conducting business with the highest ethical standards and full compliance with all applicable laws. We also expect our people to uphold our values with the highest level of integrity and behave in a manner that fosters an honest and respectful workplace. Click https://jobs.adp.com/life-at-adp/ to learn more about ADP‚Äôs culture and our full set of values.

Title: Data Analyst, EMEA Performance Media
Description:
What You'll Do:

As a Data Analyst in our Analytics Performance Media team, you will drive advertising strategies thanks to your oversight of business objectives and technical expertise of our products.


Client insights: you will analyse complex data from multiple sources to understand the performance of our advertisers‚Äô campaigns and generate innovative and impactful insights
Business strategy: you will partner with account executives, account strategists, and campaign managers to help drive client strategy and direction
Reporting tools and metrics: you will develop and scale reports and metrics that will present actionable insights to teams across the business and strategic leadership.
Testing: you will design, monitor and analyse A/B tests to understand better how our products work for clients.
Collaborative projects: you will work on ad hoc projects with different teams to automate analyses globally, improve our internal processes and our way of working and scale knowledge across the company



Your work environment:


Flexible remote working options - balance your life the way you want.
A tech-forward, primarily digital workspace.
Need special work hours? Let's talk about it!



Who You Are:


At least 2 years of experience in data analysis
A problem-solver with a passion for analytics and a logical approach to challenges.
Able to solve data problems using Python, SQL, and enthusiastic about automating and scaling solutions.
Business-minded with a goal to turn data insights into actionable strategies.
Team player who thrives in a collaborative, inclusive, and vibrant workspace.
You are skilled at simplifying complex concepts for diverse audiences.
Experience in online advertising, marketing, or consulting will be a plus.
Fluent in English
Must be eligible to work in Spain full-time with no restrictions.



We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we‚Äôd love to see your application!

Who We Are:

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world‚Äôs marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us:

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.
Show more
HTML:
What You'll Do:

As a Data Analyst in our Analytics Performance Media team, you will drive advertising strategies thanks to your oversight of business objectives and technical expertise of our products.

  • Client insights: you will analyse complex data from multiple sources to understand the performance of our advertisers‚Äô campaigns and generate innovative and impactful insights
  • Business strategy: you will partner with account executives, account strategists, and campaign managers to help drive client strategy and direction
  • Reporting tools and metrics: you will develop and scale reports and metrics that will present actionable insights to teams across the business and strategic leadership.
  • Testing: you will design, monitor and analyse A/B tests to understand better how our products work for clients.
  • Collaborative projects: you will work on ad hoc projects with different teams to automate analyses globally, improve our internal processes and our way of working and scale knowledge across the company


Your work environment:

  • Flexible remote working options - balance your life the way you want.
  • A tech-forward, primarily digital workspace.
  • Need special work hours? Let's talk about it!


Who You Are:

  • At least 2 years of experience in data analysis
  • A problem-solver with a passion for analytics and a logical approach to challenges.
  • Able to solve data problems using Python, SQL, and enthusiastic about automating and scaling solutions.
  • Business-minded with a goal to turn data insights into actionable strategies.
  • Team player who thrives in a collaborative, inclusive, and vibrant workspace.
  • You are skilled at simplifying complex concepts for diverse audiences.
  • Experience in online advertising, marketing, or consulting will be a plus.
  • Fluent in English
  • Must be eligible to work in Spain full-time with no restrictions.


We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we‚Äôd love to see your application!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are growing our teams and this is an opportunity for you to join our Barcelona office as a Data Analyst within the Analytics Performance Marketing team.

You will collaborate closely with Data Analysts, Data Scientists besides UA Managers and other Marketing roles to analyse and interpret data that drives our marketing strategies.

Your insights will play a key role in shaping campaign optimization, identifying growth opportunities, and ultimately contributing to the company's success in a competitive gaming market.

As a Data Analyst you will have a key role in defining, extracting and actioning data from big and complex datasets from a variety of analytical solutions from simple to complex.

What You'll Do

Key Responsibilities:
Data Analysis & Reporting:
Gather, clean, and analyze marketing data from multiple sources to provide actionable insights.
Produce ad hoc analyses to support decision-making for campaigns and product launches.
Monitor and evaluate the performance of marketing campaigns ( paid ads, organic TV, brand) and provide recommendations for optimisation.
Develop actionable insights from user data that inform marketing targeting, acquisition and retention strategies.
Collaboration:
Collaborate with cross-functional teams including Data Science, Data Engineer, to integrate marketing data with overall product and business objectives.
Communicate findings and insights to non-technical stakeholders through clear and concise visualizations and presentations.
Data Quality & Governance:
Ensure the accuracy and integrity of all marketing data through regular data audits and validation processes.
Help set and maintain data tracking standards across marketing channels, ensuring consistency and reliability.







What We're Looking For

Required Qualifications:
3 to 5 years of experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar analytical role, preferably within the gaming / tech / financial industry.
Strong proficiency in data analysis tools (SQL, Python, Excel, etc.).
Experience with data modelling, time series analysis, A/B testing, Difference in Difference
Ability to identify trends, extract insights, and communicate findings in a clear and actionable manner.
Strong attention to detail and ability to work with large datasets.
Ability to present complex data in an easy-to-understand format to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Nice-to-Have Skills:
Familiarity with game-related metrics, mobile apps such as daily active users (DAU), in-app purchases (IAPs), and retention/engagement metrics.


Why Product Madness?

As part of the Aristocrat family, we share their mission of bringing joy to life through the power of play, with a world-class team who creates top-grossing, leading titles in the social casino genre, including Heart of Vegas, Lightning Link, Cashman Casino.

With 800 team members across the globe, Product Madness is headquartered in London, with offices in Barcelona, Gda≈Ñsk, Lviv, Montreal and a remote team spanning the USA, making us a truly global powerhouse.

We live by our People First principle. Regardless of where, when, or how they work, our team members have opportunities to elevate their careers, and grow alongside us. We take pride in fostering an inclusive culture, where our people are encouraged to be their very best, every day.

But don‚Äôt just take our word for it. In 2024, we made the Global Inspiring Workplace Awards list, and won a bronze award at the Stevies for Great Employers in the ‚ÄòEmployer of the Year - Media and Entertainment‚Äô category.

So, what‚Äôs stopping you?

Our Values
People First
We have the deepest respect for our people and their well being. We know they are exceptionally talented and will always have a choice. We want them to re-choose us every day. We are committed to building a culture where each person's voice will always be heard and addressed.
MAD for More
Always improving, innovating and never settling for the existing. We push all boundaries with courage and ambition to become the world‚Äôs best games company.
Champion Together We excel at what we do but yet remain humble and helpful to our teammates. We champion one another and hold each other to high standards without any egos.
Globally Inclusive
We are all Equal - regardless of the language we speak, where we live, our gender, religion or culture we come from. We want to build a global home, where everyone has the equal opportunity to make an impact.
Customer Focused
We always think from the customer's perspective - be it players or internal customers.

Improving their experience and joy is what drives us. Every client's success is our big win!

Travel Expectations

None

At this time, we are unable to sponsor work visas for this position. Candidates must be authorized to work in the job posting location for this position on a full-time basis without the need for current or future visa sponsorship.

Title: Junior CS Insights Associate
Description:
Job Description

ABOUT THIS JOB

Our Analysts are vital to NielsenIQ‚Äôs success. They work every day with our client base, which includes most of the major brands you see in the supermarket. We also work with most of the supermarkets and other retailers where you‚Äôll find these products. If you saw it the last time you did your weekly shop, they‚Äôre probably a NielsenIQ client, as is the shop. They all rely on our Senior Analytics Executives.

Our clients trust our Insights Analysts, coming to them when they have challenges and questions. These questions range from deciding on new product development, designing a new price strategy, and much more! NielsenIQ‚Äôs Analysts work with our clients to create and present analyses based on the world‚Äôs best datasets. Our insights team support clients in Health and Beauty, Beers, Wine and Spirits or Grocery.

We are confident and capable crafters of compelling insights and deliver clear and actionable recommendations to our clients, helping them grow their business.

A successful candidate for this role will be someone who can establish strong relationships with both our clients and our colleagues. You will quickly become a trusted partner, working with many of our clients‚Äô teams, including marketing, sales, category, and many more. You will be expected to understand our clients‚Äô needs and then create and present solutions that help those clients achieve their strategic and tactical goals.

Our team has a wide range of backgrounds and skill sets. Some of us have backgrounds in data, some in marketing, and others in sales. We are looking for someone who is keen to bring their excellent story-telling skills to a modern, data environment.

If telling stories through data excites you but you‚Äôre uncertain whether you have the data knowledge: get in touch. We have an excellent training program, ensuring you understand all our products and how we create analyses.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Understanding Client Needs:


Understanding client business priorities and the role we can play in supporting these goals
Understand the impact we can have on personal objectives of individuals at our clients
Responsible for setting up client onboarding for analytics & insights services and conducting tactical client training for Guided Analytics & NielsenIQ tools such as Connect Express and Discover


Delivering Insight:


Become a category expert; be curious and engage with the client industry, their categories and key market trends
Being prepared to challenge client hypothesis and bring a new perspective
Make recommendations based on rigorous analysis leveraging multiple data sources, sound business understanding and commercial awareness.


Workload Management and Prioritization:


Manages workload independently and effectively prioritizes client commitments alongside internal commitments.
Maintains a clear communication pathway with the key stakeholders
Maintains and delivers work log trackers and project plans where applicable


REQUIREMENTS


Engaging presenter
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Excellent time management and prioritization skills with a proven track record of delivering projects on time
Confident numerically
Ability to analyze data confidently
Problem solving and solutions orientated
Performs work accurately and effectively with attention to detail
Good at building relationships, internally and with clients
Experience of working in an analytical environment
An understanding of the FMCG industry and trends
Capable of leveraging tools such as Microsoft excel and PowerPoint
Experience in using Home Panel data is a plus
Native in Spanish and good level of English


WHAT WE CAN OFFER

We provide the most complete and trusted view of consumers and markets in 90 countries covering 90% of the world‚Äôs populations. Focusing on consumer-packaged goods manufacturers and retailers, we combine unparalleled datasets, pioneering technology, and the industry‚Äôs top talent to create insights that unlock innovation and redefine what‚Äôs possible.

Working with our Customer Success team gives you access to:


Our amazing 'people first' culture with plenty of flexibility
Career & Learning development
Making an impact on biggest FMCG manufacturers' growth
Becoming an expert in categories that shape Spanish retail


Additional Information

This is a full time role based in Barcelona offering a hybrid working mode combining working from home, office and visiting clients.

Additional Information

Our Benefits


Flexible working environment
Volunteer time off
LinkedIn Learning
Employee-Assistance-Program (EAP)


About NIQ

NIQ is the world‚Äôs leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights‚Äîdelivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms‚ÄîNIQ delivers the Full View‚Ñ¢. NIQ is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world‚Äôs population.

For more information, visit NIQ.com

Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

NIQ is committed to reflecting the diversity of the clients, communities, and markets we measure within our own workforce. We exist to count everyone and are on a mission to systematically embed inclusion and diversity into all aspects of our workforce, measurement, and products. We enthusiastically invite candidates who share that mission to join us. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class. Our global non-discrimination policy covers these protected classes in every market in which we do business worldwide. HTML:
Job Description

ABOUT THIS JOB

Our Analysts are vital to NielsenIQ‚Äôs success. They work every day with our client base, which includes most of the major brands you see in the supermarket. We also work with most of the supermarkets and other retailers where you‚Äôll find these products. If you saw it the last time you did your weekly shop, they‚Äôre probably a NielsenIQ client, as is the shop. They all rely on our Senior Analytics Executives.

Our clients trust our Insights Analysts, coming to them when they have challenges and questions. These questions range from deciding on new product development, designing a new price strategy, and much more! NielsenIQ‚Äôs Analysts work with our clients to create and present analyses based on the world‚Äôs best datasets. Our insights team support clients in Health and Beauty, Beers, Wine and Spirits or Grocery.

We are confident and capable crafters of compelling insights and deliver clear and actionable recommendations to our clients, helping them grow their business.

A successful candidate for this role will be someone who can establish strong relationships with both our clients and our colleagues. You will quickly become a trusted partner, working with many of our clients‚Äô teams, including marketing, sales, category, and many more. You will be expected to understand our clients‚Äô needs and then create and present solutions that help those clients achieve their strategic and tactical goals.

Our team has a wide range of backgrounds and skill sets. Some of us have backgrounds in data, some in marketing, and others in sales. We are looking for someone who is keen to bring their excellent story-telling skills to a modern, data environment.

If telling stories through data excites you but you‚Äôre uncertain whether you have the data knowledge: get in touch. We have an excellent training program, ensuring you understand all our products and how we create analyses.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Understanding Client Needs:

  • Understanding client business priorities and the role we can play in supporting these goals
  • Understand the impact we can have on personal objectives of individuals at our clients
  • Responsible for setting up client onboarding for analytics & insights services and conducting tactical client training for Guided Analytics & NielsenIQ tools such as Connect Express and Discover

Delivering Insight:

  • Become a category expert; be curious and engage with the client industry, their categories and key market trends
  • Being prepared to challenge client hypothesis and bring a new perspective
  • Make recommendations based on rigorous analysis leveraging multiple data sources, sound business understanding and commercial awareness.

Workload Management and Prioritization:

  • Manages workload independently and effectively prioritizes client commitments alongside internal commitments.
  • Maintains a clear communication pathway with the key stakeholders
  • Maintains and delivers work log trackers and project plans where applicable

REQUIREMENTS

  • Engaging presenter
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Excellent time management and prioritization skills with a proven track record of delivering projects on time
  • Confident numerically
  • Ability to analyze data confidently
  • Problem solving and solutions orientated
  • Performs work accurately and effectively with attention to detail
  • Good at building relationships, internally and with clients
  • Experience of working in an analytical environment
  • An understanding of the FMCG industry and trends
  • Capable of leveraging tools such as Microsoft excel and PowerPoint
  • Experience in using Home Panel data is a plus
  • Native in Spanish and good level of English

WHAT WE CAN OFFER

We provide the most complete and trusted view of consumers and markets in 90 countries covering 90% of the world‚Äôs populations. Focusing on consumer-packaged goods manufacturers and retailers, we combine unparalleled datasets, pioneering technology, and the industry‚Äôs top talent to create insights that unlock innovation and redefine what‚Äôs possible.

Working with our Customer Success team gives you access to:

  • Our amazing 'people first' culture with plenty of flexibility
  • Career & Learning development
  • Making an impact on biggest FMCG manufacturers' growth
  • Becoming an expert in categories that shape Spanish retail

Additional Information

This is a full time role based in Barcelona offering a hybrid working mode combining working from home, office and visiting clients.

Additional Information

Our Benefits

  • Flexible working environment
  • Volunteer time off
  • LinkedIn Learning
  • Employee-Assistance-Program (EAP)

About NIQ

NIQ is the world‚Äôs leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights‚Äîdelivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms‚ÄîNIQ delivers the Full View‚Ñ¢. NIQ is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world‚Äôs population.

For more information, visit NIQ.com

NIQ is committed to reflecting the diversity of the clients, communities, and markets we measure within our own workforce. We exist to count everyone and are on a mission to systematically embed inclusion and diversity into all aspects of our workforce, measurement, and products. We enthusiastically invite candidates who share that mission to join us. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class. Title: Data Quality Analyst
Description:
In November of 2024, Printful and Printify came together as two equals and merged to form a global on-demand powerhouse. This role will involve working across our two platforms and brands, a unique and special challenge. To learn more about the merger, check out our blog post.

About The Role

Join us as a Data Quality Analyst, where your meticulous attention to finance data ensures the availability, completeness, and accuracy of essential information. Your primary focus will be on establishing efficient data retrieval processes and ensuring the highest quality of source data. You will be responsible for gathering all relevant financial data, ensuring its accuracy and prompt availability. A key part of your role will be developing and maintaining a robust data quality monitoring system, and conducting business tests to identify and resolve any issues.

Your Daily Tasks will Entail:


Maintain the accuracy of finance data in the data warehouse by developing and maintaining a robust data quality monitoring system, driving the resolution of identified errors
Collaborate with data engineers and business stakeholders to improve data pipelines
Develop source data tables for finance reporting needs and design scalable data models that facilitate accurate and insightful decision-making
Drive company-wide data accessibility by advocating for self-service data usage and utilizing BI tools such as Looker to empower teams with actionable insights
Keep processes organized and well-documented, contributing to process improvements and ensuring efficiency, particularly during month-end closing activities
Foster cross-functional collaboration by ensuring effective communication and alignment between finance and data teams, supporting seamless integration and cooperation



Your Qualifications:


At least 3 years of experience as a Business Intelligence Developer/Data Analyst
At least 2 years of experience building and enhancing Looker applications and administration
Well-versed in Python and SQL coding
Skills in data modeling and business logic processes
Experience with DWH design
Analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail
Able to work in a highly collaborative environment
Proactive attitude and ability to work independently, taking ownership of projects and delivering high-quality results within deadlines
Able to demonstrate knowledge of dimensional modeling, and data visualization techniques



What we Offer:


All the resources and tools to perform your tasks (choose between Mac or Windows)
An opportunity to work remotely or in a modern and welcoming office in Rƒ´ga
Flexible working hours (start your day as late as 11 a.m.)
Health insurance, including a mental wellness program
Employee discounts for 300+ premium products
Room for professional growth (conferences, workshops, mentoring, guest lectures)
Exciting team-building events and parties you‚Äôll never forget!



We are an equal opportunity workplace. We‚Äôre committed to diversity and inclusion and make our hiring decisions based solely on qualifications, merit, and work experience.

Interested, but don‚Äôt think this is the right fit for you? Feel free to share it with friends and check out other open positions at our career's site. We‚Äôre always looking for creative and driven minds to join our ever-growing team.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Your mission

Your mission

Skills

We are looking for a highly motivated Marketing Data Analyst to join our Growth and Marketing team. In this role you will work closely with growth, marketing, product, and business teams to drive growth and optimize marketing efforts by delivering actionable insights through data analysis, and supporting data-driven decision-making. This will be a highly analytical role, that will require a mix of cross-collaboration, operations, creativity and strong communication skills. More specifically you will be responsible for the following:


Work with growth and marketing to identify opportunities to optimize always on activities and campaigns, and drive overall growth and marketing success.
Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to track key performance metrics (KPIs), and implement specific dashboards to support leadership.
Analyze data sets to identify patterns, trends, and insights to inform growth and marketing decisions.
Ability to translate complex data into clear and actionable insights for growth and marketing teams.
Work closely with growth, marketing, product and strategy to promote the implementation of conclusions and bring business-wide improvements.
Investigate and attribute data anomalies, build automated anomaly attribution tools.
Support Livo data foundations, ranging from data modeling to tooling to consume data across the organisation.
Contribute to building a data-driven culture within Livo.


Your profile

What We're Looking For


Bachelor's degree or above, majoring in statistics or data science is preferred.
At least 3+ years of experience in growth analytics, data analysis, or a similar role in a high-performance technology company
Strong analytical skills, attention to detail, and a commitment to delivering high-quality insights. Proficiency in data analysis tools such as SQL and Python.
Knowledge of modern data tools such as Airbyte, Fivetran, or equivanet.
Experience with data visualization tools like Metabase, Looker, or similar platforms.
Experience with A/B testing, experimentation, and statistical analysis.
Familiarity with cloud-based data storage and management services.
Strong spoken and written English and Spanish is a must. Other languages are nice to have.
Self-starter with the ability to thrive in a fast-paced entrepreneurial environment.


Why us?

At Livo Health, we offer a unique opportunity to make a tangible impact in the healthcare space. You will play a pivotal role in scaling our operations, all while working alongside passionate individuals who are driven to make a difference.


High Growth: Work in a dynamic, fast-paced environment with countless opportunities for personal and professional development.
Competitive salary package: reflecting your experience and expertise, ensuring you are rewarded for your hard work and dedication
Meaningful equity package: We truly want team members to own a relevant part of the business as a key driver to fully buy into the equity story and the change we‚Äôre trying to promote in the world, with the corresponding economic upside that goes with it
Innovation: Be at the forefront of transforming healthcare staffing through technology and innovative operational processes.
Impact: Help solve one of healthcare‚Äôs most critical issues ‚Äî healthcare professional talent crisis/shortage ‚Äî and make a real-world impact on healthcare providers and patients alike.
Cool & vibrant Offices: Very well located offices at the heart of Barcelona in Paseo de Gracia with plenty of natural light, great views, spacious and cool vibes
Culture: Strong culture with an emphasis on ownership, impact, and ambition, coupled with the determination to build something meaningful whilst enjoying the journey
Benefits: We will soon rollout a benefits program in line with market standards


Interview Process

Our hiring process is designed to assess both your skills and cultural fit with our mission-driven team:


Call with HR: initial conversation to assess motivation, culture fit and salary expectations
45-minute interview with our VP of Growth, David
60-minute technical SQL & Programming call with Backend Engineer
45-minute Case Study with our VP of Growth and CEO
45-minute culture fit call with CTO


About Us

Livo was born with the mission to improve healthcare globally through cutting edge technology and that has always been our North Star since we deeply believe health is the most important asset we all have as individuals. We launched last year in Spain our nursing shift marketplace whose aim is to support health care institutions with their nurse staffing needs, by matching institutions with healthcare professionals that are interested in extra work, adding transparency, flexibility and convenience to both stakeholders and its traction has been outstanding. Our vision is to radically transform the way healthcare institutions hire, retain and manage talent nowadays whilst empowering healthcare staff with more tools, flexibility, money, and recognition.

Title: Internship in Data Analysis and Dashboard Development
Description:
Role Description As an Intern in the EMEA OPS team within the Service Supply Chain (SSC), you will play a key role in enhancing operational visibility by designing and developing data-driven tools and dashboards, primarily using Power BI. Your focus will be on analyzing data and creating user-friendly dashboards that provide live operational insights, helping the team extract meaningful conclusions to improve our parts shipment and repair operations across EMEA.
Requirements
Currently pursuing a degree in Data Analytics, Computer Science, Engineering, Business, or a related field, with plans to graduate within the next year.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Proficiency in data analysis tools and techniques, including Power BI.
Knowledge of database systems and experience with data visualization.
Effective communication skills for presenting insights and working collaboratively.
Ability to work independently, manage multiple tasks, and meet deadlines.
Nice to Have
Experience with programming languages such as Python or SQL.
Familiarity with supply chain operations or logistics processes.
Knowledge of other data visualization tools or advanced features of Power BI.
Previous internship or project experience involving dashboard development.
Interest in gaining practical experience in a dynamic, operations-focused environment.


Experience Our Benefits

Being part of HP means access to an international community with lots of growth opportunities within the company, professional development resources, networking opportunities, while enjoying in a great atmosphere making an impact.


You will be able to choose to either work office-based or hybrid work style.
Flexible schedule for part time (4h/day) or full time (8h/day) for a 6 to12 months agreement.
Lunch in the cafeteria.
Love sports? Then take advantage of our sports center (indoor and outdoor); gym, squash courts, tennis courts, basketball courts and with 25+ regular coordinated activities / sports , such as HIIT training, squash,‚ÄØbasketball and yoga.
A Young employee Network (YEN) which host fun events on a regular basis, such as ‚Äúbeer bust‚Äù Fridays at different venues including the beach in the summertime.
We have an onsite Doctor and medical team for our employees, including services such as: nutrition, physiotherapy and general health.
Free printing Happy hour ‚Äì from photographs to large posters. And Hands-on‚ÄØworkshops‚ÄØto print with the latest technology ‚Äì from wall covers to 3D printed models.


Sounds like you? Please apply and let‚Äôs talk!

Title: Analista de datos (M/H)
Description:

Title: Supply Chain Data Analyst
Description:
Job description: The Opportunity

¬†

The Global Inventory Analyst oversees the projection, analysis, and tracking of stock levels in different distribution hubs.¬†This position guarantees that products are available while reducing surplus inventory.¬†The analyst works together with demand planning, supply planning, purchasing, finance, and local markets to create and implement inventory plans that align with business goals and business activities.

¬†

What you'll get to do

¬†Create and uphold predictions for stock levels, considering expected demand, seasonal trends, and limitations in the supply chain.

Monitor global inventory levels to ensure optimal stock availability and safety stock policies across all locations.
Identify and mitigate risks of overstocking, understocking, or stock obsolescence.¬†
Analyze inventory trends and key performance metrics such as turnover rates, fill rates, and stock aging.
Generate and maintain dashboards to support strategic decision-making.
Work together with the teams responsible for demand, production, and procurement to ensure inventory levels match sales predictions.
Actively collaborate in the global budget creation for the upcoming year. ¬†
Identify opportunities to improve inventory processes and apply effective methods.
Work on continuous improvement initiatives to streamline inventory.

¬†

¬†

We'd love to meet you if you have

¬†

Qualifications & Skills:

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in engineering, Supply Chain Management, Business, Logistics, or a related field.
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple priorities.
3+ years of experience in inventory management, supply chain analysis, or a similar role (preferably in a global setting).
Experience with ERP systems (SAP, Oracle, or similar) and inventory management software.
Mandatory expertise in data analytics tools (Excel, Power BI, SQL, etc.)¬†
Proficiency in English.¬†
Finance knowledge is a plus.¬†

¬†

Competences:

Drive for Results
Analytical skills
Connect, Collaborate & Cooperate
Proactivity¬†
A few things you'll love about us
An entrepreneurial, creative and welcoming work culture
A range of learning and development opportunities
An international company with plenty of opportunities to grow
A competitive compensation & benefits package
Show more
HTML:
Job description: The Opportunity

 

The Global Inventory Analyst oversees the projection, analysis, and tracking of stock levels in different distribution hubs. This position guarantees that products are available while reducing surplus inventory. The analyst works together with demand planning, supply planning, purchasing, finance, and local markets to create and implement inventory plans that align with business goals and business activities.

 

What you'll get to do

 Create and uphold predictions for stock levels, considering expected demand, seasonal trends, and limitations in the supply chain.

  • Monitor global inventory levels to ensure optimal stock availability and safety stock policies across all locations.
  • Identify and mitigate risks of overstocking, understocking, or stock obsolescence. 
  • Analyze inventory trends and key performance metrics such as turnover rates, fill rates, and stock aging.
  • Generate and maintain dashboards to support strategic decision-making.
  • Work together with the teams responsible for demand, production, and procurement to ensure inventory levels match sales predictions.
  • Actively collaborate in the global budget creation for the upcoming year.  
  • Identify opportunities to improve inventory processes and apply effective methods.
  • Work on continuous improvement initiatives to streamline inventory.

 

 

We'd love to meet you if you have

 

Qualifications & Skills:

  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in engineering, Supply Chain Management, Business, Logistics, or a related field.
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple priorities.
  • 3+ years of experience in inventory management, supply chain analysis, or a similar role (preferably in a global setting).
  • Experience with ERP systems (SAP, Oracle, or similar) and inventory management software.
  • Mandatory expertise in data analytics tools (Excel, Power BI, SQL, etc.) 
  • Proficiency in English. 
  • Finance knowledge is a plus. 

 

Competences:

  • Drive for Results
  • Analytical skills
  • Connect, Collaborate & Cooperate
  • Proactivity 
A few things you'll love about us
  • An entrepreneurial, creative and welcoming work culture
  • A range of learning and development opportunities
  • An international company with plenty of opportunities to grow
  • A competitive compensation & benefits package

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Senior Data Analysts at Thoughtworks collect, process and analyze large datasets to provide valuable insights and support informed decision-making for our clients. They are responsible for the strategy, implementation, productionization and articulation of business impact. They collaborate with cross-functional teams and communicate findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders. They stay up-to-date with industry advancements, ensure data quality and security, and actively mentor other Thoughtworkers, fostering a culture of continuous learning and professional development.

Job responsibilities


You will perform data extraction and modeling to generate insights and make recommendations for the business.
You will support the definition and construction of KPIs that best represent the business performance of our clients, assisting in decision-making processes.
You will work on the development and maintenance of strategic dashboards, reports and KPIs.
You will use storytelling practices for effective dashboard construction.
You will build solutions and validate hypotheses through comprehensive data analysis.
You will design, conduct and measure both qualitative and quantitative research.
You will create proposals and conduct A/B tests.
You will conduct ad-hoc studies as needed.
You will connect with stakeholders to understand database structures, apply necessary business rules and share analysis methods and methodologies.



Job Qualifications

Technical Skills


You have expertise with Tableau as a self-service BI tool.
You have experience in analytics and business intelligence projects.
You have proficiency in Excel or Google Sheets.
You have strong data visualization practices with relevant tools.
You have proficiency in database management, either relational or non-relational.
You have advanced knowledge in SQL and Python.
You have ability to clean, prepare and analyze big data, both structured and unstructured.
You have exploratory, qualitative and quantitative analysis skills.
You have experience with research techniques and satisfaction indicators.
You have ability to identify patterns, actionable insights and relationships in data.



Professional Skills


You have great stakeholder management skills and you are able to build rapport and gain buy-in from clients and key stakeholders.
You are a great problem solver, thrive in ambiguity, tackle challenges from various angles and embrace risk management.
You have a data-driven approach, seeking opportunities to leverage data for efficiency and value, and actively collaborate to drive data-based decisions.
You are a great communicator and have the ability to present findings to technical and non-technical audiences.
You are a team player and actively collaborate with colleagues and other teams.
You are eager to coach, mentor and motivate others and you aspire to influence teammates to take positive action and accountability for their work.
English and Spanish communication and relationship building skills ‚Äì written, verbal, facilitation, etc, are a must.



Other things to know

Learning & Development

There is no one-size-fits-all career path at Thoughtworks: however you want to develop your career is entirely up to you. But we also balance autonomy with the strength of our cultivation culture. This means your career is supported by interactive tools, numerous development programs and teammates who want to help you grow. We see value in helping each other be our best and that extends to empowering our employees in their career journeys.

About Thoughtworks

Thoughtworks is a dynamic and inclusive community of bright and supportive colleagues who are revolutionizing tech. As a leading technology consultancy, we‚Äôre pushing boundaries through our purposeful and impactful work. For 30+ years, we‚Äôve delivered extraordinary impact together with our clients by helping them solve complex business problems with technology as the differentiator. Bring your brilliant expertise and commitment for continuous learning to Thoughtworks. Together, let‚Äôs be extraordinary.


Show more
