HTML:
If you‚Äôre here, it‚Äôs because you‚Äôre looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We‚Äôll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 25 countries.

Together we revolutionise the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

ü§ù Our culture and strong values.

  • We have an ‚Äò‚Äôoffice-first‚Äô‚Äô culture and we place collaboration at the center of everything we do!
  • We have a non-vanilla personality and feedback mindset. We don‚Äôt shy away from difficult conversations - we see them as a gift!
  • We work with high intensity and have fun along the way. We also celebrate the wins (a lot!).
  • We celebrate diversity in all its forms and foster an inclusive culture where everyone can bring their authentic selves to work.

üí™Our career development philosophy.

  • We are building a talent house of high performing teams and leaders. We invest in people who raise the bar and help others reach their full potential.
  • We take ownership of our career development. We don‚Äôt believe in linear and predictable career paths - we create the job of our dreams!
  • We embrace opportunities to move the needle and make an impact beyond our scope.

ü§ùOur commitment to being a force for good.

  • Our platform is an important economic tool for millions of people (customers, partners, couriers) and we are taking action to amplify our positive impact.
  • We invest in doing good by dedicating time and resources into social and environmental initiatives.
  • We have the ambition of being DIB role models across the tech industry. We are creating environments, systems, and processes that provide equal opportunities, break biases, and empower our communities.

We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

YOUR MISSION

Glovo is looking for a Data Operations Intern to join our regional team in Barcelona, supporting operations across the Africa Region, specifically in Morocco, Tunisia, Ivory Coast, Uganda, Nigeria, and Kenya. Are you passionate, proactive, data-driven, and hands-on? Do you want to evolve into one of the fastest-growing startups in Europe, building a product that will change people's day-to-day lives and disrupt the on-demand market?

THE JOURNEY

  • Analyze data generated by our core operations across multiple African markets to improve the experience of our key stakeholders (Couriers, Users, and Partners).
  • Provide data-driven insights to enhance key performance indicators (KPIs) across supported countries, such as delivery times, cancellations, efficiency, and cross-departmental projects.
  • Proactively identify inefficiencies, analyze root causes, and propose actionable, data-driven solutions tailored to regional needs.
  • Standardize and optimize processes to drive operational efficiency in our African markets.
  • Track KPIs, manage scheduling, attendance, and general administration of Info-Sessions, while supporting daily operations through operational supervision and data analysis.
  • Collaborate closely with local Operations Managers in each supported country to streamline customer support processes and enhance overall operations.
  • Work cross-functionally with other departments to monitor and implement structural process optimizations within the Africa Region.
  • Bring your most innovative ideas to life and make an immediate impact by thinking outside the box!

What You Will Bring To The Ride

    • Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Mathematics, or any technological field.
    • Passion for analytics: you enjoy deep-diving into problems to uncover root causes and drive improvements.
    • Strong problem-solving skills: no challenge is too big or small.
    • Proficiency in Excel.
    • Experience in SQL is a must.
    • Professional-level English (French is a plus given the regional scope).
    • An empathetic, inclusive, and curious attitude.
Individuals from diverse backgrounds, genders, and ethnicities may hesitate to apply if they don't meet 100% of the listed criteria. Don‚Äôt let that stop you! We are all about finding the best talent‚Äîskills can be learned, and diversity is a key strength.

We Believe Driven Talent Deserves

  • üçî Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
  • üèä Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
  • üèñÔ∏è Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
  • üß† Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.

Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

Title: Procurement Data Analyst
Place: Sant Cugat del Vall√®s, Catalonia, Spain
Description:
Would you like to join an international team working to improve the future of healthcare? Do you want to enhance the lives of millions of people? Grifols is a global healthcare company that since 1909 has been working to improve the health and well-being of people around the world. We are leaders in plasma-derived medicines and transfusion medicine and develop, produce and market innovative medicines, solutions and services in more than 110 countries and regions.

We believe that diversity adds value to our business, our teams and our culture. We are committed to equal employment opportunities that foster an inclusive environment.

The Procurement Excellence Technician supports the implementation and maintenance of procurement excellence initiatives. This role involves executing day-to-day procurement activities, ensuring compliance with established processes, and providing support to the procurement team..

What Your Responsibilities Will Be


Support procurement excellence initiatives.
Execute daily procurement activities.
Ensure compliance with established processes.
Provide support to the procurement team.
Maintain procurement records and documentation.
Assist with supplier evaluations and performance tracking.
Support the implementation of procurement software and tools.
Conduct routine audits of procurement processes.
Assist in the preparation of procurement reports and presentations.
Support contract management and negotiation activities.
Engage with suppliers to resolve any issues or discrepancies.



Functions And Tasks


Assist in the implementation of procurement initiatives.
Maintain records and documentation for procurement activities.
Ensure adherence to procurement policies and procedures.
Support the procurement team with data and analysis.
Coordinate with suppliers to resolve any issues or discrepancies.
Conduct basic market research to support procurement decisions.
Prepare procurement reports and summaries for management.
Assist in the development and maintenance of procurement databases.
Ensure compliance with ethical standards in procurement practices.
Provide administrative support to the procurement team.
Collaborate with IT for procurement systems implementation and maintenance.
Assist in developing training materials and conducting training sessions.
Monitor and track procurement performance metrics.
Ensure timely and accurate processing of procurement transactions.



Who You Are

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skills, education, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions).


Bachelor‚Äôs degree or relevant certification in Business, Supply Chain Management, or a related field.
Minimum of 2 years of experience in procurement or a related field.
Knowledge of procurement processes and best practices.
Strong attention to detail and organizational skills.
Good communication and team collaboration abilities..
Ability to multitask and manage multiple priorities.
Basic understanding of market research techniques.
Experience with supplier evaluation and performance tracking.
Knowledge of ethical standards in procurement practices.
Willingness to travel as required for supplier visits and training.
Good problem-solving skills and the ability to handle conflict effectively.
Ability to work under pressure and meet tight deadlines.
Experience with data analysis and reporting.
Strong organizational and time management skills.



What We Offer

It is a brilliant opportunity for you, Grifols is fully aware that its employees are one of its major assets. We are committed to maintaining an atmosphere that encourages all our employees to develop their professional careers in an excellent working environment.

Information about Grifols is available at www.grifols.com. If you are interested in joining our company and you have what it takes for such an exciting position, then don‚Äôt hesitate to apply!

We look forward to receiving your application!

Grifols is an equal opportunity employer.

Flexibility for U Program: Hybrid Model

Flexible schedule: Monday-Thursday 7-10 to 16-19h and Friday 8-15h.

Benefits Package

Contract of Employment: Permanent position

Location:

www.grifols.com

Third Party Agency And Recruiter Notice

Agencies that present a candidate to Grifols must have an active, nonexpired, Grifols Agency Master Services Agreement with the Grifols Talent Acquisition Department. Additionally, agencies may only submit candidates to positions that they have been engaged to work on by a Grifols Recruiter. All resumes must be sent to a Grifols Recruiter under these terms or they will be considered a Grifols candidate.

Grifols provides equal employment opportunities to applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other characteristic or status protected by law. We will consider for employment all qualified Applicants in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable state and local laws.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Your mission is to support the business to take data informed decisions through actionable insights and to develop the data culture aligned with Bobst vision

In this position you will be part of the Purchasing team and key for our digitalization journey. The position is based in Barcelona, Spain. The team‚Äôs mission is to support the business to take data informed decisions and to develop the data culture aligned with Bobst vision. You will be responsible for translating data into valuable information and actionable recommendations for the business directly reporting to the business intelligence. You will design, develop, and maintain decision-making systems, dashboards, performance measurement and reporting solutions

Main Responsibilities


Design and development of tools, KPI reports and dashboards for all business areas
Maintain accurate and reliable data, clearly defined KPI and single source of truth approach
Ability to develop data-driven solution by using machine learning model, Python/R
Support the Purchasing team to maintain new state of the art business intelligence tools
Create a great user experience through easy to use and visual appealing dashboards
Perform analysis of user needs, be a force of proposition during continuous improvement workshops
Drive collaboration with other departments and sharing knowledge to users
Structure the document Library of the department and maintain the internal portal


Education

B.Sc. or MSc in Computer Science, Data Analytics, Business Intelligence, or a related field

Experience Required

At least 3 years of professional experience in Business Analysis with Purchasing and/or supply Chain exposure

Specific knowledge

Proven track record of leading and implementing change management projects for an international organization

IT / Computer knowledge

Analytical approach with command of MS Office and BI Tools (esp. Tableau Desktop, Tableau prep or similar software)

Experience with SQL, Python/R and Machine leaning model

Good knowledge of ERP SAP ECC & SAP S4 Hana and Supplier Relationship Manager system (Jaggaer, Ariba, Coupa‚Ä¶)

Languages Capabilities

Fluent in English, other languages are beneficial

Personal Skills (behavior, Mindset)

Excellent communication, negotiation and problem-solving capabilities paired with ability to network and establish strong relationships.

As Business Analyst

You have an Business Intelligence background, together with sound purchasing or supply chain experience with preferably 3 years of proven track record in a similar function in an industrial environment (machines‚Äô industry or similar)

You have successful experience in a similar position in industry in international environment.

You have the ability to cope in a matrix organization with different stakeholder in a multinational company.

You are self-confident and trustworthy personality with intercultural affinity.

You are a good communicator, and you strongly perform in teams

Show initiative, just do it attitude.

Ability to deal with ambiguity.

You have a structured and analytical mind-set enabling you to efficiently drive and implement various projects simultaneously

For more than 130 years, and over 50 countries, BOBST has always been at the forefront of innovation and we want to accelerate connectivity, digitalization, automation and sustainability to make packaging better than ever.

BOBST is one of the world‚Äôs leading suppliers of equipment and services to packaging and label manufacturers in the folding carton, corrugated board and flexible materials industries. Join our highly qualified staff and together, let‚Äôs shape the future of the packaging world.

Title: Lead Data Analyst - Permanent contract - Barcelona
Description:
This year marks 10 years since we launched the idea that simplifying our customers' lives is possible by offering an innovative solution that allows them to easily subscribe to, manage, and switch all types of contracts through a unique and intuitive platform.

In that time, we have supported more than 1.5 million customers in France, Spain, and Italy, while investing in new verticals and positioning ourselves as a highly efficient, innovative, and competitive scale-up in a rapidly growing market.

With over 900 employees across 3 locations, we are solidifying our position as a market leader in Europe. We are always on the lookout for talent ready to join a dedicated and motivated team driven by a meaningful project. Working with us means embracing a culture of excellence, innovation, and real impact.

At papernest, Business is the heart of what we do and that's how we organize our data team.¬†As a Lead Data Analyst, you'll be a member of the data partnerships team, helping the B2B2C - SMB business unit to improve its performance using the right data.

At Partnerships Analytics, we :

Aim at improving the efficiency and the profitability of the partnerships business unit
Organize the data pipeline around teams and employees, agencies and partners, and leads, so we can easily understand the performance and set up more complex analysis.
Analyze and model the behavior of our partners, developing forecasting models and business plans.
Provide alerting and visual tools such as dashboards to make strategic analysis easy.
Study our sales force, helping designing their structure, analyzing their performance
They analyze and optimize B2B2C lead performance, leveraging product, operations, and CRM data to improve the P&L of the business unit.
Your role :

You‚Äôll provide data and analysis for the sales SMB team, helping to improve the efficiency and profitability of a team of more than 150 people.
You‚Äôll work in a challenging, dynamic and rewarding work environment, your coworkers are brilliant and will make you better. A lot of responsibilities: supported, not micromanaged, you'll manage a team of 2 data analysts
You'll work with a lot of stakeholders (Sales Team, Ops team, other data analysts, Data Engineers, product, etc.)


Project examples :


Help to build and track SMB business plan for a several million euro budget
Sales volume forecasting, based on our staffing and past efficiency
Datamarts and dashboards to provide the right information at the right moment.
Scoring models of partners, customers, and workforce
GenAI speech and sales analytics
Churn Models
Ad-hoc analysis to measure and guide business initiatives
Responsible for data reliability and consistency in all phases, transformation, aggregation, and exposure through tables, dashboards and, sheets
Refactoring of dashboard and the data pipeline


Our data stack is modern and you'll get to use tools for :


Complex SQL (BigQuery)
Data pipeline (dbt)
Git
Github
Data visualization (Looker Studio)
ML (Python, ML FLow, Vertex AI)
GenAI (Gemini et open AI)

Your profile :¬†

Required:


3+ years of experience in a demanding environment, in a position combining business and analytical skills
3+ years of experience in data modeling and data visualization
Business or engineering school
SQL proficiency
Looking for impacting the business, persistent and with good prioritization skills
Fluent in English

Preferred :


Fluency in Spanish or French
Previous management experience of a small team
Double track Engineering/Business
Experience with BigQuery and DBT
Previous experience with a large sales or operations team
Past experience in project management, or in management consulting

What we offer :

Thrive in an international and inclusive environment: everyone has a place at papernest. With over 46 different nationalities, it‚Äôs not uncommon here to start a sentence in English and finish it en fran√ßais or en espa√±ol ¬°


üí∏¬†Compensation: a plan for Subscription Warrants for Company Creators (BSPCE) in accordance with company regulations, as well as a Pluxee card to manage your tax level through a voluntary compensation system across different services (transportation, dining, and childcare).

üèÜ¬†Benefits: as a home insurance provider and a supplier of green electricity and gas, we offer attractive deals to our employees. After all, there‚Äôs no reason why things should only be simpler for our customers!

ü©∫¬†Health: medical insurance through Alan or Sanitas to manage your healthcare expenses in an ultra-simple, paperless way, with up to 50% coverage by papernest (after 6 months in the company).

üçΩÔ∏è¬†Meals & partnerships: a healthy breakfast offered every Tuesday, as well as partnerships with various services in Barcelona (restaurants, sports, leisure, and care centers).

üìö¬†Training: the development of our employees is essential. You will have access to ongoing training tailored to your goals, whether it involves technical, language, or managerial skills.

üìà¬†Career Development: numerous opportunities are available for you to grow, whether by deepening your expertise or exploring new paths. We support you in your professional ambitions.

‚ú®¬†Remote Work: enjoy 2 days of remote work per week to optimize your focus and efficiency.


Hiring process:
1st call with Juliette,¬†Talent Acquisition Specialist
SQL Test

Interview with Hernan,¬†Data & Analytics Manager
Interview with Arthur, Head of Data
Interview with another person of the¬†Data Analyst¬†team


Interested in this challenge? üôÇ

Don‚Äôt hesitate any longer‚Äîwe look forward to meeting you! Regardless of your age, gender, background, religion, sexual orientation, or disability, there‚Äôs a place for you with us. Our selection processes are designed to be inclusive, and our work environment is adapted to everyone‚Äôs needs.

We particularly encourage applications from women. Even if you feel that you don‚Äôt meet all the criteria outlined in this job posting, please know that every application is valuable. We strongly believe that diverse and varied backgrounds enrich our team, and we will carefully consider your application. Parity and diversity are essential assets to our success.

Title: Working student Data & AI
Description:
Work Your Magic with us!

Ready to explore, break barriers, and discover more? We know you‚Äôve got big plans ‚Äì so do we! Our colleagues across the globe love innovating with science and technology to enrich people‚Äôs lives with our solutions in Healthcare, Life Science, and Electronics. Together, we dream big and are passionate about caring for our rich mix of people, customers, patients, and planet. That's why we are always looking for curious minds that see themselves imagining the unimaginable with us.

United As One for Patients, our purpose in Healthcare is to help create, improve and prolong lives. We develop medicines, intelligent devices and innovative technologies in therapeutic areas such as Oncology, Neurology and Fertility. Our teams work together across 6 continents with passion and relentless curiosity in order to help patients at every stage of life. Joining our Healthcare team is becoming part of a diverse, inclusive and flexible working culture, presenting great opportunities for personal development and career advancement across the globe.

Your role: Our team supports Healthcare R&D in its mission to bring more medicines to more patients faster. We transform business challenges into digital solutions by combining technical expertise with business understanding. With the growing importance of artificial intelligence for all parts of the research and development process, we are increasingly leveraging AI solutions, built on the cloud, for our business. As part of the team, you will support the definition, design and implementation of new cloud and data analytics solutions. A key focus area will be the use of generative AI solutions like generative pretrained transformers (GPT). With an increasing number of use cases already in production, we are pushing forward the boundaries of applying this innovative technology to improve R&D. This includes hands-on development in support of our team as well as collaborating with the business and other developers.

Who You Are


Pursuing a bachelor, master‚Äôs or PhD degree of Science in Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics or a similar field.
Curious problem solver who finds creative technical solutions to business problems.
Strong programming skills, especially Python including scikit learn.
First experience in cloud environments like AWS, GCP or Azure is helpful.
Basic experience in building Generative AI (GenAI) applications, such as fine-tuning or deploying large language models (LLMs), is beneficial.
Team player collaborating with the business, business architects and other developers. Your role: Our team supports Healthcare R&D in its mission to bring more medicines to more patients faster. First experience in building Generative AI (GenAI) applications, such as fine-tuning or deploying large language models (LLMs), is beneficial.
Team player collaborating with the business, business architects and other developers.


What we offer: We are curious minds that come from a broad range of backgrounds, perspectives, and life experiences. We celebrate all dimensions of diversity and believe that it drives excellence and innovation, strengthening our ability to lead in science and technology. We are committed to creating access and opportunities for all to develop and grow at your own pace. Join us in building a culture of inclusion and belonging that impacts millions and empowers everyone to work their magic and champion human progress!

Apply now and become a part of our diverse team!

Title: Digital Analyst - Hybrid
Description:
Digital Analyst - (Hybrid)

As you contemplate your future, you might be asking yourself, what‚Äôs the next step? Start your journey with us!

We're seeking an experienced Digital Analyst to join our Analytics & Insights Enabling team in Barcelona (hybrid) in order to work in the tracking and analytics area to provide support to all product areas and marketing channels to track performance and user behaviour and run different campaigns, implementing tags needed and configuring. If you're ready to soar, we're ready to take you there.

Why eDreams ODIGEO

Join the world's leading travel subscription platform and one of the largest e-commerce businesses in Europe.

21 million customers ‚Äì 44 markets ‚Äì 5 brands ‚Äì 6.5M members in Prime

More than 100 million searches per day - Up to 1.8 billion daily AI predictions

Over 1,600 employees ‚Äì More than 60 different nationalities from all continents

99% permanent contracts - 36 average age

We're the world‚Äôs leading travel subscription platform and one of the largest e-commerce businesses in Europe. We are a tech company revolutionizing the travel booking experience through our consumer insight, innovative technology, market leadership, and Prime, the world's first travel subscription program.

What you will do:

The Role's Key Responsibilities and Tasks

As an eDOer, you will have clear objectives, great challenges and a clear overview of how your work contributes to the global company project and its customers. As a Digital Analyst in the Analytics & Insights Enabling team, you will be in charge of:


Manage Web & App Analytics tools implementation such as Google Analytics but also others (Specifications, Maintenance and Improvement).
Data validation.
Marketing campaigns tags implementation through our Tag Management Systems and Server Tagging solutions.
Other tracking codes implementation, personalization, audit and issues solving.
Tech documentation and support for tracking and measurement purposes.



What you need to succeed:

Good to have

Bring your unique perspective, speak up, and offer disruptive solutions. You'll have the opportunity to learn and grow while making a real impact on our team. Here's what you need to succeed:


Bachelor degree in Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics or Business.
1-3 years of experience in web analytics and app analytics, tracking and data analysis.
Knowledge on Google Analytics and its implementation.
Knowledge on Firebase Analytics and its implementation.
Knowledge on App tracking and analytics.
Knowledge in tracking and Tag Management Systems (GTM, Tag Commander).
Javascript knowledge.
SQL knowledge.
Strong analytical capabilities.
Written and spoken English at an advanced level.
Detail-oriented and resolutive person, self-starter and team player.
Good troubleshooting/problem solving skills.
Passion for data, analysis, online marketing, internet and new technologies.
Good organization and time-management skills with the ability to work on several projects at the same time.
Python and GA data in Big Query analysis knowledge will be a plus.
Online Marketing knowledge (main KPIs, how each channel works, etc.) will be a plus.



What‚Äôs in it for you?

The best talent deserves the best benefits

At eDO, we want you to be a part of our success story and great culture. Here‚Äôs what we offer:


A rewarding Compensation package! üí• Prime Plus membership, Competitive salary and benefits package, including flexible benefits, birthday day off, discounts and partnerships, relocation support and the possibility of choosing your equipment and, even better, keeping it for free after 3 years.
Grow opportunities to empower your career, and unleash your potential! üöÄPersonalised career paths and the eVOLVE Program will help you discover, grow, and thrive. Internal mobility opportunities let you pursue horizontal career changes and promotions.
Your Well-being is our Priority. Embrace Freedom and Flexibility! üíôAt eDO, we value flexibility, employee care, and transparency. We offer a hybrid home-office model focused on outcome, not time-in-seat. You‚Äôll be able to find the right work-personal life balance that suits you best.
Work hard, party hard! We believe in having fun and connecting with colleagues! üéâ Join eDO for after-work events, padel tournaments, parties, and more. Create communities based on your passions, like sports and music. Come to work as you are, with no dress code, and enjoy free fruit, coffee, and tea at our offices.
Enjoy a dynamic and healthy environment! üí´Be innovative, take risks, and share your ideas. Our diverse and open-minded teams support high performance, learning, and growth. You‚Äôll work in an Agile Mindset environment with recognition at our core.



Wanna take a peek into what it‚Äôs like to work at eDO? Follow us on LinkedIn and discover more about life at eDO! If you are ready for a career opportunity with unmatched benefits, continuous learning, and a supportive work-life balance, look no further! Take your career to new destinations by applying now and help our diverse, inclusive, and passionate team shape the future of travel.

Apply now!

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status. Our people are the key of our success. Each one of them is unique in their own way and the respect for their uniqueness is and will always be a passion and motivation.

Title: Specialist, Tracking & Analytics Measurement ¬∑ Barcelona
Description:
Are you skilled in developing and implementing tracking and analytics solutions?

Would you like to work with large international clients and develop solutions that enable impactful, data-driven decisions?

Are you excited to collaborate across markets with a team of skilled colleagues?At s360 we are expanding our footprint with a new office in Barcelona, and now is your chance to play a key role in a startup-like environment while also benefiting from the support and stability of a +300-person organisation.Your key responsibilitiesYou will join our Measurement team, where you will play a crucial role in delivering and advising on tracking and analytics solutions for our clients.

In collaboration with the team, you will be responsible for developing and implementing durable measurement and tracking setups.More specifically, your responsibilities will include:Advising clients on how to obtain a durable measurement setup and driving proactive roadmapsConfiguration of e.g.

Google Analytics 4, Consent Mode, Enhanced Conversions, Conversion API, and Consent Management Platform (Cookiebot and Cookie Information)Planning and scoping new tracking and analytics projectsTesting, auditing, and ensuring the quality of tracking setupsDeveloping documentation and implementing both smaller and larger tracking setupsImplementing and adjusting conversion tracking/pixel across various channels and platformsDebugging and resolving ad hoc tracking issues.About your future teamYou will join our Measurement team who each day collaborate to make sure our clients succeed.

We strive to work closely on projects, complex cases, and troubleshooting while having fun and prioritising the social aspects of working together.

Staying ahead with the latest technologies and products is part of our DNA, ensuring our clients gain a competitive advantage through future-proof tracking setups.Moreover, as part of our new Barcelona team, you'll help building a collaborative environment.

You will shape the growth of our office and support a culture that thrives on innovation, teamwork, and a shared commitment to delivering exceptional results for our clients.Your profileYou have 2-3 years of hands-on experience within web tracking and analytics from a digital agency or an in-house role in a digital company.

You possess high professionalism and personal integrity and thrive in a fast-paced environment where we constantly strive to improve and create more value for our clients.Furthermore, you:Are familiar with working in Google Analytics and Google Tag ManagerHave general experience with e-commerce.Are comfortable explaining complex and technical concepts both verbally and in writing.Can communicate in English with colleagues and external stakeholders from various markets.Are a problem-solver, unafraid of tackling challenging tasksAre detail-oriented and structured, taking pride in delivering thorough solutionsHave a direct and open communication style, and you are comfortable with giving and receiving constructive feedbackAppreciate collaborative sparring and knowledge-sharing within the team, coupled with the ability to work independently and manage tasks in a structured mannerKnowledge of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, as well as experience setting up tracking for Shopify and similar CMS platforms, is an advantage but not a requirement.Note: You must be eligible to work in Spain and the EU without requiring sponsorship.What we offerYou will be a part of a strong team with some of the industry's top specialists who all strive to ensure that our next delivery is always better than before.

You will join an international team working with clients across the s360 group.Moreover, you will be a part of a company characterised by:A culture that is down-to-earth and full of constructive feedback and sparring that drives your personal and professional developmentFreedom under responsibility and flexible working hoursAmbitious and professional colleagues - who also like to have fun!Continuous learning and development opportunities to enhance your skills and advance your career.Social events like our MeetUp for all s360-employeesOur office in the popular Norrsken House Barcelona offers the city's best location with views of the beach and W-hotel, as well as many social and networking activities.We'd love to hear from you!Is this the right fit for you?

Then don't hesitate to apply or reach out to Andrej Plancic, Managing Director, at ****** review applications on an ongoing basis and hire as soon as the right candidate is found, so please send your CV and application as soon as possible.

All inquiries are treated confidentially.About s360s360 is a leading Northern European digital marketing agency that helps brands and retailers grow by providing a strong tech foundation, best-in-class execution, and deep industry expertise.

With a team of +300 digital specialists, s360 operates ten offices across seven countries: Denmark, Finland, Norway, Sweden, the United Kingdom, the Netherlands, and Spain.

In recent years, s360 has been recognised with numerous national and European awards, making it one of Europe's most award-winning digital marketing agencies.

Title: Data Analyst Tax, Global Tax Services
Description:
Description

The Data Analyst improves VAT Compliance reporting and data accuracy for Global Tax Services to reflect legislative and business change. In this role, you will work closely with indirect tax compliance customers and internal tech partners to support complex data solutions underpinning Amazon's indirect tax reporting in EMEA. As a Data Analyst, you will be expected to have solid data management experience, strong skills data querying skills and understanding of tax and accounting principles to support indirect tax compliance teams in EMEA.

Key job responsibilities


Investigating and resolving data quality issues
Defining technical requirements based on data analysis
Performing user testing on new system builds
Using Excel, SQL, Alteryx for reporting, auditing and analysis
Building relationships with key tech partners and business teams
Identifying process gaps and improvements
Escalating technical/operational issues appropriately
Clearly explaining financial concepts and analysis to stakeholders
Translating business objectives into actionable analyses
Leading medium to large projects end-to-end, including establishing timelines, priorities, resource allocation, and keeping stakeholders informed of status and obstacles


About The Team

The Global Tax Services (GTS) team aims to provide scalable, innovative indirect tax data solutions that increase efficiency and reliability. By implementing robust data management standards, we seek to reduce manual work while ensuring stability. Our focus is on delivering exceptional customer service and long-term value through solutions that enable operational scale.

Basic Qualifications


Experience in tax, finance or a related analytical field
Experience in Excel (including VBA, pivot tables, array functions, power pivots, etc.) and data visualization tools such as Tableau
Experience in business or financial analysis
Experience defining requirements and using data and metrics to draw business insights
Experience with Excel
Experience with SQL
Experience making business recommendations and influencing stakeholders


Preferred Qualifications


Excellent communication skills; detail-oriented
3+ year experience in data analytics, business intelligence, tax, or finance
Bachelor‚Äôs degree


Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you‚Äôre applying in isn‚Äôt listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Talan is an international advisory group on innovation and transformation through technology, with 5000 employees, and a turnover of 600M‚Ç¨.

We offer our customers a continuum of services to support you at each key stage of your organization's transformation, with 4 main activities:



CONSULTING in management and innovation : supporting business, managerial, cultural, and technological transformations.
DATA & TECHNOLOGY to implement major transformation projects.
CLOUD & APPLICATION SERVICES to build or integrate software solutions.
SERVICE CENTERS of EXCELLENCE to support the latter through technology, innovation, agility, sustainability of skills and cost optimization.



Talan accelerates it's clients' transformation through innovation and technology. By understanding their challenges, with our support, innovation, technology and data, we enable them to be more efficient and resilient.



We believe that only a human oriented-practice of technology will make the new digital age an era of progress for all. Together let's commit!




Job Description


For our client's project, one of the largest banks in Spain, we are looking for a Data Analyst for Reconciliation to join our consultancy team. The ideal candidate will have strong experience in data analysis, backend processing, and reporting tools within an Agile environment.



What would you be doing?








Extract, process, and analyze large datasets to support reconciliation processes.




Develop and maintain data pipelines using Python and PySpark.




Create insightful reports and dashboards with QlikSense or Power BI.




Collaborate with cross-functional teams in an Agile environment (Scrum/Kanban).




Ensure data accuracy and quality while optimizing processes.







Qualifications


What we are looking for?




Education: Bachelor‚Äôs degree or equivalent in a related field.




Experience: Minimum of 2 years as a Data Analyst in Delivery projects.




Technical Skills:




Strong proficiency in Python and PySpark for data processing.




Experience with QlikSense or Power BI for data visualization.




Familiarity with Agile methodologies (Scrum/Kanban).






Language: Intermediate English (B2 level).







Additional Information


What do we offer you?



Full-time contract
Smart Office Pack so that you can work comfortably from home.
Training and career development
Benefits and perks such as private medical insurance, life insurance, lunch and travel cards as part of the flexible remuneration package
Possibility to be part of a multicultural team and work on international projects
Hibrid position based in M√°laga, Spain. Realocation is mandatory
Possibility to manage work-permits.



If you are passionate about development & tech, we want to meet you!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Talan is an international advisory group on innovation and transformation through technology, with 5000 employees, and a turnover of 600M‚Ç¨.

We offer our customers a continuum of services to support you at each key stage of your organization's transformation, with 4 main activities:



CONSULTING in management and innovation : supporting business, managerial, cultural, and technological transformations.
DATA & TECHNOLOGY to implement major transformation projects.
CLOUD & APPLICATION SERVICES to build or integrate software solutions.
SERVICE CENTERS of EXCELLENCE to support the latter through technology, innovation, agility, sustainability of skills and cost optimization.



Talan accelerates it's clients' transformation through innovation and technology. By understanding their challenges, with our support, innovation, technology and data, we enable them to be more efficient and resilient.



We believe that only a human oriented-practice of technology will make the new digital age an era of progress for all. Together let's commit!




Job Description


For our client's project, one of the largest banks in Spain, we are looking for a Data Analyst for Reconciliation to join our consultancy team. The ideal candidate will have strong experience in data analysis, backend processing, and reporting tools within an Agile environment.



What would you be doing?








Extract, process, and analyze large datasets to support reconciliation processes.




Develop and maintain data pipelines using Python and PySpark.




Create insightful reports and dashboards with QlikSense or Power BI.




Collaborate with cross-functional teams in an Agile environment (Scrum/Kanban).




Ensure data accuracy and quality while optimizing processes.







Qualifications


What we are looking for?




Education: Bachelor‚Äôs degree or equivalent in a related field.




Experience: Minimum of 2 years as a Data Analyst in Delivery projects.




Technical Skills:




Strong proficiency in Python and PySpark for data processing.




Experience with QlikSense or Power BI for data visualization.




Familiarity with Agile methodologies (Scrum/Kanban).






Language: Intermediate English (B2 level).







Additional Information


What do we offer you?



Full-time contract
Smart Office Pack so that you can work comfortably from home.
Training and career development
Benefits and perks such as private medical insurance, life insurance, lunch and travel cards as part of the flexible remuneration package
Possibility to be part of a multicultural team and work on international projects
Hibrid position based in M√°laga, Spain. Realocation is mandatory
Possibility to manage work-permits.



If you are passionate about development & tech, we want to meet you!

Title: Data Analyst (Full remote within Spain)
Description:
We are seeking a skilled and experienced Data Analyst who is passionate about their work, adapts easily, and shares our company values!

The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of working on multiple deliverables in parallel, and be comfortable receiving reporting requirements and translating these into solutions. In addition to, prioritizing and communicating progress and blockers effectively.

Key Responsibilities:


Investigate, prioritise, and document anomalies
Use Excels skills to accomplish tasks of more complex nature (vlookups, pivot tables, IF conditions..)
Ensure data accuracy
Improve operations/processes for the team by identifying trends
Implement consumer data acquisition, e-commerce analytics and trigger-based marketing
Implement consumer analytics, consumer segmentation and profiling
Respond to data analysis requests from stakeholders and staff members
Retrieving data, cleaning and preparing data for analysis, performing data analysis, and uploading the information to various sources
Help with Daily, Weekly, Monthly & Annual reporting
Perform analysis on large data sets using appropriate data analysis techniques and tools with a strong focus on quality
Defining the data quality standards in the context of the specific initiatives
Maintain functional expertise in database analytics best practices and the tools that support them
Work with cross-functional teams such as engineering, product management, business intelligence to deploy data quality across critical pipelines and to set up processes to triage data issues
Create and optimise metrics and reporting functions to measure and monitor data quality for our most critical data assets
Effectively and timely communicate data quality insights and drive projects to improve data quality
Research data sources and make any corrections to existing data as needed to ensure accuracy of the information being recorded
Real time data analyst, monitoring and identifying performance drops using analytics tools to ensure timely resolution and maintain optimal product functionality.
Reviewing data control alerts, ensuring that processes operate effectively and efficiently, enabling proactive identification and resolution of data issues



Requirements

What will make you stand out from the crowd:


BA/BS in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, Business or analytical field.
Excellent judgement, critical-thinking, and decision-making skills
Extremely detailed oriented
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Strong analytical problem solving skill
Advanced Expertise in MS Excel and Google sheet required
Preferred knowledge/experience with Analytics Platform and SQL
Knowledge of Amplitude is nice to have., ideally with experience in international environments
Good knowledge of Amplitude is nice to have



Benefits

Perks of being one of us:


Top-notch private health insurance ‚Äî includes dental and psychological services
Full-time, permanent contract
Flexible time off, no blackout dates, plus your birthday, Christmas' Eve and New Year's Eve off
Remote work OR come into the office if you prefer!
Flextime (7 - 9:30 a.m. / 3:30 - 7:30 p.m)
Free Friday afternoons (a 7-hour workday!) + 35-hour week in July and August (free afternoons here we come!)
Enhanced career path designed just for you
External training budget
Other: ticket restaurant, nursery tickets
Budget for team-building activities
We celebrate all company landmarks
And when you come into the office, you'll get free coffee and snacks, fresh fruit, and can enjoy our game room and the cool terrace overlooking the Mediterranean



Sounds good? Apply now!

We're looking forward to getting to know you :)

Equal Employment Opportunity Employer

Leadtech is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Employer, which means we encourage applications from people with different backgrounds, interests, and personal circumstances. Our team welcomes applicants regardless of their race, gender, age, religion, nationality, sexual orientation, and/or disabilities. All we need is your high energy, skills, and willingness to be part of a great project!

Location

You'll have the flexibility to choose whether you'd like to come to the office every day, from time to time, or work fully remote. We want you to find the best combination for you.

If you prefer to be surrounded with amazing people, our exceptional office is in Barcelona's Blue Building, located right on the city's seafront. Besides our stunning views, you'll enjoy our office perks such as free fruit, snacks, and coffee and you'll also be able to take part in our Mario Kart and table tennis competitions.

The personal data you provide will be used to manage your candidacy for the corporate selection processes that fit your profile. If you wish, you can exercise your rights of access, rectification or cancellation by sending a letter to Avenida Litoral, 12-14, 5ta planta, Barcelona 08005, or emailing us at protecciondedatos@LeadTech.com, including a document that validates your identity.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Capitole Consulting is growing, and we want you to be part of it!

We are looking for a Tableau Data Analyst




Requirements:

Experience Level: minimum 2 years in an analytical role and proficiency in English.




Technical Skills:

Tableau proficiency: experience in creating dashboards and visualizations, including advanced features like calculated fields, parameters, and actions.
Strong SQL skills: ability to query, manage, and analyze large datasets.
Solid understanding of data structures, relational databases, and ETL processes.
Experience with scripting languages such as Python or R (a plus).
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.




Daily Responsibilities:

Use SQL to query databases, extract and prepare clean datasets for analysis and reporting.
Update and enhance Tableau dashboards to ensure accuracy, functionality, and relevance for stakeholders.
Generate and distribute automated reports, perform ad-hoc analyses, and provide data-driven insights to support business decisions.
Validate data accuracy in dashboards and reports, troubleshoot issues, and ensure reliability across all outputs.
Collaborate with teams to understand their data needs, provide insights, and deliver actionable recommendations.
Continuously refine SQL queries, Tableau workflows, and reporting processes while staying up to date with industry best practices and new tools.




Why Join Us?

We are amazing, but with you, we‚Äôll be even better! üòä

Benefits:

‚Ç¨1,200 training budget to use on tech events, books, certifications, or courses of your choice.
Monthly team check-ins for continuous feedback.
Flexible working hours to balance your professional and personal life.
Private health insurance, fully covered by Capitole.
Flexible compensation options (meal vouchers, transport, daycare).
Andjoy (Gymforless) membership.
Exclusive employee discounts at top brands through Club Capitole.

Team Culture & Social Perks:

Team buildings every two months ‚Äì don‚Äôt miss our Summer Party or Christmas Dinner!
Capitole-sponsored football team.
Tech communities to share knowledge and ideas across teams ‚Äì internal knowledge sharing is key! üòÉ

Want to know more about us?

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Who are we?

Passion, innovation and commitment are our values. If you love challenges and work in an international environment this is the opportunity for you!

Cooltra, European leader in sustainable mobility üõµ is looking for a Data Analyst to join our data team.




Data team

We are proud that we have created a safe space where people can learn, grow and, most importantly, have fun. We celebrate our successes and failures and view everything as an opportunity to learn and improve, with no blame attached. The data team ensures data quality and provides reports and analysis to the overall of the company: Product, Marketing, Operations, etc.




Functions and Responsibilities

Increase awareness about available data and democratize access to it across the company stakeholders.
Work collaboratively across all areas of our business to make the most of our data.
Effectively communicate clear recommendations and actionable insight from data to non-technical stakeholders.
Build engaging and interactive visualizations with BI tools.
Define and analyze main Cooltra KPIs.




Requirements

Degree in a quantitative discipline such as Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering or related fields
At least, 1 year of experience as a BI/Data Analyst.
Mandatory: live in Spain and have a C1 level of Spanish.
Strong SQL skills.
Experience preparing, consolidating and maintaining data models
Experience with building and maintaining data pipelines
BI tools expertise.




Bonus Points

Good skills to communicate with stakeholders effectively.
Knowledge of best practices for a Data Warehouse management.
Previous experience with tools such as Airflow, Airbyte or dbt.
Experience in Mobility, Energy or Automotive industry.
Excellent communication skills, both written and spoken.




What do we offer?

Enviable working environment be part of an international organisation that values diversity and collaboration.
Full-time and permanent contract: 40-hours working week (Mon-Fri)
Competitive fixed and variable remuneration.
Full remote.
Flexible remuneration: through Cobee, we adapt your remuneration to your real needs, reducing your taxes.
Day off on your birthday: celebrate your special day as you deserve and enjoy a well-deserved day off.
Health benefits: health insurance with a promotional price, so you can take care of you and your loved ones.
Exclusive discounts for Cooltra employees: enjoy a 50% discount on all Cooltra services.
Personal and professional growth: access training opportunities to enhance your career and skills.
Additional offers and discounts: multiple offers thanks to our partners in services such as gym, restaurants, etc.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are looking for a skilled and motivated Data Analyst to join our team. This role offers a dynamic environment where you will have the opportunity to work on diverse data analysis tasks, collaborate with international colleagues, and develop your skills within a growing organization.




ABOUT THE JOB

We are looking for a skilled and motivated Data Analyst to join our team. This role offers a dynamic environment where you will have the opportunity to work on diverse data analysis tasks, collaborate with international colleagues, and develop your skills within a growing organization




WHAT ARE YOU GOING TO DO AS A DATA ANALYST?

Collaborate daily with colleagues in Poland

Conduct both on-demand and scheduled data analyses

Create and maintain comprehensive reports

Organize and structure file systems effectively

Manage databases efficiently

Oversee internal and external data exchange processes

WHAT DO YOU BRING AS A DATA ANALYST?

Proficiency in Microsoft Excel with Power Add-ons

English language proficiency

Microsoft Access

Database management experience

University degree or ongoing studies in Mathematics, Business Analytics, Econometrics, or a related field

Travel Requirement: Visits to Poland at least four times a year (one week per visit)




ABOUT THE TEAM

If you are passionate about data, enjoy working in a collaborative environment, and seek opportunities for professional growth, we would love to hear from you!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Grupo Fertiberia is a major player in the plant nutrition sector in Europe and also produces environmental solutions for industry and other sectors. The company has 14 production centres spread across the Iberian Peninsula and France. Grupo Fertiberia¬¥s vision is to lead the green hydrogen value chain of the future in Europe to decarbonise agriculture and other sectors such as industry and transport, as well as to continue leading the development of sustainable solutions with high added value for crop nutrition. It is also the first company in its sector to commit to achieving zero net emissions by 2035.




The position will belong to Fertiberia Corporate and will be based in Madrid, with the possibility of occasional travel to one of the work centres of the group's companies.




We are looking for a Data Analyst reporting to the Data manager of de company. This person will be responsible for creating analysis, dashboards, and reports to support relevant decision-making by our Business Managers.




Key Responsibilities:




Learning and fully understanding the data landscape in databases.
Working closely with different stakeholders to identify their needs and gathering end user reporting and dashboard requirements.
Using and developing data from different areas.
Report and create different KPI‚Äôs.
Automatization of processes.
Supporting use of model outputs for decision making and insights.




Position requirements:




Education: Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business Administration, Management, or a related field. A Master‚Äôs degree or relevant certification is preferred.
Specific training in: Data Management Tools and Power BI (It is a must); Data pre-processing techniques and data optimization.
Experience: At least 2 years of experience working with a high volume of information and with different data sources. Experience working or ability to work with predefined deadlines.
Skills: Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities. Proficiency in project management software and tools.
Attributes: The candidate must be an analytical, dynamic, innovative, quick learner, autonomous person, with the ability to work in transversal teams and push projects.
English: C1 level
Computer tools: Excel; Power BI; Proficiency in Power Apps, Power Automate and RPA tools knowledge will be a plus.
Availability for immediate hiring
Willingness to travel occasionally




If you meet the requirements and consider yourself a person with initiative, results and internal customer oriented, this is your opportunity to join a leading group. Do not hesitate to apply! We are looking for you!




We are a company committed to Equality, Diversity, Inclusion, as well as personal and family balance. The selection process for this offer guarantees equal opportunities for all candidates without any distinction based on gender, disability, race, religion, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other characteristics protected by law.

  • Learning and fully understanding the data landscape in databases.
  • Working closely with different stakeholders to identify their needs and gathering end user reporting and dashboard requirements.
  • Using and developing data from different areas.
  • Report and create different KPI‚Äôs.
  • Automatization of processes.
  • Supporting use of model outputs for decision making and insights.


Position requirements:


  • Education: Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business Administration, Management, or a related field. A Master‚Äôs degree or relevant certification is preferred.
  • Specific training in: Data Management Tools and Power BI (It is a must); Data pre-processing techniques and data optimization.
  • Experience: At least 2 years of experience working with a high volume of information and with different data sources. Experience working or ability to work with predefined deadlines.
  • Skills: Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities. Proficiency in project management software and tools.
  • Attributes: The candidate must be an analytical, dynamic, innovative, quick learner, autonomous person, with the ability to work in transversal teams and push projects.
  • English: C1 level
  • Computer tools: Excel; Power BI; Proficiency in Power Apps, Power Automate and RPA tools knowledge will be a plus.
  • Availability for immediate hiring
  • Willingness to travel occasionally


If you meet the requirements and consider yourself a person with initiative, results and internal customer oriented, this is your opportunity to join a leading group. Do not hesitate to apply! We are looking for you!


We are a company committed to Equality, Diversity, Inclusion, as well as personal and family balance. The selection process for this offer guarantees equal opportunities for all candidates without any distinction based on gender, disability, race, religion, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other characteristics protected by law.

Title: Data Analyst (Finance)
Description:
About Revolut

People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, and more freedom. Since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. Our powerhouse of products ‚Äî including spending, saving, investing, exchanging, travelling, and more ‚Äî help our 50+ million customers get more from their money every day.

As we continue our lightning-fast growth,‚Äå 2 things are essential to our success: our people and our culture. In recognition of our outstanding employee experience, we've been certified as a Great Place to Work‚Ñ¢. So far, we have 10,000+ people working around the world, from our offices and remotely, to help us achieve our mission. And we're looking for more brilliant people. People who love building great products, redefining success, and turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.

About The Role

We approach Data Science at Revolut the same way that we approach everything else. We take complex problems, and create extraordinary solutions that our customers love. Our Data Analysts aren‚Äôt kept in the background, doomed to never see the impact of their work. They‚Äôre some of our best and brightest problem solvers, deployed to the front-lines to work in Product Teams and deliver rock star solutions.

We‚Äôre looking for a superstar Data Analysts who don't believe there's a data task that can be too hard. From digging into our complex databases, looking for the root cause of a problem to designing their own solutions and writing their own code to implement them. In this process they never stop learning, picking up new skills, and delivering value.

Up for the challenge? Get in touch.

What You‚Äôll Be Doing


Supporting the Finance team in controlling market products, including market making and treasury investments
Analysing and optimising financial control and treasury management activities
Understanding business processes through financial data and ensuring accuracy from booking to accounting
Developing Price Verification Models to ensure accurate valuation of financial products
Automating financial controls to improve efficiency and compliance
Designing and implementing reconciliation logic for balance accuracy
Creating and maintaining dashboards to track key financial metrics
Collaborating with Market Making, Treasury, and Financial Control teams to enhance reporting and decision-making


What You'll Need


5+ years of experience working with Data Analysis and creating impactful solutions
Ability to manage a team and stakeholders
Excellent background / education in a quantitative discipline
Great skills with Python, SQL, or other programming languages
Evidence of strong mathematical and statistics knowledge


Nice to have


Advanced degree in a core STEM subject
Previous experience working on a Finance department


Building a global financial super app isn‚Äôt enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that‚Äôs why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We‚Äôre doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That‚Äôs why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.

Important notice for candidates:

Job scams are on the rise. Please keep these guidelines in mind when applying for any open roles.


Only apply through official Revolut channels. We don‚Äôt use any third-party services or platforms for our recruitment.
Always double-check the emails you receive. Make sure all communications are being done through official Revolut emails, with an @revolut.com domain.


We won't ask for payment or personal financial information during the hiring process. If anyone does ask you for this, it‚Äôs a scam. Report it immediately.

By submitting this application, I confirm that all the information given by me in this application for employment and any additional documents attached hereto are true to the best of my knowledge and that I have not wilfully suppressed any material fact. I confirm I have disclosed if applicable any previous employment with Revolut. I accept that if any of the information given by me in this application is in any way false or incorrect, my application may be rejected, any offer of employment may be withdrawn or my employment with Revolut may be terminated summarily or I may be dismissed. By submitting this application, I agree that my personal data will be processed in accordance with Revolut's <a class="postings-link" href="https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates">Candidate Privacy Notice

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Our Organization

Dow Jones is a global provider of news and business information, delivering content to consumers and organizations around the world across multiple formats, including print, digital, mobile and live events. Dow Jones has produced unrivaled quality content for more than 130 years and today has one of the world's largest news-gathering operations globally. It is home to leading publications and products including the flagship Wall Street Journal, America's largest newspaper by paid circulation; Barron's, MarketWatch, Mansion Global, Financial News, Investor's Business Daily, Factiva, Dow Jones Risk & Compliance, Dow Jones Newswires, OPIS and Chemical Market Analytics. Dow Jones is a division of News Corp (Nasdaq: NWS, NWSA; ASX: NWS, NWSLV).

About The Team

Our Technology team drives the evolution of our Technology, Engineering, Data, Product and User Experience functions. With a keen focus on delivering cutting-edge solutions, we shape the digital landscape for our customers, readers, and users. From revolutionizing visuals to optimizing tools and harnessing the power of data, mobile, video, and social platforms, our team is committed to providing a seamless and immersive experience across all touchpoints. Collaborating closely with our newsrooms and strategic partners, we spearhead the development of groundbreaking products and technologies.

About The Role

The B2C Analytics team focuses on developing analytics solutions to help the organization make better data driven decisions. Our team is passionate about enabling others to use data and analysis to measure and monitor performance, identify risks and opportunities and find ways to continually add value.

You will primarily support the Consumer side of the business, which includes WSJ, Barron's, MarketWatch and more; but may also include exposure to other areas of the business, such as advertising and the professional information business. The ideal candidate will have previous experience in developing datasets, dashboards and data solutions that drive core insights. You will report to the Senior Manager, B2C Analytics.

You Will

Develop Stakeholder Partnerships


Develop strong partnerships with Product, Marketing, Newsroom, Finance, Data Collection, Data Engineering and other B2C Stakeholder Business teams and work across all levels and areas of the organization.
Executie data project roadmaps based on Business teams' priorities.


Understand B2C Data


Build a deep understanding of all the B2C data sources that we leverage in our Analysis projects
Partner with data engineers and data collection colleagues to collect, cleanse and organize data.


Conduct Analysis, Create Dashboards, Improve Processes & Ensure Quality


Analyze large datasets to surface trends and deliver recommendations with tangible business outcomes.
Create intuitive reports, dashboards and data solutions using visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, Looker Studio)
Continuously identify ways to improve and streamline processes around data and reporting
Ensure the quality of data and reporting, and partner with teams to improve accuracy and consistency


Clearly Communicate


Communicate technical information clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences


You Have


Team oriented and collaborative with eagerness to help others, and aspiration to be challenged and learn
Self starter able to work independently, coordinate with multiple partners and complete projects start to finish
Detail oriented with focus on assuring quality, consistency and accuracy in data and processes
Undergraduate degree or equivalent in combination of training and experience, preferably in a quantitative field such as Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or related disciplines.
Experience working with large datasets in a fast-paced and fluid environment with the ability to understand and solve complex non-routine problems.
Experience with SQL and strong knowledge of Excel/Sheets required. Familiarity with Github, Python/R preferred.
Experience with web analytics tools (particularly Google Analytics 4 and Adobe Analytics) is a plus.
Experience with data visualizations tools and techniques, and using data to tell a story (e.g. Tableau, Looker)


Our Benefits


Comprehensive Healthcare Plans
Paid Time Off
Retirement Plans
Comprehensive Insurance Plans
Lifestyle programs & Wellness Resources
Education Benefits
Family Care Benefits & Caregiving Support
Commuter Transit Program
Subscription Discounts
Employee Referral Program


\

Reasonable accommodation: Dow Jones, Making Careers Newsworthy - We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, age, national origin, disability status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. EEO/AA/M/F/Disabled/Vets. We strongly encourage applications from all qualified individuals, including women, people with disabilities, and those from underrepresented groups. Dow Jones is committed to providing reasonable accommodation for qualified individuals with disabilities, in our job application and/or interview process. If you need assistance or accommodation in completing your application, due to a disability, email us at talentresourceteam@dowjones.com. Please put "Reasonable Accommodation" in the subject line and provide a brief description of the type of assistance you need. This inbox will not be monitored for application status updates.

Business Area: Dow Jones - Data & AI

Job Category: Data Analytics/Warehousing & Business Intelligence

Union Status

Non-Union role

Since 1882, Dow Jones has been finding new ways to bring information to the world‚Äôs top business entities. Beginning as a niche news agency in an obscure Wall Street basement, Dow Jones has grown to be a worldwide news and information powerhouse, with prestigious brands including The Wall Street Journal, Dow Jones Newswires, Factiva, Barron‚Äôs, MarketWatch and Financial News.

This longevity and success is due to a relentless pursuit of accuracy, depth and innovation, enhanced by the wisdom of past experience and a solid grasp on the future ahead. More than its individual brands, Dow Jones is a modern gateway to intelligence, with innovative technology, advanced data feeds, integrated solutions, expert research, award-winning journalism and customizable apps and delivery systems to bring the information that matters most to customers, when and where they need it, every day.

Since 1882, Dow Jones has been finding new ways to bring information to the world‚Äôs top business entities. Beginning as a niche news agency in an obscure Wall Street basement, Dow Jones has grown to be a worldwide news and information powerhouse, with prestigious brands including The Wall Street Journal, Dow Jones Newswires, Factiva, Barron‚Äôs, MarketWatch and Financial News.

This longevity and success is due to a relentless pursuit of accuracy, depth and innovation, enhanced by the wisdom of past experience and a solid grasp on the future ahead. More than its individual brands, Dow Jones is a modern gateway to intelligence, with innovative technology, advanced data feeds, integrated solutions, expert research, award-winning journalism and customizable apps and delivery systems to bring the information that matters most to customers, when and where they need it, every day.

Req ID: 45363

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Do you want to change the world? At Cabify, that‚Äôs what we‚Äôre doing. We aim to make cities better places to live by improving mobility for the people living in them, connecting riders to drivers at the touch of a button. Maybe one day cities will be places where nobody needs a private car. But we‚Äôve still got a long way to go...fancy joining us?

About The Position

As a Data Analyst, you'll be part of an exceptional team of over 30 SQL and data visualization specialists. Our Data Analytics department is organized around 11 problem spaces that mirror the structure of the entire company, ensuring that every decision we make at Cabify is data-driven.

In your day-to-day role, you'll work in a multidisciplinary squad with other disciplines such as Product, Engineering, Growth, and Operations. We also follow agile methodologies within each analytics group and foster an environment of knowledge and resource sharing among the department.

If you're passionate about managing large volumes of data, you'll be delighted to know we leverage two different data warehouses, Google BigQuery and Amazon Redshift, to perform intensive analysis thus maximizing operational efficiency.

We take pride in working with one of the largest Tableau Server platforms in Europe, where we share not only powerful analysis and visualizations but also Self Service Data Sources, making data accessible to the entire company.

You Will

Work in technical data projects autonomously to enhance the company's analytics capabilities through functions such as:


Exploit large-scale data warehouses performing efficient SQL.
Define ETL models in our datawarehouse with Airflow.
Document and maintain your code and queries in Gitlab.
Create dashboards and reports using Tableau / PowerBI to communicate results and monitor KPIs regularly.
Execute exploratory analysis to shape future projects and provide action recommendations.
Present findings to squad team members to guide business and product decisions.
Work closely with engineers to define what data is needed for analysis, request creation of new app events, 3rd party integrations, collaborate in the data models design, granularity, and how they relate to existing models.
Help design new features alongside product managers and engineers, measuring their performance and testing their business impact.
Develop Data Sources to use across the organization, thus empowering business by exploring data in a trusted environment.


Our Ideal Candidate Has


Great alignment with our principles, we take this very seriously.
At least 1-2 years of working experience as a Data Analyst
Experienced in writing and understanding complex SQL and working with large data sets
Working knowledge of Tableau, Qlik, PowerBI, Looker, or any other data visualization tool
Graduate degree in Business Administration, Economics, Engineering, Statistics, or related fields
Fluency in English and Spanish


Bonus Points


A Master's degree in Business Analytics, Business Intelligence, or related
Product Analytics experience with Amplitude, Datadog, Mixpanel, or similar


What‚Äôs it like to work at Cabify?

We‚Äôre a Company Full Of Happy, Motivated People And We Never Want That To Change. Here Are Some More Reasons Why It Rocks To Be Part Of Our High-performance Team

‚åöHybrid Model (2 work-from-home days per week plus 6 weeks per year)

üí∂Excellent Salary conditions: L2 [30-40K‚Ç¨]
