Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Grupo Fertiberia is a major player in the plant nutrition sector in Europe and also produces environmental solutions for industry and other sectors. The company has 14 production centres spread across the Iberian Peninsula and France. Grupo Fertiberia¬¥s vision is to lead the green hydrogen value chain of the future in Europe to decarbonise agriculture and other sectors such as industry and transport, as well as to continue leading the development of sustainable solutions with high added value for crop nutrition. It is also the first company in its sector to commit to achieving zero net emissions by 2035.




The position will belong to Fertiberia Corporate and will be based in Madrid, with the possibility of occasional travel to one of the work centres of the group's companies.




We are looking for a Data Analyst reporting to the Data manager of de company. This person will be responsible for creating analysis, dashboards, and reports to support relevant decision-making by our Business Managers.




Key Responsibilities:




Learning and fully understanding the data landscape in databases.
Working closely with different stakeholders to identify their needs and gathering end user reporting and dashboard requirements.
Using and developing data from different areas.
Report and create different KPI‚Äôs.
Automatization of processes.
Supporting use of model outputs for decision making and insights.




Position requirements:




Education: Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business Administration, Management, or a related field. A Master‚Äôs degree or relevant certification is preferred.
Specific training in: Data Management Tools and Power BI (It is a must); Data pre-processing techniques and data optimization.
Experience: At least 2 years of experience working with a high volume of information and with different data sources. Experience working or ability to work with predefined deadlines.
Skills: Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities. Proficiency in project management software and tools.
Attributes: The candidate must be an analytical, dynamic, innovative, quick learner, autonomous person, with the ability to work in transversal teams and push projects.
English: C1 level
Computer tools: Excel; Power BI; Proficiency in Power Apps, Power Automate and RPA tools knowledge will be a plus.
Availability for immediate hiring
Willingness to travel occasionally




If you meet the requirements and consider yourself a person with initiative, results and internal customer oriented, this is your opportunity to join a leading group. Do not hesitate to apply! We are looking for you!




We are a company committed to Equality, Diversity, Inclusion, as well as personal and family balance. The selection process for this offer guarantees equal opportunities for all candidates without any distinction based on gender, disability, race, religion, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other characteristics protected by law.

Title: Business Data Analyst
HTML:
Are we the best-kept secret in M√°laga?

We like to think so. Over the past year, our M√°laga hub has grown into a thriving center of excellence, where we combine innovation, collaboration, and opportunity. We are serious about finding the right people and are confident that we have a lot to offer.


The role in a nutshell

Are you passionate about leveraging data to make meaningful business improvements? As a Business Data Analyst within the Coupa Global Reporting & Governance team, you will be instrumental in enabling datadriven decision-making and fostering continuous improvement. Your goal? To turn data insights into actionable strategies that enhance contract compliance, boost supplier performance, and streamline operational efficiency. In this role, you will collaborate closely with diverse stakeholders, acting as a vital link between business needs and technical capabilities. Your responsibilities will include gathering and validating business requirements, translating them into technical specifications, and ensuring user-friendly reporting solutions meet organizational goals. You will uphold best practices in data quality, work towards impactful reporting outcomes, and create a data-driven culture across our global Coupa landscape. With opportunities for growth in a stimulating and innovative environment, you will develop cost-saving initiatives, enhance business processes, and maintain compliance with audit requirements. If you thrive on advancing improvements through data and working in a collaborative global team, this role is your next career move!


More specifically, you will be expected to:

‚Ä¢ Analyze trends and patterns in Power BI reports to identify areas for improvement, such as contract compliance and supplier performance;

‚Ä¢ Monitor catalogue growth and drive initiatives to increase on-catalogue purchasing and reduce offcatalogue spend;

‚Ä¢ Evaluate purchasing trends to enhance contract compliance and support cost-saving strategies;

‚Ä¢ Track payment schedules to maximize early payment discounts and optimize cost efficiency;

‚Ä¢ Implement initiatives to reduce cycle times for requisitions, invoice processing, and supplier onboarding;

‚Ä¢ Advocate for electronic invoicing to improve accuracy and streamline processes;

‚Ä¢ Gather, validate, and document business requirements for reporting projects;

‚Ä¢ Support data standardization efforts to enhance reporting accuracy and consistency;

‚Ä¢ Act as a liaison between business stakeholders and technical teams to ensure reporting solutions align with strategic goals;

‚Ä¢ Develop training programs and user guides to empower end users in utilizing reports effectively


Do you have what it takes?

‚Ä¢ Skilled at interpreting data and providing actionable business insights;

‚Ä¢ Advanced skills in Power BI and Excel; SAP experience is beneficial.

‚Ä¢ Solid interpersonal and communication skills to engage with and collaborate efficiently across teams;

‚Ä¢ High accuracy and a focus on maintaining data quality in reporting outputs;

‚Ä¢ Quick to identify and address operational and technical issues;

‚Ä¢ Significant experience in increasing efficiencies and optimizing workflows;

‚Ä¢ Experience working across procurement, finance, or accounts payable functions;

‚Ä¢ Ability to develop and deliver clear training materials for diverse user groups.


Language : As you will be part of a global team, you are expected to communicate fluently in English (verbal and written). Knowledge of other languages such as French, German, or Spanish is favorable but not mandatory.


Travel: Some occasional travelling will be required.


Location: This role will ideally be based at our Malaga office, but we could consider other suitable locations


Wondering what‚Äôs in it for you?

üÜô Be part of a world class organization with a mandate to identify opportunities for improvement and drive performance benefits

üè† Hybrid Work

üí∞ Competitive compensation structure

üë®‚Äçüë©‚Äçüëß‚Äçüë¶ Health Insurance coverage for you and your dependents

üõü Life Insurance

üìà Growth Opportunities (career progression, tuition assistance, language courses, training and certifications, etc.)

üõ¨ Relocation assistance


If you are ready to join our diverse team, make a difference and advance your career in a global setting, we want to hear from you.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Our Organization

Dow Jones is a global provider of news and business information, delivering content to consumers and organizations around the world across multiple formats, including print, digital, mobile and live events. Dow Jones has produced unrivaled quality content for more than 130 years and today has one of the world's largest news-gathering operations globally. It is home to leading publications and products including the flagship Wall Street Journal, America's largest newspaper by paid circulation; Barron's, MarketWatch, Mansion Global, Financial News, Investor's Business Daily, Factiva, Dow Jones Risk & Compliance, Dow Jones Newswires, OPIS and Chemical Market Analytics. Dow Jones is a division of News Corp (Nasdaq: NWS, NWSA; ASX: NWS, NWSLV).

About The Team

Our Technology team drives the evolution of our Technology, Engineering, Data, Product and User Experience functions. With a keen focus on delivering cutting-edge solutions, we shape the digital landscape for our customers, readers, and users. From revolutionizing visuals to optimizing tools and harnessing the power of data, mobile, video, and social platforms, our team is committed to providing a seamless and immersive experience across all touchpoints. Collaborating closely with our newsrooms and strategic partners, we spearhead the development of groundbreaking products and technologies.

About The Role

The B2C Analytics team focuses on developing analytics solutions to help the organization make better data driven decisions. Our team is passionate about enabling others to use data and analysis to measure and monitor performance, identify risks and opportunities and find ways to continually add value.

You will primarily support the Consumer side of the business, which includes WSJ, Barron's, MarketWatch and more; but may also include exposure to other areas of the business, such as advertising and the professional information business. The ideal candidate will have previous experience in developing datasets, dashboards and data solutions that drive core insights. You will report to the Senior Manager, B2C Analytics.

You Will

Develop Stakeholder Partnerships


Develop strong partnerships with Product, Marketing, Newsroom, Finance, Data Collection, Data Engineering and other B2C Stakeholder Business teams and work across all levels and areas of the organization.
Executie data project roadmaps based on Business teams' priorities.


Understand B2C Data


Build a deep understanding of all the B2C data sources that we leverage in our Analysis projects
Partner with data engineers and data collection colleagues to collect, cleanse and organize data.


Conduct Analysis, Create Dashboards, Improve Processes & Ensure Quality


Analyze large datasets to surface trends and deliver recommendations with tangible business outcomes.
Create intuitive reports, dashboards and data solutions using visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, Looker Studio)
Continuously identify ways to improve and streamline processes around data and reporting
Ensure the quality of data and reporting, and partner with teams to improve accuracy and consistency


Clearly Communicate


Communicate technical information clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences


You Have


Team oriented and collaborative with eagerness to help others, and aspiration to be challenged and learn
Self starter able to work independently, coordinate with multiple partners and complete projects start to finish
Detail oriented with focus on assuring quality, consistency and accuracy in data and processes
Undergraduate degree or equivalent in combination of training and experience, preferably in a quantitative field such as Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or related disciplines.
Experience working with large datasets in a fast-paced and fluid environment with the ability to understand and solve complex non-routine problems.
Experience with SQL and strong knowledge of Excel/Sheets required. Familiarity with Github, Python/R preferred.
Experience with web analytics tools (particularly Google Analytics 4 and Adobe Analytics) is a plus.
Experience with data visualizations tools and techniques, and using data to tell a story (e.g. Tableau, Looker)


Our Benefits


Comprehensive Healthcare Plans
Paid Time Off
Retirement Plans
Comprehensive Insurance Plans
Lifestyle programs & Wellness Resources
Education Benefits
Family Care Benefits & Caregiving Support
Commuter Transit Program
Subscription Discounts
Employee Referral Program


\

Reasonable accommodation: Dow Jones, Making Careers Newsworthy - We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, age, national origin, disability status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. EEO/AA/M/F/Disabled/Vets. We strongly encourage applications from all qualified individuals, including women, people with disabilities, and those from underrepresented groups. Dow Jones is committed to providing reasonable accommodation for qualified individuals with disabilities, in our job application and/or interview process. If you need assistance or accommodation in completing your application, due to a disability, email us at talentresourceteam@dowjones.com. Please put "Reasonable Accommodation" in the subject line and provide a brief description of the type of assistance you need. This inbox will not be monitored for application status updates.

Business Area: Dow Jones - Data & AI

Job Category: Data Analytics/Warehousing & Business Intelligence

Union Status

Non-Union role

Since 1882, Dow Jones has been finding new ways to bring information to the world‚Äôs top business entities. Beginning as a niche news agency in an obscure Wall Street basement, Dow Jones has grown to be a worldwide news and information powerhouse, with prestigious brands including The Wall Street Journal, Dow Jones Newswires, Factiva, Barron‚Äôs, MarketWatch and Financial News.

This longevity and success is due to a relentless pursuit of accuracy, depth and innovation, enhanced by the wisdom of past experience and a solid grasp on the future ahead. More than its individual brands, Dow Jones is a modern gateway to intelligence, with innovative technology, advanced data feeds, integrated solutions, expert research, award-winning journalism and customizable apps and delivery systems to bring the information that matters most to customers, when and where they need it, every day.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you looking for the next challenge in your career? Would you like to be part of an exciting, highly qualified team of professionals in an international environment?




We are currently looking for a qualified Data Analyst.




Join an international division and work alongside some of the most talented engineers and technicians from all over the world.




Your benefits:

Competitive Salary.
Long-term secure contract.
International Project with top technologies.
Possibility of working remotely with a flexible schedule.
Integration in a highly qualified team of professionals.
Travel abroad with your project.
Specialized training and continuous professional development.
Social benefits and flexible compensation plan.




Responsibilities:




Analyze and interpret complex data sets to identify trends, patterns, and insights.
Develop and maintain data models, reports, and dashboards to support business decision-making.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand their data needs and provide actionable insights.
Ensure data quality and integrity by performing regular data validation and cleansing.
Stay up-to-date with the latest data analysis tools and techniques to continuously improve our data analytics capabilities.
Participate in the deployment of data solutions, all the way to production.
Ensure the quality of data analysis and reporting based on transparent metrics.
Act as a technical leader for data analysis, assisting and leading more junior analysts.




Requirements:




Minimum 3-5 years of experience in data analysis.
Proficiency in Python, SQL, and data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
Experience with CI/CD pipelines and working with Gitlab.
Experience working with Docker, Kubernetes, and microservices architectures is a plus.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.




We positively value all work or study experience abroad.

All positions require a high level of English (at least B2) - please send your detailed CV in English.

Title: Data Analyst(They/She/He)
Description:
If you‚Äôre here, it‚Äôs because you‚Äôre looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We‚Äôll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 25 countries.

Together we revolutionize the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

ü§ù Our culture and strong values.

üí™ Our career development philosophy.

ü§ù Our commitment to being a force for good.

We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

YOUR MISSION

Support the optimization of logistics features, with a focus on delivery areas and supply/demand imbalances, by maintaining and improving settings, quantifying their impact, providing data-driven insights, coordinating feature rollouts, and measuring their effectiveness.

THE JOURNEY


Work closely with local/regional stakeholders, product teams and development teams, serving as a bridge between product and operations, to define how to best set up and enable products, monitor and give visibility of metrics and KPIs.
Deep-dive on business metrics, in order to explore areas of opportunity and enable data-driven decision-making, based on applied statistics and probability techniques
Develop and maintain scalable and self-service visualization tools and storytelling dashboards.
Build optimization processes to define the best tuning of every feature on each geography.
Build robust relationships with stakeholders acting as a strategic and supportive link between the technology, business and product.
Support recurrent processes within the team, enabling the adjustment of tools to business needs
Continuously explore and refine key operational metrics (delivery time, efficiency, costs), gaining a comprehensive understanding of Glovo‚Äôs logistics.


What You Will Bring To The Ride


1-3 years of professional experience outside of an academic and internship setting, in a quantitative analysis role
Excellent SQL and Excel/GoogleSheet skills
Solid proficiency in statistical programming (Python/R) and experience working with popular tools such as Pandas, SciPy, Seaborn, Jupyter/iPython notebooks, R Markdown.
Knowledge of visualization tools like Tableau, Looker, PowerBI, ...
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
Great spoken and written English.


Individuals representing diverse profiles, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable


üí™ Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
üçî Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
üí≥ Cobee discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
üèä Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
üèñÔ∏è Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
üë™ Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
üß† Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.


Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
You‚Äôre an important part of our future.

Hopefully, we're also a part of yours! At B. Braun, we protect and improve the health of people worldwide. This is also our vision for IT. You see technology as an opportunity, and you develop solutions that secure our business in the long term, we would like to implement the digital transformation of B. Braun with you. With fresh ideas, drive and team spirit, we are working to launch the medical technology of tomorrow and safeguard the healthcare of the future. Together. That's Sharing Expertise.

Data Analyst

Reference Code ES-COJ-DOI-XXXXXX

From Barcelona, you will join Germany-based Corporate Start-Up B. Braun New Ventures, which is taking a leading role in the digital transformation of healthcare. With a young and fast-growing team, we develop solutions to automate medical procedures across various business areas. Our goal is to augment caregivers‚Äô decision-making with data-driven insights, predictive analytics, and AI-powered solutions. Our cloud platform team is focused on creating corporate-wide solutions that will drive the next generation of B. Braun‚Äôs digital products and connected devices. The technologies and products we develop create new treatment possibilities, enable sharing of clinical experience, and result in better patient care. From our Barcelona location, you will be integrated into an international team that collaborates to achieve these goals.

Duties and responsibilities


You collect, analyze, and interpret complex healthcare and operational data to derive actionable insights that drive business decisions.
You design, build, and optimize data pipelines and workflows using Databricks, SQL, and other relevant technologies.
You create dashboards and reports using visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau) to communicate findings effectively to stakeholders.
You collaborate closely with data engineers, cloud architects, product managers, and software developers to integrate analytics into digital products and cloud-based solutions.
You develop and implement statistical models, machine learning algorithms, and predictive analytics to enhance data-driven decision-making.
You ensure data integrity, governance, and compliance with industry standards and regulatory requirements.
You work in an agile and cross-functional team, contributing to the continuous improvement of data analytics strategies and best practices.


Professional competencies


You have several years of experience as a Data Analyst, preferably in the healthcare, medical technology, or cloud-based product industry.
You have strong SQL skills and experience working with Databricks, Python, or R for data analysis and modeling.
You have experience with cloud data platforms (Azure, AWS, or GCP) and tools such as Delta Lake, Apache Spark, or Snowflake.
You are proficient in data visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or similar.
You have a strong understanding of data governance, ETL processes, and data warehousing concepts.
You have experience working in an agile environment with multidisciplinary teams.
You are familiar with machine learning techniques, statistical analysis, and predictive modeling (a plus).
You have experience in the healthcare industry or a comparable regulated environment (a plus).


Personal competencies


You are a proactive, results-oriented, and analytical thinker with problem-solving skills.
You work effectively in multidisciplinary teams, encourage collaboration (including virtual teams), and foster mutual support.
You have a hands-on mentality and a passion for transforming data into meaningful insights.
You stay productive and capable of acting in critical situations.
You communicate clearly and responsibly in English. Spanish and German are nice to have.


What we offer

Join a company that combines the innovation and agility of a start-up with the stability and global reach of a healthcare leader. By working with us, you'll be part of a team dedicated to improving people's health and healthcare services. Our corporate culture values accountability, diversity, and trust. Embrace a highly motivated international team, flat hierarchies, and fast decision-making. Barcelona, a vibrant city with a high quality of life, is an ideal location for you to grow professionally and personally.

Benefits


Flexible and family-oriented working hours and hybrid working between office and home.
Modern office optimized for concentration and collaboration, featuring an integrated high-tech simulation operating room, and generous social areas and creativity zones.
Experience the rich cultural offerings, architectural beauty, and warm climate of Barcelona.
Opportunities for professional development and continuous learning within an international team that fosters collaboration and innovation.
Attractive private healthcare insurance conditions.


B. Braun Medical, S.A. U. | Ver√≥nica Lerma Cabrera | +347231

Title: Business Data Analyst - Pricing
Description:
About Ukio |

Ukio's mission is to empower individuals to live where they want, when they want üåé.

We do this by disrupting the traditional residential real estate market, providing fully furnished and artfully designed apartments for stays starting at one month. We remove all the hassle around finding a rental with no long-term contracts, moving/buying furniture, security deposits, broker fees, etc. giving choice and flexibility to allow people to live where and when they want. üí•

We are a Barcelona based startup with offices in Madrid, Lisbon, Berlin and Paris! and soon we will conquer some more cities across Europe üöÄ

Backed by Europe's best Venture Capital firms, the next year will be a critical phase in our growth as we look to further build out our team and expand into multiple new markets üî• . We have successfully raised a Series A investment round that will help propel our growth throughout Western Europe. ü•á

Our Culture |

We honor diversity, compassion, and honesty above all else in our team. We've already got a great mix of dedicated, collaborative, and results-driven people and are looking for more like minded folks to join our team. In true startup fashion, we always embrace the unknown and grant full autonomy to our team members to act as the owners of their projects and tasks. We are creators who embrace dynamic environments and take on and build up projects from scratch.

Our team is composed of everyone from foodies to athletes, adventure seekers to art buffs. We know fun, and we always have a team event on our calendars, so are you ready to join us?

Responsibilities |


Analyze strategies for real estate properties or hospitality services, including short-term rentals, hotels, and long-term leases
Analyze historical data, market trends, and competitor pricing to recommend optimal rates
Collaborate with the Revenue Team to align pricing strategies with business objectives
Build and maintain pricing models using advanced Excel techniques, business intelligence tools, and forecasting software
Generate daily, weekly, and monthly performance reports to track key metrics such as occupancy, average daily rate (ADR), and revenue per available unit (RevPAR)
Conduct scenario analyses to evaluate the impact of pricing changes on revenue and profitability


About you |


Bachelor's degree in Finance, Economics, Business, or a related field
2-4 years of experience in pricing, revenue management, or financial analysis within the real estate or hospitality industry
Proficiency in data analysis tools such as Excel, SQL, Power BI, or Tableau
Strong analytical and decision-making skills
Excellent communication and collaboration abilities


Ukio Life Benefits |


Private Health Insurance with ALAN
Flexible retribution with Payflow
UKIO Anniversary gift
Team buildings and office events
Transportation card (transportation coverage for role that have traveling needed for their work tasks according to the internal policy)
Breakfast at the office, fruits, nutrition bars, free coffee/tea and popcorn!
An amazing internal culture and no dress code!
International working environment with many different nationalities!


Ukio's culture promotes and values each individual's contribution. Diversity and inclusion, it's a big topic for us, as such we encourage applications from individuals of all backgrounds, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, socio-economic background, religion and/or belief.

Sky's the limit for us. We're here to revolutionize your life. Be part of this revolution üî•

We look forward to receiving your application!

For more information about Ukio, visit us at www.ukio.com and to keep up to date with UKIO's news, follow us on LinkedIn and Instagram!

Title: Data Analyst Trainee
Description:
Ecolab Company has an opening for an Data Analyst Trainee in our Procurement Analytics and Digital Solutions (ADS) team located in Barcelona, Spain. If you are a passionate professional that is seeking opportunity, advancement, and a rewarding learning chance and career we invite you to apply. This is a fantastic opportunity to join a highly recognized global growth company offering competitive compensation and benefits in addition to career growth.

Job Overview

As a part of the Data Operations team in the Global Supply Chain Analytics and Digital Solutions group you will be responsible for continuous improvements in digital capabilities and advanced analytics. You will lead the development of new digital products providing critical insights that help solve business challenges. The successful candidate will lead efforts to improve the chemical data understanding across the organization through improved process, governance, and data management.

Candidates must display a passion for systems, data, operational reporting & advanced analytics. The strong performer can expect further career advancement opportunities with Ecolab and will have the chance to move into other roles within Procurement or the organization, with increasing leadership opportunities. This is an exciting opportunity to advance your career with a stable growing company!

Main Responsibilities


Serve as a liaison among stakeholders to analyze, document, and validate requirements for reporting and changes to business processes
Develop and maintain data products
Develop, test, and operationalize new standardized reporting
Develop and maintain business intelligence dashboards
Lead automation of processes and analyses
Train other teams in systems, tools, and processes owned by ADS
Proactively make recommendations and identify opportunities to solve business problems through new business intelligence reporting
Interface with IT to specify and implement improvements to our data pipelines


Basic Qualifications


Masters in Data Science or Statistics or Computer Science or equivalent advance degree.
Interest in an Artificial Intelligence (AI) and business intelligence (BI) role
Experience with AI and BI data modeling and presenting insights to key stakeholders.
Exceptional analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Proficient in Python, PySpark, SQL, Azure AI, Tenserflow, Streamlit, Flask, Power Apps, Power BI, Snowflake, Azure SQL Database.
Intermediate SQL skills, or willingness to learn.
Fluent English
Full-time availability.
To be eligible for the Traineeship contract you must have completed your bachelor's or master's degree studies.
Work permit in Barcelona.


Preferred Qualifications


Experience designing and building standard reports and dashboards
History of managing and delivering projects, tasks, and initiatives
Ability to create, implement, document, and continuously improve processes in a changing environment
Training or experience in data science areas such as time series analysis, forecasting, classification, and regression analysis
Experience with data analytics tools such as Python, R, SPSS, MATLAB, Stata, and SAS
Experience working with global cross-functional teams and demonstrated ability to work well with people from different disciplines with varying degrees of technical expertise
Microsoft PowerBI experience
Project management experience
Experience in the petrochemical industry a plus
Enrolled in or recently completed degree with emphasis in Chemistry, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Information Technology, or Engineering preferred


Ecolab‚Äôs commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion (DE&I) reflects our longstanding value of working together to integrate diverse perspectives to challenge ourselves, reach our goals and do what‚Äôs right. Disability certificate will be an asset.

Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

Ecolab is committed to fair and equal treatment of associates and applicants and furthering the principles of Equal Opportunity to Employment. Our goal is to fully utilize minority, female, and disabled individuals at all levels of the workforce. We will recruit, hire, promote, transfer and provide opportunities for advancement based on individual qualifications and job performance. In all matters affecting employment, compensation, benefits, working conditions, and opportunities for advancement, Ecolab will not discriminate against any associate or applicant for employment because of race, religion, color, creed, national origin,‚ÄØcitizenship status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expressions, genetic‚ÄØinformation, marital status, age, or disability.

Title: CS Insights Associate
Description:
Job Description

ABOUT THIS JOB

Our Analysts are vital to NielsenIQ‚Äôs success. They work every day with our client base, which includes most of the major brands you see in the supermarket. We also work with most of the supermarkets and other retailers where you‚Äôll find these products. If you saw it the last time you did your weekly shop, they‚Äôre probably a NielsenIQ client, as is the shop. They all rely on our Senior Analytics Executives.

Our clients trust our Insights Analysts, coming to them when they have challenges and questions. These questions range from deciding on new product development, designing a new price strategy, and much more! NielsenIQ‚Äôs Analysts work with our clients to create and present analyses based on the world‚Äôs best datasets. Our insights team support clients in Health and Beauty, Beers, Wine and Spirits or Grocery.

We are confident and capable crafters of compelling insights and deliver clear and actionable recommendations to our clients, helping them grow their business.

A successful candidate for this role will be someone who can establish strong relationships with both our clients and our colleagues. You will quickly become a trusted partner, working with many of our clients‚Äô teams, including marketing, sales, category, and many more. You will be expected to understand our clients‚Äô needs and then create and present solutions that help those clients achieve their strategic and tactical goals.

Our team has a wide range of backgrounds and skill sets. Some of us have backgrounds in data, some in marketing, and others in sales. We are looking for someone who is keen to bring their excellent story-telling skills to a modern, data environment.

If telling stories through data excites you but you‚Äôre uncertain whether you have the data knowledge: get in touch. We have an excellent training program, ensuring you understand all our products and how we create analyses.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Understanding Client Needs:


Understanding client business priorities and the role we can play in supporting these goals
Understand the impact we can have on personal objectives of individuals at our clients
Responsible for setting up client onboarding for analytics & insights services and conducting tactical client training for Guided Analytics & NielsenIQ tools such as Connect Express and Discover


Delivering Insight:


Become a category expert; be curious and engage with the client industry, their categories and key market trends
Being prepared to challenge client hypothesis and bring a new perspective
Make recommendations based on rigorous analysis leveraging multiple data sources, sound business understanding and commercial awareness.


Workload Management and Prioritization:


Manages workload independently and effectively prioritizes client commitments alongside internal commitments.
Maintains a clear communication pathway with the key stakeholders
Maintains and delivers work log trackers and project plans where applicable


REQUIREMENTS


Engaging presenter
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Excellent time management and prioritization skills with a proven track record of delivering projects on time
Confident numerically
Ability to analyze data confidently
Problem solving and solutions orientated
Performs work accurately and effectively with attention to detail
Good at building relationships, internally and with clients
Experience of working in an analytical environment
An understanding of the FMCG industry and trends
Capable of leveraging tools such as Microsoft excel and PowerPoint
Experience in using Home Panel data is a plus
Native in Spanish and good level of English


WHAT WE CAN OFFER

We provide the most complete and trusted view of consumers and markets in 90 countries covering 90% of the world‚Äôs populations. Focusing on consumer-packaged goods manufacturers and retailers, we combine unparalleled datasets, pioneering technology, and the industry‚Äôs top talent to create insights that unlock innovation and redefine what‚Äôs possible.

Working with our Customer Success team gives you access to:


Our amazing 'people first' culture with plenty of flexibility
Career & Learning development
Making an impact on biggest FMCG manufacturers' growth
Becoming an expert in categories that shape Spanish retail


Additional Information

This is a full time role based in Madrid offering a hybrid working mode combining working from home, office and visiting clients.

Additional Information

Our Benefits


Flexible working environment
Volunteer time off
LinkedIn Learning
Employee-Assistance-Program (EAP)


About NIQ

NIQ is the world‚Äôs leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights‚Äîdelivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms‚ÄîNIQ delivers the Full View‚Ñ¢. NIQ is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world‚Äôs population.

For more information, visit NIQ.com

Want to keep up with our latest updates?

Follow us on: LinkedIn | Instagram | Twitter | Facebook

Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

NIQ is committed to reflecting the diversity of the clients, communities, and markets we measure within our own workforce. We exist to count everyone and are on a mission to systematically embed inclusion and diversity into all aspects of our workforce, measurement, and products. We enthusiastically invite candidates who share that mission to join us. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class. Our global non-discrimination policy covers these protected classes in every market in which we do business worldwide. Learn more about how we are driving diversity and inclusion in everything we do by visiting the NIQ News Center: https://nielseniq.com/global/en/news-center/diversity-inclusion

Title: Digital Analyst
Description:
What makes Cognizant Netcentric a great fit for you?

At Cognizant Netcentric, we come to work every day with the mission of leveraging cutting-edge technology to create memorable digital experiences for the worlds leading brands. And we do it as a diverse, global community of over 1500+ digital marketing experts collaborating across countries, cultures, languages and technologies.




We're energized by an inclusive and responsive organizational culture that brings together the entrepreneurial spirit of a startup with the resources, growth opportunities and stability of a larger global organization. Holacracy is the cornerstone of how we work, empowering every individual with the power to make an impact within our organization. All this encourages us to learn and grow as individuals, and unite as a team to build innovative digital experiences that touch peoples lives.

We are looking for a Marketing enthusiast with strong experience in Audience Management, who loves to transmit his/her passion for marketing technologies to clients to shape and drive their digital experiences.




We are looking for a Digital Analyst professional who loves to transmit his/her passion for web technologies and big data projects. You will consult internal stakeholders by leveraging data insights. You will be the interface between the product team and the business. You are a good fit, if you are a sharp mind that gathers insights and turns them into business value. You have a strong analytical mindset and are a great communicator to convey your insights.




Required Skills

Ideally 5-7 years of experience
Understanding of Digital Marketing
Understanding and knowledge of Tealium Tag Management, Google Cloud Biq Query, SQL
Experience in Google Analytics UA/GA360/GA4, Data Studio, Qlik, Looker Domain Skills
Experience working in the area of Customer Experience in Travel or Retail industry
Technology Data Management




Roles & Responsibilities in your day-to-day activities you will:

Consult internal stakeholders on using data to gain meaningful insights
Continuously work with product teams and improve the product
Responsible for product reporting and guiding team along with Product Owner
Basic understanding of SQL and queering data to derive insights for business
Consult on projects with respect to tracking and measuring all desired on and offline touchpoints.
Advocate customers through the creation of Analytics, Data Management and Customer Data Platform solutions.
Added advantage:
Experience in Tag Management with the ability to read and write code
Model business processes in data architecture for analysis and optimization
Workshop attendance - online, as well as some onsite travel required.




What do we offer YOU?

Permanent contract
30 working days of vacation
Flexible working hours
Recognition bonus system
Private health insurance
Apple work equipment
WFH equipment + welcome package
WFH monthly expenses compensation
Access to Udemy courses
Adobe certification
Sponsored gym membership
Tax-free benefits (ticket restaurant, kindergarten and transport)
A dynamic and international team
Everyone has a voice; we are a Holacracy organisation

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are growing our teams and this is an opportunity for you to join our Barcelona office as a Data Analyst within the Analytics Performance Marketing team.

You will collaborate closely with Data Analysts, Data Scientists besides UA Managers and other Marketing roles to analyse and interpret data that drives our marketing strategies.

Your insights will play a key role in shaping campaign optimization, identifying growth opportunities, and ultimately contributing to the company's success in a competitive gaming market.

As a Data Analyst you will have a key role in defining, extracting and actioning data from big and complex datasets from a variety of analytical solutions from simple to complex.

What You'll Do

Key Responsibilities:
Data Analysis & Reporting:
Gather, clean, and analyze marketing data from multiple sources to provide actionable insights.
Produce ad hoc analyses to support decision-making for campaigns and product launches.
Monitor and evaluate the performance of marketing campaigns ( paid ads, organic TV, brand) and provide recommendations for optimisation.
Develop actionable insights from user data that inform marketing targeting, acquisition and retention strategies.
Collaboration:
Collaborate with cross-functional teams including Data Science, Data Engineer, to integrate marketing data with overall product and business objectives.
Communicate findings and insights to non-technical stakeholders through clear and concise visualizations and presentations.
Data Quality & Governance:
Ensure the accuracy and integrity of all marketing data through regular data audits and validation processes.
Help set and maintain data tracking standards across marketing channels, ensuring consistency and reliability.







What We're Looking For

Required Qualifications:
3 to 5 years of experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar analytical role, preferably within the gaming / tech / financial industry.
Strong proficiency in data analysis tools (SQL, Python, Excel, etc.).
Experience with data modelling, time series analysis, A/B testing, Difference in Difference
Ability to identify trends, extract insights, and communicate findings in a clear and actionable manner.
Strong attention to detail and ability to work with large datasets.
Ability to present complex data in an easy-to-understand format to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Nice-to-Have Skills:
Familiarity with game-related metrics, mobile apps such as daily active users (DAU), in-app purchases (IAPs), and retention/engagement metrics.


Why Product Madness?

As part of the Aristocrat family, we share their mission of bringing joy to life through the power of play, with a world-class team who creates top-grossing, leading titles in the social casino genre, including Heart of Vegas, Lightning Link, Cashman Casino.

With 800 team members across the globe, Product Madness is headquartered in London, with offices in Barcelona, Gda≈Ñsk, Lviv, Montreal and a remote team spanning the USA, making us a truly global powerhouse.

We live by our People First principle. Regardless of where, when, or how they work, our team members have opportunities to elevate their careers, and grow alongside us. We take pride in fostering an inclusive culture, where our people are encouraged to be their very best, every day.

But don‚Äôt just take our word for it. In 2024, we made the Global Inspiring Workplace Awards list, and won a bronze award at the Stevies for Great Employers in the ‚ÄòEmployer of the Year - Media and Entertainment‚Äô category.

So, what‚Äôs stopping you?

Our Values
People First
We have the deepest respect for our people and their well being. We know they are exceptionally talented and will always have a choice. We want them to re-choose us every day. We are committed to building a culture where each person's voice will always be heard and addressed.
MAD for More
Always improving, innovating and never settling for the existing. We push all boundaries with courage and ambition to become the world‚Äôs best games company.
Champion Together We excel at what we do but yet remain humble and helpful to our teammates. We champion one another and hold each other to high standards without any egos.
Globally Inclusive
We are all Equal - regardless of the language we speak, where we live, our gender, religion or culture we come from. We want to build a global home, where everyone has the equal opportunity to make an impact.
Customer Focused
We always think from the customer's perspective - be it players or internal customers.

Improving their experience and joy is what drives us. Every client's success is our big win!

Travel Expectations

None

At this time, we are unable to sponsor work visas for this position. Candidates must be authorized to work in the job posting location for this position on a full-time basis without the need for current or future visa sponsorship.

We are growing our teams and this is an opportunity for you to join our Barcelona office as a Data Analyst within the Analytics Performance Marketing team.

You will collaborate closely with Data Analysts, Data Scientists besides UA Managers and other Marketing roles to analyse and interpret data that drives our marketing strategies.

Your insights will play a key role in shaping campaign optimization, identifying growth opportunities, and ultimately contributing to the company's success in a competitive gaming market.

As a Data Analyst you will have a key role in defining, extracting and actioning data from big and complex datasets from a variety of analytical solutions from simple to complex.

What You'll Do

Key Responsibilities:
  • Data Analysis & Reporting:
    • Gather, clean, and analyze marketing data from multiple sources to provide actionable insights.
    • Produce ad hoc analyses to support decision-making for campaigns and product launches.
    • Monitor and evaluate the performance of marketing campaigns ( paid ads, organic TV, brand) and provide recommendations for optimisation.
    • Develop actionable insights from user data that inform marketing targeting, acquisition and retention strategies.
  • Collaboration:
    • Collaborate with cross-functional teams including Data Science, Data Engineer, to integrate marketing data with overall product and business objectives.
    • Communicate findings and insights to non-technical stakeholders through clear and concise visualizations and presentations.
  • Data Quality & Governance:
    • Ensure the accuracy and integrity of all marketing data through regular data audits and validation processes.
    • Help set and maintain data tracking standards across marketing channels, ensuring consistency and reliability.






What We're Looking For

Required Qualifications:
  • 3 to 5 years of experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar analytical role, preferably within the gaming / tech / financial industry.
  • Strong proficiency in data analysis tools (SQL, Python, Excel, etc.).
  • Experience with data modelling, time series analysis, A/B testing, Difference in Difference
  • Ability to identify trends, extract insights, and communicate findings in a clear and actionable manner.
  • Strong attention to detail and ability to work with large datasets.
  • Ability to present complex data in an easy-to-understand format to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Nice-to-Have Skills:
  • Familiarity with game-related metrics, mobile apps such as daily active users (DAU), in-app purchases (IAPs), and retention/engagement metrics.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
NexGen Cloud is a growing IaaS company revolutionizing cloud infrastructure with cutting-edge GPU solutions. We power the next wave of innovation across AI & Machine Learning, VFX & Rendering, Data Science, IoT and High-Performance Computing, enabling businesses to push boundaries faster and smarter.

We are dedicated to simplify the complexities of the digital world, delivering scalable, secure and cost-effective cloud solutions that drive real impact.

At our core, we‚Äôre a team of visionary, driven and highly skilled professionals, passionate about shaping the future of cloud technology and making a lasting mark on the industry.




THE ROLE

We are seeking a proactive, resourceful and forward-thinking Data Analyst to play a key role in our expanding Operations team to help our strategic shift to a Data Driven Organisation.

This role has a unique opportunity to set the foundation for data processes, reporting and automation. You‚Äôll collaborate with the leadership & cross-functional teams to unlock Business Intelligence insights that will drive key business strategies and create meaningful operational efficiencies.

If you thrive on solving complex problems, creating actionable insights from data and want a huge potential for career growth, this is the role for you!




WHAT YOU¬¥LL DO

Data Ownership & Integration

Own the process of extracting, integrating and aggregating data from various internal and external sources (data warehouses, business systems, APIs).
Build and optimize data pipelines to ensure seamless data flow and synchronization across platforms.
Partner with Operations and Business Teams to automate and streamline integration workflows.

Business Intelligence & Reporting

Design and build insightful dashboards and reports using tools like Power BI, Tableau or similar platforms
Deliver actionable insights to key stakeholders and leadership on KPIs, performance trends, and growth opportunities.
Manage ad-hoc reporting needs and provide real-time, business-critical analysis to support agility and informed decisions across the organization.
Influence decision-making by presenting data in a way that resonates with diverse audiences, aligning insights with strategic objectives.

Advanced Data Analysis

Analyse complex datasets to identify trends, patterns and insights that directly influence strategic decisions.
Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams (Leadership, Technology, Sales, Finance, Marketing, etc.) to translate data findings into business actions.
Conduct rigorous data validation and quality checks to ensure data accuracy and integrity.

Automation & Process Optimisation

Map, document and enhance business processes while identifying automation opportunities.
Build and maintain automation workflows using tools like Microsoft Power Automate, Zapier, or similar.
Lead initiatives that drive operational efficiency and scalability across departments.

Data Governance & Compliance

Implement best practices in data governance, security and compliance.
Ensure proper documentation of methodologies, processes and workflows for knowledge sharing and scalability.

Cross-functional Collaboration & Influence

Be the go-to expert for data insights within the RevOps team and wider organization.
Work closely with IT and business stakeholders to optimize data accessibility and usability.
Provide support and knowledge-sharing to team members on BI tools and data processes.




QUALIFICATIONS & SKILLS

Required Skills & Experience

4+ years of hands-on experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar role, ideally within fast-paced environments.
Proven track record in data extraction, integration and automation projects.
Strong SQL skills for querying and managing data from relational databases is mandatory.
Expertise in BI tools such as Power BI, Tableau.
Experience with automation tools beneficial (e.g., Microsoft Power Automate, Zapier).
Familiarity with scripting & analytic languages like Python or R is advantageous.
Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Business Analytics or a related field is a plus, but not mandatory.
Knowledge of data warehouse solutions such as Snowflake, AWS Redshift, or Google BigQuery is a plus.
Bonus: Understanding of monitoring tools like Prometheus, Grafana, and experience with ETL workflows (Alteryx, Talend, Apache Airflow).

Soft Skills:

Exceptional analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Strong communicator and collaborative team player.
Detail-oriented with the ability to manage multiple projects independently.
A self-starter who thrives in greenfield roles where you can leave your mark.
Passionate about using data to solve real-world business problems.
Curious and creative, always looking for new ways to improve processes and uncover insights.




WHY JOIN US?

Be the pioneer: You have the autonomy to influence business strategies, optimise processes and drive real change.
Massive growth potential: As our business scales, so will your role and career opportunities.
Own your impact: You'll work closely with leadership and stakeholders on strategic projects.
Bring your ideas: We value innovation and are excited to hear new ideas that improve how we operate.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst (h/m)
Description:
Clikalia es la proptech europea que est√° redefiniendo el real estate a trav√©s de la innovaci√≥n, la eficiencia y la transparencia. Nuestro prop√≥sito es revolucionar la experiencia inmobiliaria, simplificando cada proceso y ofreciendo soluciones integrales que maximizan el valor de los activos de nuestros clientes.

Con una visi√≥n disruptiva y un enfoque basado en la tecnolog√≠a, hacemos que comprar, vender o reformar una vivienda sea m√°s √°gil, accesible y confiable. Creemos en la transformaci√≥n del sector mediante un modelo sostenible, optimizando el parque inmobiliario y mejorando su eficiencia energ√©tica. Nuestro equipo, apasionado y resiliente, trabaja cada d√≠a para ofrecer una experiencia cuidada y justa, con relaciones basadas en la confianza y la excelencia.

Si te motivan la innovaci√≥n, los retos y el impacto real en la industria, este es tu sitio. En Clikalia, no solo construimos el futuro del real estate, lo estamos liderando.

Tu impacto en Clikalia:

Estamos buscando un Data Analyst para incorporarse en nuestro equipo de tecnolog√≠a. En este rol, ser√°s parte de un equipo din√°mico y en crecimiento, donde tu trabajo tendr√° un impacto directo en la evoluci√≥n del sector inmobiliario.

Lo que har√°s:


Entendimiento de problemas y necesidades de datos, y definici√≥n de requisitos anal√≠ticos junto con responsables de productos de datos y usuarios de negocio
Recopilaci√≥n, procesamiento y preparaci√≥n de grandes conjuntos de datos para garantizar su exactitud y explotaci√≥n
Implementaci√≥n de soluciones atractivas y comprensibles para visualizaci√≥n y an√°lisis de datos
Comunicaci√≥n de resultados del an√°lisis a analistas de negocio y otros miembros del equipo de cara a toma de decisiones
Utilizaci√≥n de herramientas y t√©cnicas estad√≠sticas para ciencia de datos (an√°lisis predictivo e identificaci√≥n de patrones y tendencias)
Trabajo conjunto con equipo de Data Engineering para implementaci√≥n de las capas de activaci√≥n, acceso y consumo de nuestro pipeline y arquitectura de datos.



Objetivos del puesto:


Cumplimiento y entrega de trabajos asignados en funci√≥n de planificaciones quincenales (sprints)
Gesti√≥n efectiva y cumplimentaci√≥n de estado y progreso de tareas en las herramientas departamentales
Seguimiento y cumplimiento de criterios de dise√±o e implementaci√≥n de soluciones de modelizaci√≥n, visualizaci√≥n y an√°lisis de datos en su totalidad

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
A career in our Technology practice, will provide you with the opportunity to help clients seize essential advantages by working alongside business leaders to solve their toughest problems and capture their greatest opportunities.

The role - Data Analyst

Responsibilities

As a Data Analyst, you will work as part of a team of problem solvers, helping to solve complex business issues from strategy to execution. PwC Professional skills and responsibilities for this management level include but are not limited to:


Write and optimize SQL scripts for the creation of controls on data sources, data transformation processes, and report reconciliation
Automate Excel files to apply controls to data sources and generate reports
Extract, load, and transform data from various sources for business analysis, ensuring clarity and conciseness in the presentation of data
Create Power BI reports for data visualization and results presentation
Ensure project management using DevOps.


Your profile


BSc or MSc in Computer Science, in Engineering, Mathematics or similar is preferred
Experience in writing and optimizing SQL scripts
Advanced knowledge of Excel automation (e.g., VBA, Macros)
Familiarity with creating reports and dashboards in Power BI
Fluent in both written and spoken English and Portuguese.


We believe you have what it takes. Are you ready to join our ‚Äúcommunity of solvers‚Äù?

Be a part of The New Equation.

Title: Junior Data Analyst Trainee
Description:
About The Job


As Chief Operating Officer (COO) team, we assist our different business team in multiple topics, both on daily/monthly needs as in project mode. Within the COO team we have a small team of data scientists focusing on data, who are involved in the data use cases from exploration phase up to production delivery.
We are looking for a junior business data analyst to join the COO team to provide assistance in the automation of our business monitoring reports and enhance and leverage our data capabilities.


Your Main Activities Are


Automate business dashboards as prototypes and prepare them to be put in production, working closely with the team¬¥s data analysts
Report to Top line TB Management and TB COO on all data queries and data needs.
Contribute to the development and governance of our data and support the different business lines with data-driven decision-making
Meet different stakeholders to frame their data needs, based on your findings collect the necessary data, process the data, and turn it into meaningful tools meeting the requirements expressed by the teams
Participate and interact with inter-disciplinary teams (IT, Business, Operations) and contribute to the improvement and streamlining of data systems within the company to drive innovation


Profile And Skills To Success


Academic background in Data Analytics, Computer Science, Information Management, Business Intelligence, Business, Economics or Mathematics
Fluency in English
Highly proficient with MS Excel
Ability to quickly comprehend new software tools and learn how to use them optimally
Great attention to detail
Excellent interpersonal, communication and influence skills
Good conceptualization skills and data exposure
Open, curious and eager to learn and discover day to day banking products


Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union's leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Full Stack Data Analyst - Critical Data Products
Description:
We're searching for a talented Data Analyst to join our growing Critical Data Products team. This team is pivotal in delivering and enhancing high-quality, robust data solutions that underpin Pleo‚Äôs essential data-driven products and operations. You will directly impact our customers by supporting critical business areas with insightful analytics and self-serve data tools.

You‚Äôll be part of the broader Product Hub within the Data competence, collaborating with a multidisciplinary team across a broad range of product and operational related data initiatives.

You will thrive in this role if you:


Are an experienced Data Analyst with a strong background in analytics, data visualization, and insight generation within a fast-paced environment, preferably fintech
Possess advanced SQL skills and experience with data modeling tools, particularly dbt and BigQuery
Have extensive experience with data visualization tools, specifically Looker and LookML
Are passionate about building high-quality, robust, and user-friendly dashboards and tools for diverse stakeholders
Are committed to ensuring the reliability and accuracy of data and data products, critical in a fintech setting
Possess an understanding of business and product strategy, and how data can support it
Demonstrate a strong sense of ownership and responsibility for your work
Are familiar with CI/CD processes and understand their importance in maintaining data integrity
Have experience in financial operations, payments, credit and/or compliance.
Possess a solid understanding of data privacy principles and governance practices


What will you be doing:


Run analyses with data, present and automate insights and recommendations to business stakeholders
Empowering our internal teams at Pleo with high-quality, self-serve data through the development and maintenance of dashboards and reports in Looker
Support in the development and delivery of reporting for external purposes
Identifying opportunities to improve operational efficiencies and product performance using data and analytics
Collaborating with cross-functional stakeholders to define data requirements, uncover trends, and identify opportunities for product enhancement
Engaging with data colleagues and peers to foster a culture of cross-team learning and knowledge sharing


Your colleagues say you


Are an effective bridge-builder who creates strong partnerships across data, engineering, product, and business teams
Balance innovation and pragmatism, knowing when to go deep and when to deliver quickly
Are a trusted mentor who uplifts and develops those around you
Actively seek and share knowledge, contributing to a culture of continuous learning
Have a knack for bringing people together and aligning them towards shared goals
Are someone they‚Äôd love to have coffee with (virtual or not)


Show me the benefits!


Your own Pleo card (no more out-of-pocket spending!)
Lunch is on us - with catering in our Lisbon, Copenhagen and London offices or a monthly lunch allowance paid directly together with your salary in other markets üçú
Private health insurance to ensure you‚Äôre fit in body and mind to do your best work
We offer 25 days of holiday + your public holidays
Flexibility/remote working options
Option to purchase 5 additional days of holiday through a salary sacrifice
We‚Äôre trialling MyndUp to give our employees access to free mental health and wellbeing support with great success so far ‚ù§Ô∏è‚Äçü©π
Access to LinkedIn Learning - acquire new skills, stay abreast of industry trends and fuel your personal and professional development continuously
Paid parental leave - we want to make sure that we're supportive of families and help you feel that you don't have to compromise your family due to work üë∂


Why join us?

Working at Pleo means you're working on something very exciting: the future of work. Our mission is to help every company go beyond the books. Pleo itself means ‚Äòmore than you‚Äôd expect‚Äô, and it‚Äôs been the secret to our success over the last 8 years. So it‚Äôs only fitting that we‚Äôd pass this philosophy onto our customers to help them make the most of their finances.

We think company spending should be delegated to all employees and teams, that it should be as automated as possible, and that it should drive a culture of responsible spending. Finance teams shouldn‚Äôt be siloed from the rest of the organisation ‚Äì they should work in unity with marketing, sales, IT and everyone else.

Speaking of working in unity, our values tell the story of how we work at Pleo. We have four core values, the first of which is ‚Äòchampion the customer‚Äô, which means we address real pain points that businesses face. Next up is ‚Äòsucceed as a team‚Äô, which highlights how our strength lies in our diversity and trust in each other. We also ‚Äòmake it happen‚Äô by taking bold decisions and following through to deliver results. Last but not least, we ‚Äòbuild to scale‚Äô, creating lasting solutions that address today‚Äôs challenges and anticipate tomorrow‚Äôs needs.

So, in a nutshell, that's Pleo. Today we are a 850+ team, from over 100 nations, sitting in our Copenhagen HQ, London, Stockholm, Berlin, Madrid, Montreal and Lisbon offices ‚Äîand quite a few full-time remotes in 35 other countries! Being HQ'd out of Copenhagen means we're inspired by things like a good work-life balance. If you don't work in the office with us, we'll help you set up the best remote setup possible and make sure you still have time to connect with your team.

About Your Application


Please submit your application in English; it‚Äôs our company language so you‚Äôll be speaking lots of it if you join üíï
We treat all candidates equally: If you are interested please apply through our application system - any correspondence should come from there! Our lovely support isn't able to pass on any calls/ emails our way - and this makes sure that the candidate experience is smooth and fair to everyone üòä
We‚Äôre on a mission to make everyone feel valued at work. That‚Äôs only achievable if our team reflects the diversity of the world around us - and that starts with you, hitting apply, even if you are worried you might not tick all the boxes! We embrace and encourage people from all backgrounds to apply - regardless of race/ethnicity, colour, religion, nationality, gender, sex, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, neurodiversity, socio-economic status, culture or beliefs
When you submit an application we process your personal data as a data processor. Find out more about how your data is used in the FAQs section at the bottom of our jobs page

Why join us?

Working at Pleo means you're working on something very exciting: the future of work. Our mission is to help every company go beyond the books. Pleo itself means ‚Äòmore than you‚Äôd expect‚Äô, and it‚Äôs been the secret to our success over the last 8 years. So it‚Äôs only fitting that we‚Äôd pass this philosophy onto our customers to help them make the most of their finances.

We think company spending should be delegated to all employees and teams, that it should be as automated as possible, and that it should drive a culture of responsible spending. Finance teams shouldn‚Äôt be siloed from the rest of the organisation ‚Äì they should work in unity with marketing, sales, IT and everyone else.

Speaking of working in unity, our values tell the story of how we work at Pleo. We have four core values, the first of which is ‚Äòchampion the customer‚Äô, which means we address real pain points that businesses face. Next up is ‚Äòsucceed as a team‚Äô, which highlights how our strength lies in our diversity and trust in each other. We also ‚Äòmake it happen‚Äô by taking bold decisions and following through to deliver results. Last but not least, we ‚Äòbuild to scale‚Äô, creating lasting solutions that address today‚Äôs challenges and anticipate tomorrow‚Äôs needs.

So, in a nutshell, that's Pleo. Today we are a 850+ team, from over 100 nations, sitting in our Copenhagen HQ, London, Stockholm, Berlin, Madrid, Montreal and Lisbon offices ‚Äîand quite a few full-time remotes in 35 other countries! Being HQ'd out of Copenhagen means we're inspired by things like a good work-life balance. If you don't work in the office with us, we'll help you set up the best remote setup possible and make sure you still have time to connect with your team.

About Your Application

  • Please submit your application in English; it‚Äôs our company language so you‚Äôll be speaking lots of it if you join üíï
  • We treat all candidates equally: If you are interested please apply through our application system - any correspondence should come from there! Our lovely support isn't able to pass on any calls/ emails our way - and this makes sure that the candidate experience is smooth and fair to everyone üòä
  • We‚Äôre on a mission to make everyone feel valued at work. That‚Äôs only achievable if our team reflects the diversity of the world around us - and that starts with you, hitting apply, even if you are worried you might not tick all the boxes! We embrace and encourage people from all backgrounds to apply - regardless of race/ethnicity, colour, religion, nationality, gender, sex, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, neurodiversity, socio-economic status, culture or beliefs
  • When you submit an application we process your personal data as a data processor. Find out more about how your data is used in the FAQs section at the bottom of our jobs page

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people.


Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people.

With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:- DECSKILL TALENT: We believe that our people are key to our success.

Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients.

We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.- DECSKILL BOOST: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.- DECSKILL CONNECT: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.We are searching for a Data Analyst!Responsabilities:You support to migrate current developed reports from Tableau On-premises to Tableau Cloud.You collaborate with your data science team to smoothly switch reporting used data source from Microsoft SQL Server to Microsoft Azure.You rebuild current developed reports with modern look and feel.You reconfigure current developed reports if any business logics are changed while migration.You develop new reports to support customers' needs.You work in a cross functional agile environment with an international team.You stay updated on the latest advancements in data science, business intelligence, etc.Requirements:You have a Bachelor or Master degree in the field of Statistics, Business informatics, Econometrics or any related discipline.You are fully skilled with Tableau, ideally certificated with "Tableau Certified Data Analyst" or higher.You are experienced in Tableau environment and familiar with the DAX functions.You bring work experience in any relevant field, ideally 5 years at least in similar analytical context with relevant quests for ITSM.

(e.G.

Incident Management, Problem Management, etc.)

or CMDB (Configuration Management Database)You are experienced in working in agile team and you can proactively explore and communicate findings.You bring a strong expertise in cloud as well as on-premises storage systems.

(preferably MS SQL Server and Azure services)You have an analytical mindset with strong knowledge, and you are capable of communicating findings through the cross functional team.You are fluent in English.If you're interested in this job, please send your CV in to ****** with reference "VR/DataAnalyst"
