Title: Data Analyst (Arch Data) (M/F) - Remote
HTML:
Sysmatch is an IT Consultancy and Outsourcing Company with a wide range of technological skills, resulting from the accumulation of know-how and the experience of our consultants, allowing the implementation of solutions adapted to the needs of our clients, privileging their robustness and scalability.More than two decades in the IT market, we present ourselves as a flexible, adaptable, innovative and forward-looking Company.At the moment we are looking for the following candidate:Data Analyst (Arch Data) (m/f)

  • RemoteMandatory:Experience with Data Analysis and Data Governace; Experience withPython, SQL, and any Dashboard/ Reporting tool; Experience withArch Data.What we offer:- A dynamic project in a well-regarded client at an international level;
  • Salary classification according to the experience shown;
  • Career development with intervention in ambitious and innovative technological projects;
  • Good working environment with young and dynamic teams;
  • Personalized follow-up to each consultant;
  • Integration into Sysmatch staff with access to all company activities;
  • You will be part of our trainings and Team Building events;
  • A network of hundreds of partnerships with companies in countless sectors that offer you exclusive discounts (health, wellness, travel, gastronomy, culture, leisure, training, etc).Recruitment, selection and integration process:The first contacts will be made by phone call or video call.We are prepared to ensure the monitoring and integration of new employees and support them in this new phase of their professional career.To respond to this opportunity, please send us your CV, indicating the reference PC/DA/E to the following email address ******

Title: Analyst & Business Intelligence
Description:
Mutual Respect, Empathy, Innovation, and Professional Pride. Do you see yourself within these values?

Founded in 2006 with the mission "To Challenge Complexity", Closer Consulting is a Data Science company specializing in Business Intelligence, Advanced Analytics, and Artificial Intelligence.

Developing projects in the most diverse industries ‚Äì Banking, Telecommunications, Healthcare, Retail, Energy, Insurance, and Aviation, among others ‚Äì, we have created an environment where the brightest enquiring minds feel at home, providing our people with the means, opportunities and support they need to thrive and innovate.

We seek an Analyst & Business Intelligence willing to accept new challenges in our Closer team in a hybrid model in Lisbon is mandatory.

Are you the one?


Experience with data integration, optimizations, and orchestration of large volumes of data on a daily basis;
Data analytics, Data modeling, Data visualization, Data integration, Data warehousing, and Data exploration;
ETL process (Batch, Micro-batch, Real time processing (data streaming or data events);
Proven technical know-how in: SQL, Azure, Azure Fabric, Azure Databricks or Datafactory;
Knowledge of Python and other similar tools such as Hadoop or Spark would also be ideal;
Communication with stackholders and functional, requirements and business orientation is a must.


We Believe We Are The Ones To, By


Providing a multidisciplinary Team.
Giving a home office kit with everything you need to perform remotely.
Ensuring a career plan alongside professional growth.
Providing you with a custom training plan.
Helping you reach happiness.


Oh‚Ä¶ And By The Way, We Also Have


Several challenging complex projects.
Stimulating teams and leaders.
World-class Clients and Partners.


If you believe in this match as much as we do, send us your CV to joana.ferreira@closer.pt and reach the closer side of life.

Closer is a company that values diversity and inclusion. We are committed to fostering an environment where everyone is treated with dignity and respect, regardless of race, gender, beliefs, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, or other personal characteristics.

At Closer, we embrace the unique perspectives and experiences that everyone brings, and we believe that it is a fundamental driver for the success we've achieved.

Title: Data Administrative Analyst - Remote - Based in Portugal
Description:
Reporting to the Clinical Support Helpdesk Manager/Team Lead, the Data Administrative Analyst is responsible for processing User Administrative requests for multiple Clinical Applications managed by the Clinical Support Help Desk (CSHD). Using strong analytical and data processing skills, the Analyst will provide accurate ticket processing and query response in a timely manner and with the highest level of customer service.

Please be aware we can only hire people already based in Portugal with fully legal and valid documentation to work in Portugal (fiscal number, social insurance number and title of residence or manifestation of interest if you're not a citizen). If you do not meet these requirements please do not apply.

Please apply with your resume in English.

Why should I apply, you may ask?


Fully remote and stable position, from wherever you want in Portugal
Permanent contract (sem termo)
Flexible working hours focused in EST/EDT office hours (current shift is from 10:00 to 19:00 Lisbon time)
Training: around 4 weeks from Monday to Friday 1pm to 10pm Portuguese time.
Salary of 12.180‚Ç¨ gross/year (divided in 12 or 14 payments, as you wish).
Teleworking of 50‚Ç¨ gross fixed per month
Private health insurance
Full training provided and dozens of E-Learning courses available
No mandatory need for a college/university degree


Key Responsibilities

Manage client user data utilizing provided tools / applications (i.e., account provisioning, deactivation, modification, urgent access requests)

Maintain technical proficiency with client tools

Manage and organize workload based on priorities

Suggest process improvements to improve quality and consistency

Create and delete internal Analyst accounts

Verification of request sheet submission

QC requests to ensure Quality Control

File paperwork as needed for auditing purposes

Contact clients where necessary to clarify processes ‚Äì requests received primarily by email

Other duties as assigned

Required Technical Skills

Proficient with Windows operating system and applications ‚Äì email, online chat

High proficiency with MS Office Suite, high level MS Excel expertise

Solid computer keyboarding, multiple monitor, and touchpad skills

General understanding of various software and hardware. Citrix experience an asset

Required Soft Skills

Strong attention to detail with a commitment to quality

Fluency in English, spoken and written

Exceptional organization, planning and time management skills

Excellent customer service orientation

Proven ability to work under pressure and in a very fast paced environment

Ability to adapt based on rapidly changing client needs; high level of flexibility is required

Capacity to take initiative and think outside the box if necessary

Must be able to communicate professionally in a written and verbal capacity

Must be a team player and demonstrate a strong work ethic

Required Education And Experience

Business Administration or related field or a minimum of 1-year previous data processing / administrative experience preferably in a call center environment and/or any equivalent combination of education and experience.
Show more
HTML:
Reporting to the Clinical Support Helpdesk Manager/Team Lead, the Data Administrative Analyst is responsible for processing User Administrative requests for multiple Clinical Applications managed by the Clinical Support Help Desk (CSHD). Using strong analytical and data processing skills, the Analyst will provide accurate ticket processing and query response in a timely manner and with the highest level of customer service.

Please be aware we can only hire people already based in Portugal with fully legal and valid documentation to work in Portugal (fiscal number, social insurance number and title of residence or manifestation of interest if you're not a citizen). If you do not meet these requirements please do not apply.

Please apply with your resume in English.

Why should I apply, you may ask?

  • Fully remote and stable position, from wherever you want in Portugal
  • Permanent contract (sem termo)
  • Flexible working hours focused in EST/EDT office hours (current shift is from 10:00 to 19:00 Lisbon time)
  • Training: around 4 weeks from Monday to Friday 1pm to 10pm Portuguese time.
  • Salary of 12.180‚Ç¨ gross/year (divided in 12 or 14 payments, as you wish).
  • Teleworking of 50‚Ç¨ gross fixed per month
  • Private health insurance
  • Full training provided and dozens of E-Learning courses available
  • No mandatory need for a college/university degree

Key Responsibilities

Manage client user data utilizing provided tools / applications (i.e., account provisioning, deactivation, modification, urgent access requests)

Maintain technical proficiency with client tools

Manage and organize workload based on priorities

Suggest process improvements to improve quality and consistency

Create and delete internal Analyst accounts

Verification of request sheet submission

QC requests to ensure Quality Control

File paperwork as needed for auditing purposes

Contact clients where necessary to clarify processes ‚Äì requests received primarily by email

Other duties as assigned

Required Technical Skills

Proficient with Windows operating system and applications ‚Äì email, online chat

High proficiency with MS Office Suite, high level MS Excel expertise

Solid computer keyboarding, multiple monitor, and touchpad skills

General understanding of various software and hardware. Citrix experience an asset

Required Soft Skills

Strong attention to detail with a commitment to quality

Fluency in English, spoken and written

Exceptional organization, planning and time management skills

Excellent customer service orientation

Proven ability to work under pressure and in a very fast paced environment

Ability to adapt based on rapidly changing client needs; high level of flexibility is required

Capacity to take initiative and think outside the box if necessary

Must be able to communicate professionally in a written and verbal capacity

Must be a team player and demonstrate a strong work ethic

Required Education And Experience

Business Administration or related field or a minimum of 1-year previous data processing / administrative experience preferably in a call center environment and/or any equivalent combination of education and experience.

Title: Business, Data Analytics and Insights Associate
Description:
HOW MIGHT YOU DEFY IMAGINATION?

The Amgen Capability Center in Lisbon, Portugal (ACCP), number 1 company in Best Workplaces - https://www.greatplacetowork.pt/ - ranking in Portugal (category 201-500 employees) by the Great Place to Work Institute. is home to over 300 talented people and more than 35 different nationalities, diverse areas of expertise and professional experience that are shaping the future of healthcare. This is your chance to explore a world of opportunities in different areas such as Cybersecurity, Data & Analytics, Digital, Technology and Innovation, Finance, General & Admin, Human Resources, Regulatory Affairs and many more. In Lisbon's city center, our AMGEN office fosters innovation, excellence, and inspiration. Come thrive with us at AMGEN, supporting our mission To Serve Patients. What we do at AMGEN matters in people‚Äôs lives.

Business, Data Analytics and Insights Senior Associate

LIVE

What You Will Do

You, as our Business, Data Analytics and Insights Associate, supports the delivery of day to day D&A activities. You are responsible for producing budgeting and planning reports, data analysis and supporting wider business Units within the ACCP.

Other responsibilities will include:


Supporting business planning and decision making through financial analysis.
Support long-term and short-term planning support activities.
Calculating scenarios based of expectations.
Collecting feedback and preparing communication plans to share outputs.
Taking ownership of complex calculations through understanding inputs and their relationships to the problem.
Upload, manage and store complex data.
Communicate competently with regional hubs.
Supporting ACCP continuous improvement activities.
Supporting wider business units on an ad hoc basis (Finance/FP&A/Business Enablement).


WIN

What We Expect Of You

Our ideal candidate is a team player with customer focus. He/she is problem solving and result oriented and has time and process management skills and can compile data.

Proven experience and skills needed:


University Degree in commerce, finance, economics, mathematics, healthcare or related field.
1+ years working in a finance/data related field ideally Data and Analytics.
Fluency in English, both in written and oral communication.
Strong Excel knowledge .


Preferred Requirements:


Working knowledge of IS systems (including demonstrated capability of other MS Office applications, SQL, Hyperion Pillar, Tableau, Anaplan).
Demonstrates a service-minded attitude.
Experience in the Pharmaceutical industry.
Clearly explains processes and procedures.
Fluency in multiple European languages.


THRIVE

What You Can Expect Of Us


Vast opportunities to learn, develop, and move up and across our global organization.
Diverse and inclusive community of belonging, where colleagues are empowered to bring ideas to the table, take risks, and act.
Generous Amgen Total Rewards Plan comprising healthcare, finance, wealth and career benefits.
Flexible work arrangements.


APPLY NOW

for a career that defies imagination

In our quest to serve patients above all else, Amgen is the first to imagine, and the last to doubt. Join us.

careers.amgen.com

EQUAL OPPORTUNITY STATEMENT

Amgen is an Equal Opportunity employer and will consider you without regard to your race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided a reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request an accommodation.

Title: Financial Resources Data Analyst
Description:
Keywords: Capital Markets, Risk Management, Trading Risk, Equities, Fixed Income, Currencies and Commodities, Data Analytics

About The Job

The Financial Resources Analytics is accountable for delivering excellence in all trading risk strategy activities we lead or oversee. This includes ensuring that these activities align with the Bank's objectives, client goals, approved risk appetites, and strategic priorities.

Your Main Activities Are


Assess and challenge the allocation and management of Risk and Resources (R&R) by the Business Lines (FICC) to ensure a strategic optimization of returns
Analyse Risk measures linked to capital consumption of Bank activities and ensure that return is optimised for capital allocation
Comply with all legal and regulatory requirements, and anticipate/ plan future regulatory changes, in relation to R&R management and capital allocation
Propose and implement solutions to facilitate new trades when BNPP‚Äôs risk appetite is reached
Identify and suggest innovative ideas to improve the Bank‚Äôs risk processes and reduce inaccuracies
Understand and monitor the main characteristics and concentrations of the risk portfolio managed by the team
Prepare periodic and ad-hoc reports on individual counterparties, sectors and/ or country crisis
Contribute to the reporting of the main risks and stress-tests across Global Markets
Maintain, improve and develop a toolbox for efficient risk management


Profile And Skills To Success


Master‚Äôs in Finance, Economics, Computer Science or Engineering
Interest in Financial Markets
Expertise with data analysis‚Äì Python, VBA and SQL (Strongly referred)
Ability to provide clear and concise analysis
Process oriented with a problem-solving mindset
Curiosity, Attention to detail and Autonomy
Ability to communicate clearly ‚Äì both oral and written forms
Fluency in English
Structured, methodical and organized approach to work


About The Team

The Global Equities and Fixed Income Currencies and Commodities (FICC) Trading Risk Strategy (TRS) Team is responsible for managing trading positions' risk and returns. To achieve this, we oversee the daily production of key position reports and stress tests for trading desks, as well as a weekly in-depth review of positions and Profit/ Loss (P&L) performance. Additionally, we participate in ad-hoc studies and deep dives to assess specific portfolio risks and expected returns, upon request.

Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centers providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Data Engineer Internship
Description:
Keywords: Data Analytics, ETL, Oriented programming, SQL, Tableau, git, python

Your Main Activities Are


Development, maintenance, and support of data processing and analytical stacks
Ensure architecture meets business requirements
Recommend ways to efficiently provide quality data
Develop data ETL processes in production environment
Leverage large volumes of data from internal sources
Help global markets to achieve digital transformations
Proof of concept data projects with innovative methods or tools


Profile And Skills To Success


Master in Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Electronic, Biomedical or similar Engineering Master
Knowledge with Python programming language (Java/C++/C# will be considered)
Proficient understanding of code versioning tools such as Git
Knowledge of SQL
Knowledge of Tableau
Knowledge and interest in financial markets
Strong communication and presentation skills both verbal and written
Effective problem solver and consensus builder
Team work and collaborative mind-set
Fluency in English


About The Team

The Global Client Analytics (GCA) team is responsible for providing data, insights and analysis to Global Markets front office on client activity. The team aims to build a solid database from various sources and develop analysis, reports and dashboards to provide valuable insight to the Front Office in a rapid, agile manner. The team in Lisbon is comprised of 9 members. The consumers of this data and analysis are over 1000 global Front Office users including Sales, Trading, Research and Senior Management. We are a global team, with presence in Europe, America, and Asia.

Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centers providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.

  • Commitment towards work/life balance

At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.

  • Remote Working Conditions

At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal

  • Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
  • In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Microsoft Business Intelligence
HTML:
Your Connection With Aubay Starts In The Following Lines

Aubay Portugal is a multinational French company, in Portugal since 2007. We have offices in Lisbon and Oporto and we are a specialized consultant in Management, Implementation, Development and Maintenance of Information Systems. We have more than 150 active partners and we operate in sectors such as banking, insurance, telecommunications, services, energy and transports.

What are you going to do?

  • Developing and implementing an overall organizational data strategy that aligns with business processes;
  • Supporting project proposals and providing technical expertise in Business Intelligence;
  • Designing and optimizing ETL processes using Power BI, SSRS, SSIS, and SSAS;
  • Managing data exports through Windows Services for regular reporting.

What are we looking for?

  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, or related fields (or at least 6 years of experience in Information Systems technologies);
  • Minimum of 4 years of experience in Business Intelligence projects, specifically working with: PowerBI, SSRS, SSIS, and SSAS;
  • Experience with (MXD)/ArcGIS;
  • Knowledge of data integration and interoperability through Web Services and/or APIs is a plus;
  • Proven experience in leading and coordinating BI projects;
  • Written and verbal communication skills in English (B2 mandatory);
  • Hybrid work model: 2 days home office, 3 days in-office (Venda Nova ‚Äì Cac√©m);
  • Residency in Portugal ‚Äì Citizenship or Work Visa/Residence Card (eliminatory factor).

What do we have to offer you?

  • Health Insurance;
  • Feedback&Coffee ‚Äì the system that includes Aubay‚Äôs Performance Management Cycle, with regular moments of feedback and the Career Progression Model;
  • Working model: hybrid/remote/on-site;
  • A Training Academy designed to think of you and your needs. You can count on technical and behavioural training sessions (e-Learning and classroom), Meet&Techs, Webinars and Mentoring;
  • Events and Teambuildings.

What makes us different?

  • Our organizational culture is based on values such as transparency, team spirit, regular feedback and continuous learning;
  • Reference prizes and birthday present;
  • We don‚Äôt have a dress code;
  • We know your name and all address each other informally;
  • You will grow in good company. Isn‚Äôt this one of the ways in which to develop professionally?

If we got your attention, we now hope to spark your enthusiasm. Ready for the first phase?

Personal Data collected by AUBAY PORTUGAL as Data Controller, regarding the identification, contact and professional capabilities of the candidates, in the present procedure, will be processed for the application analysis, having in consideration that the processing is conducted in order to to take the steps, at the request of the data subject, prior to entering into a contract;

Personal data sent through the present application will be kept by Aubay during the application procedure and will remain stored whilst updated (for one year period).

The collected data might be transferred or include other processing actitivites, as long as the data subject is informed, in the occurrence of a standard application and selection procedure, for the compliance of legal obligations for the time required by law.

For any queries or request regarding personal data protection rights, the Data Subject may contact AUBAY PORTUGAL‚Äôs headquarters in Avenida Duque D`√Åvila, n¬∫46 em Lisboa or use the DPO‚Äôs e-mail - dpo@aubay.pt. The Data Subject also has the right to file a complaint with the National Data Protection Authority ‚Äì www.cnpd.pt.

(please do not include data regarding racial or ethnical origins, political opinions, religion, philosophy, biometrical data, health data, sexual life and orientation, or relating to o criminal convictions and offences.)

Since 1998, our constant growth has been driven by our capacity for innovation. Today, we are morethan 7,500 people strong, spread across 21 offices in 7 European countries. We offer complete andpersonalized solutions, differentiating ourselves through our proximity and interaction with clients andthe management of our people. In Portugal, with headquarters in Lisbon and an office in Porto, we havemore than 1,450 employees, dedicated to more than 150 clients.

Title: Capital Portfolio Management Data Analyst
Description:
About The Job


The Resource & Portfolio Management (RPM) Team is part of the Securitised Product Group (SPG), which combines all securitisation and other risk distribution activities within Global Banking EMEA ‚Äì Capital Markets
The Securitisation Trade Manager is responsible for the booking of transactions and the management of their cash flows (calculation, monitoring of payments, etc.) and for their correct regulatory Capital calculation in the systems, to achieve optimum Capital savings for the bank
Acting as a point of contact with investors during the life of the transaction, as well as for regulatory reporting, the Securitisation Trade Manager will develop expertise in transaction management (Securitisation, SRT, Credit Default Swap, Credit Insurance) and most importantly in regulatory Capital of the Bank
The Candidate will work with data to assess the Capital savings on the transactions under management and should have an interest in learning Python/SQL languages. The Candidate will also be key to ensure that all the contractual commitments related to Resources & Portfolio Management transactions are fulfilled


Your Main Activities Are


Advisory role in pre-trade phase by actively liaising with the Origination and Structuring team, to assess the feasibility of a transaction
Booking of transactions in Front-Office systems
Perform monitoring and payment of invoices to Third Parties (Investors, Brokers and Insurers)
Calculate the correct Capital savings by ensuring the right Risk-Weighted Assets (RWA) are calculated during the quarterly Capital process
Perform quarterly updates of the capital structure of existing programs and quarterly coupon computation and validation, following instructions of underlying flow of funds
Identify claims based on rating triggers in underlying portfolios
Perform reporting to Validation Agent, Investors, Regulators, and internal stakeholders, acting as a point of contact for questions related to existing portfolios


Profile And Skills To Success


Master's degree in Engineering, Finance, Maths or Economics
Up to 3 years of relevant experience
Interest in VBA, Python, or data analytics tools such as SQL
Fluency in English both oral and written (mandatory)
Advanced knowledge of Office package (Excel)


#Hybrid

Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centers providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
A career in our Technology practice, will provide you with the opportunity to help clients seize essential advantages by working alongside business leaders to solve their toughest problems and capture their greatest opportunities.

The role - Data Engineer

Responsibilities

As a Data Engineer you will contribute to the design and build of required infrastructure to support optimal extraction, transformation, and load of data from various sources. Integration, setup, and maintenance of analytical tools. Pipeline maintenance, monitoring and performance. Your main responsibilities will include, but are not limited to:


Designing and delivering Azure data solutions across data strategy, ETL, analytics, and AI
Leading solution workshops and working hands-on with the latest Azure Data technologies
Building scalable, high-performance, and secure data platforms
Collaborating with Azure Architects and Engineers to deliver end-to-end enterprise solutions.


Your profile


You have completed a degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field
At least 2 years of professional experience in Data Engineering
Advanced proficiency in Python and SQL
Strong understanding of data modeling and data platform concepts
Expertise in both on-premises and cloud-based solutions
Hands-on experience with ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes and data quality engines
Proficient in Microsoft Azure technologies, such as Data Factory, Functions and ADL
Experience working with Databricks for big data processing and analytics
Certifications are an advantage: Azure Fundamentals, Azure Data Fundamentals, Azure Data Engineer Associate, Databricks Certified Data Engineer Associate / Professional.


We believe you have what it takes. Are you ready to join our ‚Äúcommunity of solvers‚Äù?

Be a part of The New Equation

‚ÄØ

Title: Data Analytics and Business Intelligence expert (M/W)
Description:
Company Description

VANTIVA, headquartered in Paris, France and formerly known as Technicolor, is a global technology leader in designing, developing and supplying innovative products and solutions that connect consumers around the world to the content and services they love ‚Äì whether at home, at work or in other smart spaces.

VANTIVA has also earned a solid reputation for optimizing supply chain performance by leveraging its decades-long expertise in high-precision manufacturing, logistics, fulfilment and distribution. With operations throughout the Americas, Asia Pacific and EMEA, VANTIVA is recognized as a strategic partner by leading firms across various vertical industries, including network service providers, software companies and video game creators for over 25 years.

Our relationships with the film and entertainment industry goes back over 100 years by providing end-to-end solutions for our clients. VANTIVA is committed to the highest standards of corporate social responsibility and sustainability across all aspects of their operations.

For more information, please visit www.vantiva.com

Job Description

The BI expert will contribute to all aspects of BI development, covering Vantiva applications and supporting the implementation of the data strategy roadmap.

This role is critical in designing, developing, and maintaining data warehousing, reporting solutions, and BI applications. It requires a strong foundation in business intelligence, analytics, and functional expertise to interpret business requirements effectively.

The candidate will drive solution design, customization, and development to resolve issues, enhance existing solutions, and deliver new business intelligence capabilities.

The ideal candidate thrives in complex technical environments, enjoys problem-solving, and is passionate about data and analytics.

Key Responsibilities


Align and implement data architecture to support data analytics, reporting needs, and business planning requirements.
Ensure BI system health and performance by proposing, implementing, and monitoring best practices.
Maintain data reliability across all layers of the data platform and satellite systems.
Develop best practices for data visualization, dashboarding, planning, analytics, and application architecture.
Conduct root cause analysis and provide recommendations to leadership to mitigate risks and improve efficiency.
Ensure compliance with core solution principles and industry regulations for data handling and reporting.
Implement and maintain data security measures to protect sensitive information.
Handle user support requests, prioritizing them based on business impact.
Perform necessary system configurations and developments as needed.
Collaborate extensively with business stakeholders to understand reporting & analytics needs and deliver solutions that meet their requirements.


Qualifications


Highly motivated, proactive, and a self-starter with a strong sense of ownership.
Strong experience in analyzing, diagnosing, designing, planning, executing, and evaluating BI solutions while meeting time, cost, and quality targets.
Excellent verbal and written communication, interpersonal, and documentation skills.
10+ years of experience in data foundation, data management, data governance, and insights generation.
Senior-level expertise in SAP BI architecture and development tools, with a focus on BW/4HANA.
Hands-on experience with BW/4HANA, IP/BPC, SAC, BODS, BOBJ (Webi), and Analysis for Excel.
Exposure to HANA administration, including data provisioning, data tiering, security, and performance optimization.
Proficiency in ABAP development is required (programs, functions, object classes, WebDynpro).
Strong SQL skills with experience in query performance tuning.
Knowledge of MS Power BI, Azure Data Lake, and Data Factory is an advantage.
Databricks experience is a strong plus completed by a proficiency in Python.


Additional Information

The position is located in Lisbon, Portugal.

Our most important asset is our People

Vantiva‚Äôs success greatly relies on our people‚Äôs energy, motivation, and talent.

We are dedicated to cultivating a workforce that embraces and celebrates diversity as we believe our differences drive our creativity, and innovation.

We are proactive in supporting equality and maintaining an inclusive work environment, developing, and enhancing career opportunities for all.

If you require a reasonable accommodation at any step of the application process, please let us know by answering the dedicated question in this application form.

Title: Data Understanding Specialist - (Third Party Associate) - Arabic Market- Portugal
Description:
Responsibilities

Important Note: Please be advised that this job posting is for informational purposes only. This is a 6 month temporary assignment managed by HYLegal. All contractual terms, including payroll and benefits, will be handled by HYLegal. By applying, you agree that the information provided in your application may be processed for recruitment purposes, shared with the third-party agency, and other purposes in accordance with ByteDance's Applicant Privacy Notice https://sf16-sg.tiktokcdn.com/obj/eden-sg/uvyloeh7vhonuhf/privacy/ByteDance_Global_Applicant_Privacy_Notice.pdf

TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok's global headquarters are in Los Angeles and Singapore, and its offices include New York, London, Dublin, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo.

Why Join Us

Creation is the core of TikTok's purpose. Our platform is built to help imaginations thrive. This is doubly true of the teams that make TikTok possible.

Together, we inspire creativity and bring joy - a mission we all believe in and aim towards achieving every day.

To us, every challenge, no matter how difficult, is an opportunity; to learn, to innovate, and to grow as one team. Status quo? Never. Courage? Always.

At TikTok, we create together and grow together. That's how we drive impact - for ourselves, our company, and the communities we serve.

Join us.

The Global Monetization Integrity team ensures safe and quality experiences for Advertisers to enable TikTok in its mission to inspire joy and creativity. The team is responsible for creating scalable and reliable solutions that allow TikTok Advertisers and businesses to interact in a trustworthy manner, always working to anticipate and protect against threats. They will do so by creating ad policies, managing content review processes, and more.

We are looking for talented multi-lingual individuals to join our team in Lisbon, Portugal. Whether you have existing experience in our industry or not, our expert teams will give you all the tools and support you need to learn how to grow your career in this incredibly important part of TikTok. In return, you'll help support the build up of ML capabilities for better advertising products. Watch your ambitions become reality as your inspiration brings infinite opportunities at TikTok.

This position will be responsible for meeting the Risk and Moderation demands. This means, as Global Operations Specialist, you will review & moderate advertisements entering the TikTok platform. By doing so, this will mitigate any risk to our community by supporting advertisers proactively, and effectively addressing violations of MI Policies.

Main Responsibilities


SOP Clarification and Training:
Work with the BPs to clarify and eliminate ambiguities in the requirements/SOPs
Provide simplified and straightforward tasks to labellers
Deliver training to labellers for complex requirements
Quality Improvement and Assurance:
Constantly monitor and review the quality of the labelled data
Identify the root cause of any issues and take appropriate remedial actions such as simplify or disambiguate the - - SOPs or provide additional training
Identify opportunities or areas for improvement for key metrics and propose experiments to support initiatives
Project Management:
Ensure timely delivery of projects
Coordinate effectively with key stakeholders
Provide project visibility and progress updates to stakeholders through data


Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:


Fluent in written and spoken required language plus business level English
1-3 years experience in operation for a tech or social media company data analytic experience but graduates also highly welcomed
Proficiency in data interpretation and analysis; Understanding of AI and Machine Learning concepts, particularly as they relate to data labelling is a plus
Excellent verbal and written communication skills for clear and effective communication with both requestors and labellers
Strong abilities in simplifying complex instructions and requirements, along with robust experience in training in a technical context
Experience in project management with strong organizational skills to manage multiple tasks concurrently, preferably in a data-intensive environment


Preferred Qualifications


Strong analytical and problem-solving skills to identify and resolve issues
Strong technical skills in SQL and scripting languages (Python, R) are a plus
Fluency in English (written and verbal) and an additional language


TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.
Show more

Title: BI Microsoft Consultant
Description:
We are Landskill and we are looking for new members to join our team.

If you‚Äôre reading this, you already know you want to change your professional life and you have landed in the right place. What are we looking for?

People who love technology and, above all, love to learn.

And we get it - keeping our team motivated and happy is the key to staying successful.

That‚Äôs why we‚Äôre so dedicated to making sure our work environment is always a top priority. Do you want to work in a transparent company with opportunities tailored to you?

If you‚Äôre a BI Microsoft Consultant and want to be part of a team working to grow together, we‚Äôre actively looking for you. What we‚Äôre looking for: Previous experience as a BI Developer Proficiency with PowerBI Solid knowledge of SSAS / SSIS / SSRS Experience with Oracle or a similar database Expertise in data modeling and exploration Experience in data warehouse Fluent in spoken and written English What we offer: Close-knit culture based on empathy and inclusion, with guidance from management teams Training and professional/personal development program, along with a career plan tailored to you Feedback culture and performance management system with regular meetings We value new ideas and identifying areas for improvement, so your opinion matters to us Events to get to know each other better and foster team spirit Referral program rewarding your contribution to the team's growth and success The chance to scale your career as a BI Developer Powered by JazzHR

Title: Data Engineer
HTML:

Ent√£o a Deloitte √© para ti. Aqui, vais ter a possibilidade de potenciar a tua carreira e de refor√ßar as tuas compet√™ncias no nosso universo tecnol√≥gico.

Somos um Tech Hub internacional e estamos √† procura dos melhores especialistas em Data para se juntarem aos nossos centros de excel√™ncia e √† nossa comunidade. Na Deloitte, vais transformar o mundo como o conhecemos e desenvolver solu√ß√µes √∫nicas e inovadoras nos mais variados e complexos projetos de transforma√ß√£o, de Portugal para o mundo. Vamos refor√ßar a nossa √°rea de Data&AI, que tem suportado milhares de clientes na evolu√ß√£o/cria√ß√£o das suas plataformas de dados, anal√≠tica e IA e, por isso, procuramos profissionais experientes que tenham gosto e aptid√£o natural para trabalhar em equipa e em ambiente multi-projeto. Podes descobrir todas as fun√ß√µes que vais desempenhar, de acordo com o teu perfil, para assim dares um salto na tua carreira!

Juntas-te a n√≥s? Estamos √† tua espera.

O teu dia a dia ser√° composto por v√°rios desafios, dos quais podemos elencar alguns:

  • Desenho e implementa√ß√£o de Arquiteturas de Dados escal√°veis utilizando tecnologias de ponta com um foco na Cloud (Azure, GCP, AWS, Alibaba Cloud);
  • Extrair, transformar e carregar (ETL) grandes volumes de dados de diversas fontes para Datalakes e Data Warehouses;
  • Defini√ß√£o e implementa√ß√£o de processos para controlo e tratamento de dados (Data Quality, Profiling, Cleansing, Masking, entre outros);
  • Desenho e implementa√ß√£o de solu√ß√µes real-time;
  • Colaborar com v√°rios stakeholders em projetos nacionais e internacionais;
  • Colaborar com m√∫ltiplos colegas da rede Deloitte, tirando partido do conhecimento e projetos internacionais que j√° decorreram e que est√£o a decorrer;
  • Assumir gradualmente a coordena√ß√£o de equipas t√©cnicas e funcionais no √¢mbito de projetos de dados;
  • Propor novas ideias e criar provas de conceito para diferentes desafios.


Procuramos profissionais com algumas das val√™ncias abaixo:

  • Licenciatura/ Mestrado nas √°reas de Engenharia Inform√°tica, Engenharia Eletrot√©cnica e de Computadores, Matem√°tica ou √°reas similares;
  • Experi√™ncia profissional entre 1 e 6 anos em projetos de Data;
  • Conhecimento de processos de desenvolvimento de software;
  • Conhecimentos de SQL / NoSQL;
  • Experi√™ncia profissional em solu√ß√µes ETL (exemplos: Azure Data Fabric, AWS Glue, FiveTran, DBT, Talend, Matillion, Databricks);
  • Conhecimentos em Python, PySpark;
  • Experi√™ncia em solu√ß√µes da Data Visualization (exemplo: Power BI, Tableau, Microstrategy, Looker, Grafana, Qlik);
  • Valorizamos experi√™ncia profissional com Data Warehouses / Data Lakes / Data Lakehouses;
  • Conhecimento de solu√ß√µes Cloud (AWS, Azure, GCP, Alibaba Cloud) orientadas a arquiteturas de dados distribu√≠dos;
  • Valorizamos experi√™ncia profissional em solu√ß√µes/tecnologias Real-time (exemplos, Kafka, Apache Flink, Apache Spark, Amazon Kinesis, Azure Data Stream, MongoDB, outras);
  • Valorizamos experi√™ncia previa em projetos com metodologias Agile;
  • Dom√≠nio da l√≠ngua inglesa falado e escrito (obrigat√≥rio);
  • Valorizamos tamb√©m profissionais que tenham conhecimentos de l√≠ngua francesa e alem√£.
  • Valorizamos certifica√ß√µes orientadas aos projetos de dados;

  • Boas capacidades de comunica√ß√£o, relacionamento interpessoal e trabalho em equipa;
  • Sentido de responsabilidade, sentido cr√≠tico, curiosidade.


Desenvolve uma carreira √† tua medida

  • Atrav√©s de um plano de desenvolvimento de carreira personalizado (skills/ oportunidades t√©cnicas e funcionais), adequado ao momento, √†s tuas necessidades e objetivos;
  • Participando em projetos nacionais e internacionais, com dimens√£o e impacto relevante nesta √°rea de especializa√ß√£o;

Vive uma cultura de uni√£o

  • Uma cultura de inova√ß√£o e excel√™ncia que nos torna l√≠deres e precursores de tend√™ncias;
  • Um ambiente amig√°vel, de respeito, confian√ßa, transpar√™ncia e informalidade;

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
We are Landskill and we are looking for new members to join our team.

If you‚Äôre reading this, you already know you want to change your professional life and you have landed in the right place. What are we looking for?

People who love technology and, above all, love to learn.

And we get it - keeping our team motivated and happy is the key to staying successful.

That‚Äôs why we‚Äôre so dedicated to making sure our work environment is always a top priority. Do you want to work in a transparent company with opportunities tailored to you?

Just make sure you have the right skill, and guarantee the perfect project to scale your career. If you‚Äôre a Data Engineer and want to be part of a team working to grow together, we‚Äôre actively looking for you. What we‚Äôre looking for: Experience in programming with Python, Java, or Scala Experience in data integration and ETL tools Experience in cloud environments (AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud Platform) Experience with SQL Fluent in spoken and written English What we offer: Close-knit culture based on empathy and inclusion, with guidance from management teams Training and professional/personal development program, along with a career plan tailored to you Feedback culture and performance management system with regular meetings We value new ideas and identifying areas for improvement, so your opinion matters to us Events to get to know each other better and foster team spirit Referral program rewarding your contribution to the team's growth and success Powered by JazzHR

Title: Data Understanding Specialist - (Third Party Associate) - Spanish Market- Portugal
Description:
Responsibilities

Important Note: Please be advised that this job posting is for informational purposes only. This is a 6 month temporary assignment managed by HYLegal. All contractual terms, including payroll and benefits, will be handled by HYLegal. By applying, you agree that the information provided in your application may be processed for recruitment purposes, shared with the third-party agency, and other purposes in accordance with ByteDance's Applicant Privacy Notice https://sf16-sg.tiktokcdn.com/obj/eden-sg/uvyloeh7vhonuhf/privacy/ByteDance_Global_Applicant_Privacy_Notice.pdf

TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok's global headquarters are in Los Angeles and Singapore, and its offices include New York, London, Dublin, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo.

Why Join Us

Creation is the core of TikTok's purpose. Our platform is built to help imaginations thrive. This is doubly true of the teams that make TikTok possible.

Together, we inspire creativity and bring joy - a mission we all believe in and aim towards achieving every day.

To us, every challenge, no matter how difficult, is an opportunity; to learn, to innovate, and to grow as one team. Status quo? Never. Courage? Always.

At TikTok, we create together and grow together. That's how we drive impact - for ourselves, our company, and the communities we serve.

Join us.

The Global Monetization Integrity team ensures safe and quality experiences for Advertisers to enable TikTok in its mission to inspire joy and creativity. The team is responsible for creating scalable and reliable solutions that allow TikTok Advertisers and businesses to interact in a trustworthy manner, always working to anticipate and protect against threats. They will do so by creating ad policies, managing content review processes, and more.

We are looking for talented multi-lingual individuals to join our team in Lisbon, Portugal. Whether you have existing experience in our industry or not, our expert teams will give you all the tools and support you need to learn how to grow your career in this incredibly important part of TikTok. In return, you'll help support the build up of ML capabilities for better advertising products. Watch your ambitions become reality as your inspiration brings infinite opportunities at TikTok.

This position will be responsible for meeting the Risk and Moderation demands. This means, as Global Operations Specialist, you will review & moderate advertisements entering the TikTok platform. By doing so, this will mitigate any risk to our community by supporting advertisers proactively, and effectively addressing violations of MI Policies.

Main Responsibilities


SOP Clarification and Training:
Work with the BPs to clarify and eliminate ambiguities in the requirements/SOPs
Provide simplified and straightforward tasks to labellers
Deliver training to labellers for complex requirements
Quality Improvement and Assurance:
Constantly monitor and review the quality of the labelled data
Identify the root cause of any issues and take appropriate remedial actions such as simplify or disambiguate the - - SOPs or provide additional training
Identify opportunities or areas for improvement for key metrics and propose experiments to support initiatives
Project Management:
Ensure timely delivery of projects
Coordinate effectively with key stakeholders
Provide project visibility and progress updates to stakeholders through data


Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:


Fluent in written and spoken required language plus business level English
1-3 years experience in operation for a tech or social media company data analytic experience but graduates also highly welcomed
Proficiency in data interpretation and analysis; Understanding of AI and Machine Learning concepts, particularly as they relate to data labelling is a plus
Excellent verbal and written communication skills for clear and effective communication with both requestors and labellers
Strong abilities in simplifying complex instructions and requirements, along with robust experience in training in a technical context
Experience in project management with strong organizational skills to manage multiple tasks concurrently, preferably in a data-intensive environment


Preferred Qualifications


Strong analytical and problem-solving skills to identify and resolve issues
Strong technical skills in SQL and scripting languages (Python, R) are a plus
Fluency in English (written and verbal) and an additional language


TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.
Show more

Title: Cloud Engineer | Remote
Description:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people.


Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people.

With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:


DECSKILL TALENT: We believe that our people are key to our success.Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients.


We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.


DECSKILL BOOST: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.
DECSKILL CONNECT: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.We are looking for a Cloud Engineer.Responsibilities:Ensure high availability, resiliency and efficiency of the hosting platform.Develop tools and infrastructure to deploy, monitor and manage production and non-productions services.Ensure delivered solutions are optimized for ease of use, reusability and scalability.Ensure implementations and development activities always lead towards enriching knowledge base documentation, design details, usage, maintenance, configuration and deployment notes.Be comfortable working with agile framework, scrum or kanbanBe available for a 24x7 shift rotation on as needed basis.Requirements:7+ years of experience in software development or operations.3+ years of experience in cloud platform (AWS or Azure or hybrid Cloud Environments).Experience with Kubernetes/Docker.Expertise in DevOps, CI/CD or SRE environments .Advanced knowledge of best practices and experience in code-based configuration, IaC, load-balancing, auto-scaling, monitoring, alerting, networking and problem-solving in a cloud environment.Demonstrated ability to design and implement automation infrastructure solutions.Proficient in any programming language, but be comfortable with learning a new language (Golang).Background in highly-available distributed systems.


The candidate should be able to understand and be able to debug asynchronous systems that use reactive messaging patterns and know how to use distributed debugging tools.Proficiency in English.If you're interested in this job please send your CV in English to ****** with reference "CC/CE)".Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
There are NO limits to your career: come shape the future and be part of a truly unique global culture at OutSystems!

About This Role

We are looking for a Data Analyst to transform data, reports, and analysis into business insights, as a crucial support to OutSystems‚Äô decision-making fueled by Data. As such, this means someone who executes with technical acumen and data products mindset, strives to understand challenges using a business perspective and effectively collaborates with others.

You will be part of the Data Science and Analytics team, at the heart of the decision-making at OutSystems, with a special focus on our Go-to-Market strategies. Besides partnering with company stakeholders, you will collaborate within a broader Data Area that covers Data Engineering, Data Architecture, Data platform management, and Analytics Enablement.

You should have strong foundations in Data Analysis and reporting, evidence critical reasoning and the ability to derive conclusions from Data. OutSystems data lake is large and covering multiple dimensions, and you must be able to navigate it and collaborate with others to extract the most of it.

What You Will Do Or Key Responsibilities


Craft compelling and impactful data visualizations, interactive dashboards, data narratives to communicate complex analysis results and insights.
Create and maintain BI reporting based on a variety of systems and data, leveraging technology to scale the team‚Äôs efforts, increasing efficiency and output using data visualization tools such as Power BI and/or Shiny;
Conduct Advanced Data Analysis and modeling, while guaranteeing the quality of data for analyses;
Work with stakeholders to understand their real business needs, acting as a Strategic Advisor to the business.
Collaborate with Data Engineering and Architecture to design and optimize our data lake, to enable more efficient analyses and Analytics Self-Service solutions


Qualifications / What You Need To Succeed (Hiring manager provides)


2+ years experience as a Data Analyst;
MSc in Mathematics, Computer Science Informatics (or a related field) or equivalent experience;
Experience working with at least one visual BI analytical tool (Power BI preferential);
Proficiency in using query languages such as SQL;
Knowledge of R or Python programming language for data analysis. Experience with Shiny is a plus;
Critical thinking: explore data, identify trends and come to new conclusions based on findings, in a business focused way;
Communication skills: empathy and active listening; good presentation skills with clear speaking, easily communicating complex ideas;
Collaborate with a cross-functional team (Data Engineering, Data Architecture, Data platform management, and Analytics Enablement).


The Longer Story

OutSystems is a global leader transforming how companies innovate through software, empowering IT leaders with a better way to build the software that matters most.We are looking for talented and motivated people to join us in helping companies solve some of their most strategic business challenges, from modernizing their workplace processes to transforming their employee and customer experiences. As a member of the OutSystems global team, you will help build, deliver, manage, and evolve the software that is a low-code market leader and preferred by professional developers around the world.

OutSystems is a truly global company, with more than 800,000 developer community members, 1,700 employees, more than 500 partners, and thousands of active customers in over 75 countries and across 21 industries. Founded in 2001, OutSystems has offices in the United States, United Kingdom, the Netherlands, Portugal, Germany, the UAE, Japan, Hong Kong, Malaysia, Australia, India, and Singapore, and of course has a thriving, worldwide community of remote employees.

Working at OutSystems

Our goal is to ensure that OutSystems is a place for bright, happy, and motivated people who share a common purpose and take pride in excellent work towards our vision. Our culture is focused on building agility at scale, which allows us to operate with a high drive in a competitive market. In our federation of teams culture, if we have every team operating like a startup, we can all learn, grow, and innovate while having the space to be proactive and creative. We encourage our team members to collaborate, focus on results, act quickly, understand our business, and adopt a growth mindset.

What do we have to offer you?


A company that continues to grow, change, and innovate, and gives our teams the space to be proactive and creative.
Real career opportunities. We care about growth and development. Vertical career progression is an obvious possibility, but we also offer the possibility for lateral moves, joining different teams, and mastering specific skills.
Work colleagues that are as smart, hardworking and driven as you ‚Äì and a team that is global.
Disrupting the status quo is in our DNA. In fact, it‚Äôs why our company exists.
We ‚ÄúAsk Why‚Äù a lot. It helps us connect our individual work to the bigger picture and sometimes even uncover a better way.


Are you ready for the next step in your career? Then we‚Äôd love to hear from you!

OutSystems nurtures an inclusive culture of diversity, where everyone feels empowered to be their authentic self and perform at their best. A company that embraces the creativity and innovation that comes through diverse perspectives. We are committed to creating a team that reflects society through inclusive programs and initiatives and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants receive equal consideration regardless of race, place of origin, color, age, marital status, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender expression or identity, protected veteran status, disability status or any other status protected by law.

Join us in disrupting the status quo of the low-code market, we give you the power to "Ask Why", you give our customers the power to innovate through software!
Show more

Title: Junior Data Analyst Trainee
Description:
About The Job


As Chief Operating Officer (COO) team, we assist our different business team in multiple topics, both on daily/monthly needs as in project mode. Within the COO team we have a small team of data scientists focusing on data, who are involved in the data use cases from exploration phase up to production delivery.
We are looking for a junior business data analyst to join the COO team to provide assistance in the automation of our business monitoring reports and enhance and leverage our data capabilities.


Your Main Activities Are


Automate business dashboards as prototypes and prepare them to be put in production, working closely with the team¬¥s data analysts
Report to Top line TB Management and TB COO on all data queries and data needs.
Contribute to the development and governance of our data and support the different business lines with data-driven decision-making
Meet different stakeholders to frame their data needs, based on your findings collect the necessary data, process the data, and turn it into meaningful tools meeting the requirements expressed by the teams
Participate and interact with inter-disciplinary teams (IT, Business, Operations) and contribute to the improvement and streamlining of data systems within the company to drive innovation


Profile And Skills To Success


Academic background in Data Analytics, Computer Science, Information Management, Business Intelligence, Business, Economics or Mathematics
Fluency in English
Highly proficient with MS Excel
Ability to quickly comprehend new software tools and learn how to use them optimally
Great attention to detail
Excellent interpersonal, communication and influence skills
Good conceptualization skills and data exposure
Open, curious and eager to learn and discover day to day banking products


Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union's leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.
