Why joining BNP Paribas?

  • Leading banking institution

BNP Paribas is the European Union's leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.

  • Our presence in Portugal

In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.

  • International reach

Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions

  • Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
  • Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
  • Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
  • Diversity and Inclusion commitment

BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.

  • Commitment towards work/life balance

At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.

  • Remote Working Conditions

At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal

  • Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
  • In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
At Arkadium our purpose is to have fun while creating fun - and that‚Äôs exactly what we‚Äôve been doing for 20 years. We‚Äôre the creators behind the world‚Äôs most-played games. From the Solitaire that came on your Windows machine, to hundreds of other games you‚Äôve come to know and love - you can find our games on Arkadium.com, iOS, Android, and lots of other big sites worldwide.

As a proud Evergreen business our values of Fierce Drive, Positive Energy and Living Full Lives are the driving force behind how we run and the choices we make.

We‚Äôre privately held (aka stable and reasonable about growth), founder-led (aka passionate about our craft) and we consistently rank as a ‚ÄúBest Place to Work‚Äù (aka not your typical games company).

Interested in becoming an Arkadian? We‚Äôd love to hear from you!




Overview




As a Data Analyst, you will play a crucial role in connecting business strategy with data-driven insights. You will work closely with cross-functional teams, including Product, Marketing, and Operations, to analyze key metrics, interpret trends, and develop actionable recommendations that drive business growth. Beyond technical skills, we seek a candidate who can bridge the gap between data and decision-making, ensuring that insights translate into impactful business strategies.




What You‚Äôll Do:




Conduct ad-hoc analyses using statistical methods to answer business-critical questions.
Interpret and translate data findings into actionable recommendations for stakeholders.
Define and own data processes, from event tracking and data collection to building structured datasets and dashboards.
Develop and maintain data visualizations and reports to communicate insights clearly and effectively.
Collaborate with Product, Marketing, and other business units to identify data needs and align analytics efforts with company objectives.
Ensure data integrity and accuracy through proactive auditing, validation, and monitoring.
Work with engineering and data teams to enhance data pipelines, implement tracking strategies, and optimize data models.




What You Bring:




Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field (or equivalent experience).
3+ years of experience in a data analyst or similar role.
Strong analytical mindset with expertise in statistical methods and hypothesis testing.
Proficiency in SQL for querying and data manipulation.
Experience with Python and/or R for data analysis, modeling, and automation.
Ability to communicate complex data concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Strong business acumen with a problem-solving mindset to drive data-backed decisions.




Preferred Qualifications:




Experience in web analytics and understanding of website performance metrics.
Familiarity with cloud-based infrastructure (e.g., Azure).
Experience with BI tools (Power BI, Tableau) for data visualization.
Hands-on experience with Databricks or other big data processing platforms.
Knowledge of A/B testing methodologies and marketing analytics.




Why Join Arkadium?




High-Impact Role ‚Äì Work at the intersection of strategy, execution, and technology, influencing the company‚Äôs trajectory.
Fast-Paced, High-Growth Environment ‚Äì No two days are the same. You'll be challenged, stretched, and given autonomy to make an impact.
Leadership & Growth Opportunity ‚Äì Manage a small but high-impact team and take ownership of critical company initiatives.
Collaborative, Agile Culture ‚Äì We move fast, work hard, and have fun while doing it.
Shape the Future ‚Äì Be part of a company that is redefining browser gaming and driving innovation in the space.




Benefits




Competitive compensation with structured performance and career development check-ins.
Meaningful health insurance.
Meal allowance.
Personal development budget to fuel your passions and desire to learn (Arkadians are taking classes in not only Excel and leadership, but also interior design and even swimming!)
Additional budget for conferences you are interested in.
Professional Coaching Budget .
Time off from Christmas Eve through New Year's Day so we can all enjoy the holidays.
Summer Fridays: 4 Fridays off throughout the Summer to have more fun in the sun.
A unique culture of transparency, true teamwork and fun.




This role is open to candidates based in Portugal. Business hours are 9-18 WEST (UTC+1). For candidates based in the Lisbon area, this role will transition to a hybrid model, requiring in-person presence. For candidates located outside the Lisbon area in Portugal, a different cadence of in-person presence may apply, depending on proximity.

Title: Full Stack Data Analyst - Critical Data Products
Description:
We're searching for a talented Data Analyst to join our growing Critical Data Products team. This team is pivotal in delivering and enhancing high-quality, robust data solutions that underpin Pleo‚Äôs essential data-driven products and operations. You will directly impact our customers by supporting critical business areas with insightful analytics and self-serve data tools.

You‚Äôll be part of the broader Product Hub within the Data competence, collaborating with a multidisciplinary team across a broad range of product and operational related data initiatives.

You will thrive in this role if you:


Are an experienced Data Analyst with a strong background in analytics, data visualization, and insight generation within a fast-paced environment, preferably fintech
Possess advanced SQL skills and experience with data modeling tools, particularly dbt and BigQuery
Have extensive experience with data visualization tools, specifically Looker and LookML
Are passionate about building high-quality, robust, and user-friendly dashboards and tools for diverse stakeholders
Are committed to ensuring the reliability and accuracy of data and data products, critical in a fintech setting
Possess an understanding of business and product strategy, and how data can support it
Demonstrate a strong sense of ownership and responsibility for your work
Are familiar with CI/CD processes and understand their importance in maintaining data integrity
Have experience in financial operations, payments, credit and/or compliance.
Possess a solid understanding of data privacy principles and governance practices


What will you be doing:


Run analyses with data, present and automate insights and recommendations to business stakeholders
Empowering our internal teams at Pleo with high-quality, self-serve data through the development and maintenance of dashboards and reports in Looker
Support in the development and delivery of reporting for external purposes
Identifying opportunities to improve operational efficiencies and product performance using data and analytics
Collaborating with cross-functional stakeholders to define data requirements, uncover trends, and identify opportunities for product enhancement
Engaging with data colleagues and peers to foster a culture of cross-team learning and knowledge sharing


Your colleagues say you


Are an effective bridge-builder who creates strong partnerships across data, engineering, product, and business teams
Balance innovation and pragmatism, knowing when to go deep and when to deliver quickly
Are a trusted mentor who uplifts and develops those around you
Actively seek and share knowledge, contributing to a culture of continuous learning
Have a knack for bringing people together and aligning them towards shared goals
Are someone they‚Äôd love to have coffee with (virtual or not)


Show me the benefits!


Your own Pleo card (no more out-of-pocket spending!)
Lunch is on us - with catering in our Lisbon, Copenhagen and London offices or a monthly lunch allowance paid directly together with your salary in other markets üçú
Private health insurance to ensure you‚Äôre fit in body and mind to do your best work
We offer 25 days of holiday + your public holidays
Flexibility/remote working options
Option to purchase 5 additional days of holiday through a salary sacrifice
We‚Äôre trialling MyndUp to give our employees access to free mental health and wellbeing support with great success so far ‚ù§Ô∏è‚Äçü©π
Access to LinkedIn Learning - acquire new skills, stay abreast of industry trends and fuel your personal and professional development continuously
Paid parental leave - we want to make sure that we're supportive of families and help you feel that you don't have to compromise your family due to work üë∂


Why join us?

Working at Pleo means you're working on something very exciting: the future of work. Our mission is to help every company go beyond the books. Pleo itself means ‚Äòmore than you‚Äôd expect‚Äô, and it‚Äôs been the secret to our success over the last 8 years. So it‚Äôs only fitting that we‚Äôd pass this philosophy onto our customers to help them make the most of their finances.

We think company spending should be delegated to all employees and teams, that it should be as automated as possible, and that it should drive a culture of responsible spending. Finance teams shouldn‚Äôt be siloed from the rest of the organisation ‚Äì they should work in unity with marketing, sales, IT and everyone else.

Speaking of working in unity, our values tell the story of how we work at Pleo. We have four core values, the first of which is ‚Äòchampion the customer‚Äô, which means we address real pain points that businesses face. Next up is ‚Äòsucceed as a team‚Äô, which highlights how our strength lies in our diversity and trust in each other. We also ‚Äòmake it happen‚Äô by taking bold decisions and following through to deliver results. Last but not least, we ‚Äòbuild to scale‚Äô, creating lasting solutions that address today‚Äôs challenges and anticipate tomorrow‚Äôs needs.

So, in a nutshell, that's Pleo. Today we are a 850+ team, from over 100 nations, sitting in our Copenhagen HQ, London, Stockholm, Berlin, Madrid, Montreal and Lisbon offices ‚Äîand quite a few full-time remotes in 35 other countries! Being HQ'd out of Copenhagen means we're inspired by things like a good work-life balance. If you don't work in the office with us, we'll help you set up the best remote setup possible and make sure you still have time to connect with your team.

About Your Application


Please submit your application in English; it‚Äôs our company language so you‚Äôll be speaking lots of it if you join üíï
We treat all candidates equally: If you are interested please apply through our application system - any correspondence should come from there! Our lovely support isn't able to pass on any calls/ emails our way - and this makes sure that the candidate experience is smooth and fair to everyone üòä
We‚Äôre on a mission to make everyone feel valued at work. That‚Äôs only achievable if our team reflects the diversity of the world around us - and that starts with you, hitting apply, even if you are worried you might not tick all the boxes! We embrace and encourage people from all backgrounds to apply - regardless of race/ethnicity, colour, religion, nationality, gender, sex, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, neurodiversity, socio-economic status, culture or beliefs
When you submit an application we process your personal data as a data processor. Find out more about how your data is used in the FAQs section at the bottom of our jobs page

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Keywords: Capital Markets, FX Payments, Digital, Client Engagement

Your Main Activities Are

The purpose of the role is to Drive the Business Intelligence for FX+, including (but not limited to) reporting on the activity, tracking of the business case, management of the Revenue Sharing Agreements, pricing and booking models enhancements, business development and tracking of the operational quality


Monitor the FX Payments activity and the revenue sharing
Monitor activity KPIs (volumes, revenues, pricing ) for all geographies / clients
Manage revenue sharing with TB / DM / IRB partners
Track the FX+ platform performance and operational quality
Support the business development with accurate ad-hoc data analysis (pricing analysis, campaigns targeting and follow-up)
Build a state of the art industrial "Client Intelligence" solution
Establish key metrics, reports and alerts and requirements in terms of digital business performance, in close collaboration with the businesses, to measure activity and revenues
Contribute to the management of the product roadmap for Client Intelligence (extension to new activities, new countries, new client segments and needs )


Profile And Skills To Success


Academic background in Engineering, Mathematics, Finance, Economics or similar areas
Experience in a similar Business Intelligence
An overall understanding and interest in the financial world
Strong appetite for Digital technologies, support and foster a culture of continuous improvement
Experienced in defining and sponsoring projects and project management: business case and scoping study, management of the delivery along with Business Lines / IT / Operations
Fluency in English
Excellent communication skills and client focus
Strong team work while being able to work autonomously
Ability to work under tight deadlines and organisational skills
Strong Excel knowledge
Tableau, PowerBI and other IT coding Skills - (Intermediate)


About The Team

The FX Payments activity is a key area of growth for Global Markets. In order to support and accelerate that growth an electronic platform (FX+) has been designed. FX+ is delivering automated FX solutions to support other BNPP business lines such as Cash Management, Trade Finance, Correspondent Banking, who require FX to deliver transactional services to their clients.


FX+ Payments is a platform that manages the execution of FX within International Payments
(i.e. Payment + FX in one transaction)
FX+ is successfully implemented in ca 40 countries across Europe, MEA, APAC and North America ; it is globally generating a very significant stream of revenues for BNP Paribas
FX+ aims to strengthen the BNPP FX electronic offer: Enrich the transaction banking offer (pricing flexibility, extend currency coverage ) with a better FX execution (transparency, automation of processes, 24/7 service, ...)
Within this context, FX+ drives the cross selling with new Business lines (Cash Management, Trade or Supply Chain) and Third parties (Retailers, Payment Service Providers) through a complete and integrated FX+ Product suite, involving innovative Open Banking API solutions
The FX+ Platform development and the FX Payments marketing are part of the Global Markets eCommerce & Digital (eC&D) team, which is globally responsible for driving the digital strategy and associated transformation across the Global Markets business lines


About Global Markets


Global Markets is BNP Paribas‚Äô capital markets business within Corporate & Institutional Banking (CIB), delivering solutions across asset classes, and industry-leading services for clients including Institutionals, corporates, private banks and retail distribution networks
Our Portugal Platform (Porto and Lisbon) is a major HUB in Europe and certainly unique in the country by its size and its scope of activity, with all Front Office roles present (Trading, Sales, Research, Structuring, Quant & Engineering, Business Dev and Support, Marketing & Client Support, Risk Management, Data Analytics and Machine Learning‚Ä¶)


Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centers providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Company Description

AUTODOC is a technology company with a leading e-commerce platform for vehicle parts and accessories in Europe. Founded in 2008 in Berlin, we are now 5,000 people from 68 nationalities, collaborating to make mobility easy and sustainable. By placing technology at the core of everything we do, we manage to serve customers in 27 European countries in 23 languages.

Curious minds, adventurous experts, and tech-savvy professionals - one team, one billion euros in revenue. Catch the ride!

Job Description

A role that includes planning, implementing, and managing data sources, usage, maintenance of data assets for ongoing analysis, ongoing analysis of all business and data indicators, creating forecast scripts and methodology, preparation and analyze data for budgeting and UX research

Responsibilities

  • Knowledge of business domain zone (Preferably Finance);
  • Writing SQL scripts to check the correct operation of data sources;
  • Control of incidents related to data quality;
  • Ensuring compliance with the rules for the collection, storage, and use of data;
  • Standardization, Unification of business metrics and terms in the company;
  • Interaction with business experts to establish business rules and check their reflection in data sources;
  • Interaction with a team of data engineers - Error handling control;
  • Ensuring confidentiality and privacy of data;
  • Proficiency in English at the level of B2 "Above Intermediate" / C1 "Advanced";
  • Python, ML
  • Analyze UX research results with advanced statistics methods
  • Data visualization, dashboard creation (PowerBi)
  • Statistic analysis


Requirements

  • 3-5 years of experience in data and product analytics;
  • Data Analyst (BI) skills: deep understanding of BI, data analysis, visual analysis, knowledge of SQL fundamentals, deep understanding of all the capabilities of BI tools
  • Knowledge of the functional area of business (Finance), experience as a financial analyst;
  • Advance statistics knowledge;
  • Middle Python ML
  • Fundamentals of designing and working with corporate storages and data lakes (Data Warehouse, Data Lake), as well as ETL/ELT processes
  • Business analysis methods and techniques for identifying and formalizing data requirements;
  • Ability to work with large amounts of data and business information;
  • Ability to develop technical documentation;
  • Understanding data source maintenance processes.


Nice To Have

  • Experience with DataBase Clickhouse, certifications, e-commerce, or automotive domain


What do we offer?

  • Competitive salaries based on your professional experience
  • Fast-growing international company with stable employment
  • Annual vacation of 22 working days and 1 additional day off on your birthday
  • Meals Allowance
  • Mental Wellbeing Program ‚Äì the opportunity for free psychological counseling for you and your family members 24/7 hotline and online sessions
  • AUTODOC Corporate Discount (1,080 Euros per annum) to order parts for their own use at special discounted rates
  • Retail discounts of up to 75% on travel, technology, fashion and much more
  • Opportunities for advancement, further trainings (over 650 courses on soft and hard skills on our e-learning platform) and coaching
  • Free English and German language classes
  • Flexible working hours and hybrid work


Join us today and let‚Äôs create a success story together!

Title: Analytic Consultant
Description:
Job Description


Translate number into insights, understand the need,
Earning client trust and building relationships by delivering meaningful analysis,
Understanding the business needs of our client and applying solutions, with specific focus on the price& promotion strategy
Support Price and Promo projects for Western Europe, working together with the executive teams, analyzing the outputs of the projects, and providing insightful price and promo recommendations


Qualifications

A LITTLE BIT ABOUT YOU

Curiosity drives your interest in what impacts the market. Managing time, deadlines and different projects comes naturally to you. You enjoy working with a good team spirit and you‚Äôre known for your organization and good communication. Connecting with clients matters to you, and that motivates you to sift through data to search for new angles. You can identify business potential and build a narrative behind numbers, and you are always looking for what‚Äôs next.


Minimum 2-3 years of experience in a similar position/ business area
Previous experience in the FMCG sector, preferably within brand, category management, trade marketing, consumer insights or revenue management
High level of business relationship skills
High level of client service skills
Strong Business English knowledge, both verbal and written (another European Language, namely French or German, would be an asset)
Strong analytical mindset and excellent numerical skills
Strong communication & visualization skills ‚Äì interested in storytelling techniques
Comfortable working in a digital-enabled environment
Experience working with PowerBI would be an asset
Ability to work independently
Knowledge of Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint
Strong organizational & interpersonal skills


Additional Information

Our Benefits


Flexible working environment
Volunteer time off
LinkedIn Learning
Employee-Assistance-Program (EAP)


About NIQ

NIQ is the world‚Äôs leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights‚Äîdelivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms‚ÄîNIQ delivers the Full View‚Ñ¢. NIQ is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world‚Äôs population.

For more information, visit NIQ.com

Want to keep up with our latest updates?

Follow us on: LinkedIn | Instagram | Twitter | Facebook

Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

NIQ is committed to reflecting the diversity of the clients, communities, and markets we measure within our own workforce. We exist to count everyone and are on a mission to systematically embed inclusion and diversity into all aspects of our workforce, measurement, and products. We enthusiastically invite candidates who share that mission to join us. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class. Our global non-discrimination policy covers these protected classes in every market in which we do business worldwide. Learn more about how we are driving diversity and inclusion in everything we do by visiting the NIQ News Center: https://nielseniq.com/global/en/news-center/diversity-inclusion

In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights‚Äîdelivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms‚ÄîNIQ delivers the Full View‚Ñ¢. NIQ is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world‚Äôs population.

For more information, visit NIQ.com

Want to keep up with our latest updates?

Follow us on: LinkedIn | Instagram | Twitter | Facebook

Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

NIQ is committed to reflecting the diversity of the clients, communities, and markets we measure within our own workforce. We exist to count everyone and are on a mission to systematically embed inclusion and diversity into all aspects of our workforce, measurement, and products. We enthusiastically invite candidates who share that mission to join us. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class. Our global non-discrimination policy covers these protected classes in every market in which we do business worldwide. Learn more about how we are driving diversity and inclusion in everything we do by visiting the NIQ News Center: https://nielseniq.com/global/en/news-center/diversity-inclusion

Title: BI Consultant
HTML:
Dellent is a consulting company focused in System Information and Telecommunications. Our goal is to help our candidates and consultants to take a step forward in their careers through projects that meet their needs and expectations.

If you enjoy the thrill of the challenges that Digital Transformation and Energy Transition bring to companies, this project may be interesting to you. Here you will be able to work with the development of personalized services and end-to-end solutions.

We are looking for a BI Consultant (hybrid) for a long term role in this project in Lisbon.

Required Competences

  • Proven experience in developing Business Intelligence systems with a minimum of 2 years of experience;
  • Preferably a degree in Mathematics, Biomedicine, Physics, IT;
  • Experience in Microsoft BI tools such as PowerBI, Analysis Services and Integration Services with a minimum of 2 years of experience;
  • Solid experience in SQL is mandatory. In addition to modelling the data structure to ensure efficiency and optimization, you must know how to create procedures, triggers and functions;
  • Experience in data migration from one system to another;
  • Data Bricks and Microsoft Fabric;
  • Availability for hybrid model (up to 2 days / week at client - Lisbon).

Preferred Competencies

  • Experience or knowledge in Microsoft Fabric and its components;
  • Ease of relationship and communication with different stakeholders (customers, team);
  • Autonomy, sense of responsibility, proactivity and team spirit.

What You Can Expect From Us

  • Health insurance;
  • A personalized training plan, with a budget to spend on the training and technical books you find necessary;
  • Constant feedback so you can grow professionally;
  • Remote onboarding process;
  • Team events every semester so you can live new adventures;
  • Exclusive discounts and offers from our partners;
  • Culture of proximity and transparency. Your ideas and needs are heard and valued by us!

Apply

If the above sounds like the kind of job opportunity you would want to get involved with, then please do not hesitate to apply here. You can also explore our content about the job market here.

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Expleo is a trusted partner for your innovation journey. As a global engineering, technology and consulting service provider, we are ideally positioned to help you achieve your ambitions and future-proof your business. With a smart blend of bold thinking and reliable execution, we‚Äôre able to fast-track innovation through each step of your value chain.

We are strategically positioned to build value, with a global footprint across 30 countries.

We are as global and local as you need us to be, with strong best-in-class pan-European technological centres and unique best-shoring capabilities.

We leverage a network of high value-adding affiliates in consulting and industrial excellence, and leading partners across multiple sectors to provide you with the most comprehensive services and solutions in an ever-changing environment.

Responsibilities


Main responsible for Business requirement gathering, User Story writing, and leading User Story refinement / Solution design efforts within the team. Able to build small prototypes and mock-ups as part of refinement efforts.
Work together with Stakeholders during the Acceptance stage of solutions to guarantee successful delivery.
Proactively capture and understand Business processes and suggest improvements to the Data Platform that benefit the organization.


Essential Skills


At least 5 years' experience in a similar role;
Proven experience with data projects related to accounting, planning and financial analysis domains;
Solid knowledge of data analysis and programming with SQL and Python;
Good knowledge of understanding REST/API SOAP APIs;
Good ability to create prototypes to support requirements in Power BI;
Good knowledge of English.


What Do I Need Before I Apply

This project is remote but you must live in Portugal.

Title: Capabilities & Insights Analytics Analyst - Digital Consumer
Description:
Who You'll Work With

You‚Äôll work in our office in Lisbon, Portugal as part of our Digital Opportunities Scan team.

The Marketing & Sales practice strives to help clients in both consumer and business-to-business environments on a wide variety of marketing and sales topics. Our clients benefit from our experience in core areas of marketing and sales such as branding, customer insights, marketing Return on Investment, digital marketing, CLM (Customer Lifecycle Management), pricing, and sales and channel management.

Our practice offers an exceptional opportunity to work at the intersection of marketing, sales and consulting. Focusing on issues like redefining marketing and sales operations and commercial transformation, our people help clients build capabilities and transform how companies go to market - moving them to customer centric organizations.

Your Impact

You will apply a suite of sales assets that will help clients optimize their sales planning, coverage strategy, go-to-market model, front-line talent and commercial capabilities.

In this role, you will have responsibilities that will include translating business problems into appropriate configurations of the solution, orchestrating the solution delivery process with a global team of colleagues and preparing client deliverables with in-depth analysis and distinctive insights. You will leverage our firm assets to serve clients and create sustainable impact. You will often work on more than one project at a time that will include optimizing their planning, coverage strategy, go-to-market model, front-line talent and commercial capabilities.

You will work with client representatives and McKinsey consultants in joint problem solving sessions and will drive the process of translating data, benchmarks and analytics into value added insights and recommendations to help clients achieve breakthrough commercial improvements including sales productivity and go-to-market excellence. You will be fully responsible to deliver our diagnostic solutions in close collaboration with both McKinsey consultants and clients. You will ensure effective and impactful diagnostic projects and scope. You will set up, run, and analyze the findings of our diagnostics. Our McKinsey consultants will look to you for guidance on setting the marketing & sales agenda for their clients and will see you as a thought partner in client development and client service strategies.

You will also be an entrepreneurial leader in our solutions team, taking ownership for improving our existing assets and helping us innovate new ones. You will be directly involved in improving the process and technology improvements needed to further scale our client support model.

This role will give you the opportunity to enjoy the combination of McKinsey‚Äôs highly professional environment and a start-up attitude of entrepreneurship and dynamics.

Your Qualifications and Skills


Bachelor‚Äôs degree with a focus on business, marketing & sales or statistics/mathematics
Excel and PowerPoint skills; Alteryx or similar analytics automation and Tableau skills are desired
Ideally 1+ years in a consulting/analytics position
Background in, or strong interest for, Marketing & Sales in B2B (business-to-business); willingness to specialize in the area and bring related expertise to McKinsey teams and clients
Experience applying analytics, knowledge of R, SPSS or Python is a plus
Confidence and ability to work with senior firm stakeholders
Sound problem-solving skills with the ability to quickly process complex information and present it clearly and simply
Entrepreneurial mindset and the willingness to work in a fast-changing environment
Curious and committed to personal development and that consistently delivers exceptional results and great ideas
Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written

Title: Data Protection Analyst
Description:
PrimeIT is a leading company with over 18 years of experience in providing IT, Telecommunications, and Engineering technological services. Specialized in Team Extension, Managed Services, Custom Software, and Nearshore, we currently have a team of over 2350 professionals collaborating on national and international projects across various technologies.




We are looking for a Personal Data Protection Analyst for this project! What are we looking for?




Responsibilities

Ensure project validation processes comply with Privacy by Design principles, and supporting Project Managers on their data protection activities
Manage incoming external and internal requests, including Data Subject Rights Requests
Publish periodic report
Contribute to disseminate a culture of personal data protection
Develop and share best practices with the data protection network







Technical skills:

Fluent in English
Mandatory experience/ academic background on EU GDPR
Knowledge of other Privacy laws and regulations is a plus




Location: Hybrid in Lisbon (Portugal)




What do we offer?

Integration into an international company with a presence in over 50 cities worldwide;
Continuous training in the latest and most innovative technologies ‚Äì Prime Academy;
Career guidance and progression.




üì© Send us your CV and join the Prime team!

Title: Web Data Analyst
Description:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:

Decskill Talent: We believe that our people are key to our success. Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.

Decskill Boost: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.

Decskill Connect: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.

At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.

We are looking for a Web Data Analyst for a hybrid project based in Porto or Lisbon (2x/Week).

Scope: In practice, your day-to-day as a Web Data Analyst you will ensure to collect data from various digital sources (Web, Mobile Apps) respecting GDPR constraints and to translate it into actionable insights to be shared transversally to different teams (marketing analytics/digital, IT‚Ä¶).

Requirements: +4 years of experience as a web developer;Strong expertise in front-end languages: HTML, CSS, JavaScript;Knowledge of back-end languages like SQL, Python, VBA and third-party APIs;Project management and usage of technologic tools;Capacity to analyze and structure data;Familiar with data management and integration (data warehouse);Fluent in English. Responsibilities: Translate Business Requirements into Tagging Plans;Follow-up and validate data availability in the digital assets;Setup Web Analytics solutions (Adobe Experience Platform & OneTrust);Setup Web Analytics dashboards;Analyze user experience, online performance and funnel conversion;Implement A/B testing for personalization/optimization;Document and share online tracking knowledge and best practices. If you're interested in this job please send your CV to ****** with reference CN/WDA.

Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: Junior Data Scientist (m/f/d)
Description:
Your new Company




Join a leading company in the Telco/M√≠dia industry, renowned for its efficiency and innovation.




Your new role




As a Data Scientist, you‚Äôll handle data science projects focused in predictive modeling, machine-learning, clustering and classification techniques, and algorithms.




What You Will Need to Succeed




Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience in quantative field (Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, etc.)
At least 1 - 2 years' of experience in quantitative analytics or data modeling
Deep understanding of predictive modeling, machine-learning, clustering and classification techniques, and algorithms
Fluency in a programming language (Python, C,C++, Java, SQL)
Familiarity with Big Data frameworks and visualization tools (Cassandra, Hadoop, Spark, PowerBI)







What the Company Can Offer You




Opportunity to participate in high-impact projects: You‚Äôll have the chance to contribute to significant initiatives.

Excellent work environment: Join a dynamic team with a great working spirit.

Career growth and development: Explore opportunities for professional evolution.




Next Step

Title: Data Administrative Analyst - Remote - Based in Portugal
Description:
Reporting to the Clinical Support Helpdesk Manager/Team Lead, the Data Administrative Analyst is responsible for processing User Administrative requests for multiple Clinical Applications managed by the Clinical Support Help Desk (CSHD). Using strong analytical and data processing skills, the Analyst will provide accurate ticket processing and query response in a timely manner and with the highest level of customer service.

Please be aware we can only hire people already based in Portugal with fully legal and valid documentation to work in Portugal (fiscal number, social insurance number and title of residence or manifestation of interest if you're not a citizen). If you do not meet these requirements please do not apply.

Please apply with your resume in English.

Why should I apply, you may ask?


Fully remote and stable position, from wherever you want in Portugal
Permanent contract (sem termo)
Flexible working hours focused in EST/EDT office hours (current shift is from 10:00 to 19:00 Lisbon time)
Training: around 4 weeks from Monday to Friday 1pm to 10pm Portuguese time.
Salary of 12.180‚Ç¨ gross/year (divided in 12 or 14 payments, as you wish).
Teleworking of 50‚Ç¨ gross fixed per month
Private health insurance
Full training provided and dozens of E-Learning courses available
No mandatory need for a college/university degree


Key Responsibilities

Manage client user data utilizing provided tools / applications (i.e., account provisioning, deactivation, modification, urgent access requests)

Maintain technical proficiency with client tools

Manage and organize workload based on priorities

Suggest process improvements to improve quality and consistency

Create and delete internal Analyst accounts

Verification of request sheet submission

QC requests to ensure Quality Control

File paperwork as needed for auditing purposes

Contact clients where necessary to clarify processes ‚Äì requests received primarily by email

Other duties as assigned

Required Technical Skills

Proficient with Windows operating system and applications ‚Äì email, online chat

High proficiency with MS Office Suite, high level MS Excel expertise

Solid computer keyboarding, multiple monitor, and touchpad skills

General understanding of various software and hardware. Citrix experience an asset

Required Soft Skills

Strong attention to detail with a commitment to quality

Fluency in English, spoken and written

Exceptional organization, planning and time management skills

Excellent customer service orientation

Proven ability to work under pressure and in a very fast paced environment

Ability to adapt based on rapidly changing client needs; high level of flexibility is required

Capacity to take initiative and think outside the box if necessary

Must be able to communicate professionally in a written and verbal capacity

Must be a team player and demonstrate a strong work ethic

Required Education And Experience

Business Administration or related field or a minimum of 1-year previous data processing / administrative experience preferably in a call center environment and/or any equivalent combination of education and experience.

Title: Business, Data Analytics and Insights Associate
Description:
HOW MIGHT YOU DEFY IMAGINATION?

The Amgen Capability Center in Lisbon, Portugal (ACCP), number 1 company in Best Workplaces - https://www.greatplacetowork.pt/ - ranking in Portugal (category 201-500 employees) by the Great Place to Work Institute. is home to over 300 talented people and more than 35 different nationalities, diverse areas of expertise and professional experience that are shaping the future of healthcare. This is your chance to explore a world of opportunities in different areas such as Cybersecurity, Data & Analytics, Digital, Technology and Innovation, Finance, General & Admin, Human Resources, Regulatory Affairs and many more. In Lisbon's city center, our AMGEN office fosters innovation, excellence, and inspiration. Come thrive with us at AMGEN, supporting our mission To Serve Patients. What we do at AMGEN matters in people‚Äôs lives.

Business, Data Analytics and Insights Senior Associate

LIVE

What You Will Do

You, as our Business, Data Analytics and Insights Associate, supports the delivery of day to day D&A activities. You are responsible for producing budgeting and planning reports, data analysis and supporting wider business Units within the ACCP.

Other responsibilities will include:


Supporting business planning and decision making through financial analysis.
Support long-term and short-term planning support activities.
Calculating scenarios based of expectations.
Collecting feedback and preparing communication plans to share outputs.
Taking ownership of complex calculations through understanding inputs and their relationships to the problem.
Upload, manage and store complex data.
Communicate competently with regional hubs.
Supporting ACCP continuous improvement activities.
Supporting wider business units on an ad hoc basis (Finance/FP&A/Business Enablement).


WIN

What We Expect Of You

Our ideal candidate is a team player with customer focus. He/she is problem solving and result oriented and has time and process management skills and can compile data.

Proven experience and skills needed:


University Degree in commerce, finance, economics, mathematics, healthcare or related field.
1+ years working in a finance/data related field ideally Data and Analytics.
Fluency in English, both in written and oral communication.
Strong Excel knowledge .


Preferred Requirements:


Working knowledge of IS systems (including demonstrated capability of other MS Office applications, SQL, Hyperion Pillar, Tableau, Anaplan).
Demonstrates a service-minded attitude.
Experience in the Pharmaceutical industry.
Clearly explains processes and procedures.
Fluency in multiple European languages.


THRIVE

What You Can Expect Of Us


Vast opportunities to learn, develop, and move up and across our global organization.
Diverse and inclusive community of belonging, where colleagues are empowered to bring ideas to the table, take risks, and act.
Generous Amgen Total Rewards Plan comprising healthcare, finance, wealth and career benefits.
Flexible work arrangements.


APPLY NOW

for a career that defies imagination

In our quest to serve patients above all else, Amgen is the first to imagine, and the last to doubt. Join us.

careers.amgen.com

EQUAL OPPORTUNITY STATEMENT

Amgen is an Equal Opportunity employer and will consider you without regard to your race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided a reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request an accommodation.

Title: Data Business Analyst
HTML:
With just over 7 years of experience in the Portuguese market, we share our DNA with more than 200 workers and position our offer according to 3 lines of service:Strategy (Outsourcing, NeXel, Team as a Service, Tech Academies); R&D (Bootcamps,POC, Tech Lab); Nearshore.In ADENTIS, we focus on PEOPLE.

This is our emotional salary:Great Work-Life balance; Very flexible organizational routine; Health benefits(for you and your family); Team Building activities; Over 300 protocols to offer you great discounts in different areas; Continuous professional development sponsored by our Training and Certification Department; Regular feedback on your performance through a personalized plan; Comprehensive career plan and progression involving assertive performance reviews.Responsibilities:- Collection, analysis and challenge of business needs with animation ofworkshops in collaboration with the Product Owner- Writing requirements and user stories- Participation in the design of the People Repository (screen models, userpaths, data mappings, etc.

)Contribution to the definition of the functional solution of the platformClose collaboration with the IT teams (developers, service center, test center) and the project manager to ensure a good understanding of the needs and their IT implementationsContribution to tests (strategy, test cases, test campaigns, analysis ofanomalies, etc.

)- Contribution to the drafting of operating procedures, user guides- Active contribution to all agile rituals (sprint planning, grooming, sprintreview, daily meeting)- > Propose optimizations and efficiency gains.You must have:A good knowledge of Data BusinessA first experience as Data Functional AnalystA first experience in Data Models and BI environment is a plusAbility to understand business needs and translate them to ITFluency in EnglishPortuguese residency and eligibility to work.Availability to go twice a week to the office.If you want to be part of a real People First organization, join us!

Send your CV to ******

Title: Digital Performance & Analytics Specialist
HTML:
Boost IT is a Portuguese technology consultancy company, we are integrated into one of the most entrepreneurial groups in Portugal, with investment in more than 30 companies.

We want to be known for being the most dynamic, energetic and reliable company to operate in the market and, for that, we want to count on you.

If you're passionate about technology and want to work on the most relevant technology projects, then this ad could be for you!


Responsibilities:

¬∑ Develop the analytics and data platform vision and roadmap for the business, while ensuring day-to-day delivery and performance

¬∑ Develop the strategy for collecting, manipulating, and analyzing data for all departments such as Marketing, Product, Operations, and Customer Experience

¬∑ Develop a data culture and community across the organization to share best practices, champion the use of data, and continuously improve our focus on outcomes and user experience

¬∑ Build strong relationships with and educate team leaders on how to use data in their environments and leverage insights to drive improved business outcomes

¬∑ Partner with teams to track market trends, user behavior, and business performance through the development of dashboards, hypotheses, and related experiments

¬∑ Support the development and collection of both qualitative and quantitative insights


Requirements:

¬∑ 2+ years of related work experience;

¬∑ Degree in Marketing & Communication, Mathematics, Statistics, Management or a related technical field

¬∑ Expert experience with Google Analytics 360 and Google Tag Manager required ‚Äì analysis and implementation;

¬∑ Experience with Data Layer configurations (Enhanced e-commerce set-up, events, etc.)

¬∑ Experience with creating effective data visualizations with Google Looker Studio (Power BI and other tools are a plus);

¬∑ Technical expertise in data models and database design and development;

¬∑ Working knowledge of HTML, JavaScript, and Web debugging tools;

¬∑ Experience with SQL, Microsoft Excel, Big Query, and Google Cloud Platform;

¬∑ Ability to understand and analyze data sets required for machine learning and AI algorithms is a plus;

¬∑ Strong analytical and critical thinking skills;

¬∑ Experience with A/B Testing;

¬∑ Be creative, proactive, logical, and innovative;

¬∑ Be highly results-oriented, a self-learner, and have the energy and determination to succeed in a fast-paced, fun, and entrepreneurial environment;

¬∑ Ability to perform multiple tasks simultaneously with excellence;

¬∑ Excellent written and verbal communication skills, both in Portuguese and English, able to work with people at all levels inside and outside the company and explain findings.


Benefits

22 days of annual vacation leave (+ 3 additional days on us! - Birthday, Christmas Eve, and New Year's Eve)

Career progression opportunities

Health insurance

Teambuilding activities



Boost IT. Doing IT. Better

Title: Data analyst (Monochains, Multinetwork and Cosmos Hub Ecosystem)
Description:
P2P.org is the largest institutional staking provider with a TVL of over $10B and a market share exceeding 20% in restaking.

We are continually focused on researching and improving our infrastructure to extract maximum APR while enhancing security. For instance, in ETH and SOL, our NRR is on average 10% higher than the market, and in DOT, it's 20% higher.

We also place significant focus and resources on launching new networks such as TON, Avail, Monad, Babylon, Story, Berachain, and others, along with yield products. From restaking, where we are the largest operator with a 20+% market share, to yield aggregators on stablecoins.

Our clients include BitGo, Copper, Crypto.com, Ledger, ByBit, Bitget, OKX, HTX, Bitvavo, SBI, and others, who choose us for our client-centric approach and extensive product line from unified API to widgets and custom dApps.

We are also actively expanding our product line, exploring RWA, data, yield, and service products for banks, exchanges, custodians, and wallets.

P2P.org unites talented individuals globally ‚ù§Ô∏è

Despite our distributed team, we share a passion for decentralized finance - a fairer system for all. We code, learn, create, and connect to shape finance's future üí∞

P2P.org boasts a strong reputation and network. We prioritize customer satisfaction and, as tech enthusiasts, develop innovative solutions that bolster our brand.

You will


Explore blockchain ecosystem to detect possible opportunities and risks
Optimise economy for validation process including research, modeling, and improving business processes.
Design and develop end-to-end data solutions, from initial analysis and model development to deployment, optimizing for performance and scalability
Provide informative dashboards to team, company, and community.
Configure data platform instruments to load, process, and transform data
Formulate data requirements for the data engineering team. Decide on granularity, frequency, and data quality.
Govern your team data marts. Provide data lineage from sources to reporting.
Provide ad-hoc support to your team


You have


Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field.
Proficiency in advanced SQL, including different joins and window expressions (utilizing Google BigQuery).
Competence with the analytical Python stack or other programming languages.
Experience working with ETL instruments such as Airflow and dbt.
Advanced knowledge of visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Superset, Looker)
Knowledge of data modeling techniques.
Data research skills, probability theory, and mathematical statistics. Ability to operate in such models as regressions, and ab-tests.
Data storytelling skills. Ability to form your opinion and prove it with data beyond a reasonable doubt.
Knowledge of cryptocurrencies and blockchain technology is considered a plus!
English B2+


At P2P.org we have a team of experts with their own unique approach and ownership culture. Together we gain experience and make dreams come true! üåü


Full-time Contractor (Indefinite-term Consultancy Agreement)
Competitive salary level in $ (we can also pay in Crypto)
Well-being program
Mental Health care program
Compensation for education, including Foreign Language & professional growth courses
Equipment & co-working reimbursement program
Overseas conferences, community immersion
Positive and friendly communication culture


P2P.org is committed to providing equal opportunities. All applicants will be considered without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, or disability.

Title: Senior Analyst, Insights & Enablement-R-239739
Description:
Our Purpose

Mastercard powers economies and empowers people in 200+ countries and territories worldwide. Together with our customers, we‚Äôre helping build a sustainable economy where everyone can prosper. We support a wide range of digital payments choices, making transactions secure, simple, smart and accessible. Our technology and innovation, partnerships and networks combine to deliver a unique set of products and services that help people, businesses and governments realize their greatest potential.

Title And Summary

Senior Analyst, Insights & Enablement

Overview - Data & Services within Mastercard

The Data & Services team is a key differentiator for Mastercard, providing the cutting-edge services that help our customers grow. Focused on thinking big and scaling fast around the globe, this agile team is responsible for end-to-end solutions for a diverse global customer base. We combine traditional management consulting with our rich data assets and in-house technology to provide our clients with powerful strategic insights and recommendations. Centered on data-driven technologies and innovation, these services include consulting, loyalty and marketing programs, test-and-learn business experimentation, and data-driven information and risk management services. While specializing in the payments industry, Mastercard Data & Services also works closely with major retailers, airlines, and other enterprises, leveraging data and insights garnered from within and beyond its network.

Role

The position is for the Insights & Enablement team, a global team focused on ensuring that all of Data & Services can make data-driven decisions and operate effectively and efficiently. This person will report to the Manager of Consulting Operations and will contribute to drive efficiency within the global Data & Services ~2,500 consulting team by supporting activities such as capacity planning, evaluation & development and recognition.

Expectations


Understands internal client needs and identifies opportunities to improve its efficiency
Clearly formulates a problem statement and effectively structures how to address it through analyses and activities
Executes analyses in autonomously and flawlessly, knowing how to leverage the existing tools
Summarizes insights and implications in a concise and clear way through well crafted powerpoint decks
Effectively participates in meetings with senior stakeholders, understanding their context and providing own point of view (when applicable)
Takes full ownership for implementing agreed initiatives
Build strong relationships with manager level clients and internal stakeholders to guide impactful decisions
Partners with peers from other teams whenever needed in order to deliver agreed initiatives
Proactively plans and prioritizes own work, leveraging the supervisor when needed
Seeks opportunities to learn more about the business and grow one‚Äôs career
Act as a professional and mature leader in all situations



All About You & Experience


Engineering or business degree
2-4 years of analytical experience with proven problem-solving skills
Strong communication skills in English
Drive to grow own‚Äôs career



Corporate Security Responsibility

All activities involving access to Mastercard assets, information, and networks comes with an inherent risk to the organization and, therefore, it is expected that every person working for, or on behalf of, Mastercard is responsible for information security and must:


Abide by Mastercard‚Äôs security policies and practices;
Ensure the confidentiality and integrity of the information being accessed;
Report any suspected information security violation or breach, and
Complete all periodic mandatory security trainings in accordance with Mastercard‚Äôs guidelines.

Title: BI Analytics Application Support
Description:
With just over 7 years of experience in the Portuguese market, we share our DNA with more than 200 workers and position our offer according to 3 lines of service:

Strategy (Outsourcing, NeXel, Team as a Service, Tech Academies);
R&D (Bootcamps, POC, Tech Lab);
Nearshore.




In ADENTIS, we focus on PEOPLE. This is our emotional salary:

Great Work-Life balance;
Very flexible organizational routine;
Health benefits (for you and your family);
Team Building activities;
Over 300 protocols to offer you great discounts in different areas;
Continuous professional development sponsored by our Training and Certification Department;
Regular feedback on your performance through a personalized plan;
Comprehensive career plan and progression involving assertive performance reviews.




Responsibilities:

¬∑ BI Analytics Application Support: Manage and provide specialized technical support for the organization's Business Intelligence (BI) and Analytics solutions, ensuring their availability, performance, and integrity.

¬∑ SQL/PLSQL Query Development and Maintenance: Create, optimize, and maintain SQL queries and PL/SQL procedures to facilitate data analysis and ensure system operations efficiency.

¬∑ Unix Environment Administration: Administer Unix environments to ensure stability and security of applications, including server and operating system installation, configuration, and maintenance. ¬∑ ControlM Job Monitoring and Control: Configure and monitor scheduled jobs using ControlM, ensuring proper execution and adherence to defined schedules.

¬∑ Troubleshooting: Identify and resolve technical issues related to BI Analytics applications, SQL, PL/SQL, Unix, and ControlM, conducting in-depth analyses and implementing effective solutions.

¬∑ Interdepartmental Collaboration: Collaborate with development, operations, and end-user teams to understand requirements, implement improvements, and provide ongoing technical support.

¬∑ Documentation and Training: Document processes, procedures, and technical solutions, and provide training and guidance to end-users and support teams.

¬∑ Incident and Change Management: Manage incidents and change requests related to BI Analytics applications, SQL, PL/SQL, Unix, and ControlM, ensuring timely and effective resolution.

You must have:

¬∑ Proficiency in SQL and PL/SQL for query and procedure development and maintenance.

¬∑ Experience in Unix environment administration, including installation, configuration, and troubleshooting.

¬∑ Practical knowledge of job scheduling tools like ControlM.

¬∑ Analytical and problem-solving skills.

¬∑ Excellent communication skills and ability to collaborate effectively with multiple teams.

¬∑ Ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks in a dynamic environment.

¬∑ Strong documentation and training skills.

¬∑ European Union Citizenship or Portuguese Working Visa / Portuguese Residency.

¬∑ Availability to go to the office, once a month.

If you want to be part of a real People First organization, join us! Send your CV to andre.lago@adentis.pt

Title: Data Engineer (Power BI), Portugal
Description:
We are tech transformation specialists, uniting human expertise with AI to create scalable tech solutions.

With over 6,500 CI&Ters around the world, we‚Äôve built partnerships with more than 1,000 clients during our 30 years of history. Artificial Intelligence is our reality.¬†

When applying for one of our positions, you‚Äôre agreeing to the use of AI in the early phases of the selection process, where your profile will be evaluated by our virtual assistant. For more information, access our opportunities‚Äô page.




We are looking for a Data Engineer to be part of our team that is working for clients in Europe. In this position, you will design, implement and support data pipelines working closely with teams in the EU, US, Brazil and other countries. You need advanced and/or fluent proficiency in English to communicate with these different teams and clients during the workday, HENCE PLEASE SUBMIT YOUR CV IN ENGLISH.

Objective

Strategically manage multidisciplinary teams to achieve the company's strategic objectives, ensuring high-quality program and process delivery and operational effectiveness. This role is vital for leading initiatives that drive growth, innovation, and business expansion within the organization.

Key Responsibilities / Main Activities

We are looking for someone who has:

Solid experience in building Power BI reports (semantic models and dashboards).

Solid experience in designing, building and testing data pipelines.

Solid experience using Python for data (data gathering, cleaning, transformation, joining, reading and writing data frames using different formats).

Solid experience on at least one ETL tool (e.g. Talend, Microsoft Integration Services, etc).

Comfort learning new frameworks.

Experience with CI/CD Pipelines (ideally in the context of deploying Power BI reports).

Willingness to work with different technologies and learn every day.

Ability to share your knowledge with more junior team members.

The main responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

Develop, Support, Configure Power BI Models and Reports.

Manage Power BI (access, data refresh, etc‚Ä¶).

Develop, Support, troubleshoot and fix bugs on existing data pipelines (including performance tuning).

Define, build and deliver high-quality data pipelines.

Participate in the Data Validation process.

Develop and Support CI/CD PipelinesDesign, construct, install, test and maintain data management systems.

Ensure that all systems meet the business/company requirements as well as industry practices.

Integrate up-and-coming data management and software engineering technologies into existing data structures.

Recommend different ways to constantly improve data reliability and quality.

Analyze and organize raw data.

Build data-marts that will be consumed by data scientist‚Äôs analysis and data visualization tools

We expect candidates to have knowledge in some, but not necessarily all fields below:

Knowledge on using Snowflake as a DataWahouse.

Knowledge of non-functional requirements (performance, security, privacy, GDPR and etc).

Knowledge of unit, integration and E2E testing.

Knowledge of using python or other scripting languages to automate day to day tasks.

Knowledge on different SQL and No SQL databases.







Why join us?

- Competitive Salary¬†¬†

- Generous paid vacation days

- Generous sick time¬†

- 100% paid health & dental benefits starting day one¬†

- Annual profit-sharing distribution¬†

- Paid parental leave¬†

- Dedicated career advisor¬†¬†

And so much more‚Ä¶

Collaboration is our superpower, diversity unites us, and excellence is our standard.¬†

We value diverse identities and life experiences, fostering a diverse, inclusive, and safe work environment. We encourage applications from diverse and underrepresented groups to our job positions.

We are looking for a talented, experienced market researcher for the European team based out of Lisbon.

Role

Ability to synthesize and analyze information from multiple sources to prepare insightful presentations
Experience of using qualitative/quantitative research tools would be an advantage
Strong at business writing and creating client-ready materials
Excellent communication skills



All About Your Education & Skills


You have 3-5 years' hands-on experience in primary research (quantitative techniques including survey design and analysis and/or qualitative research including designing and facilitating in-depth interviews, focus groups, online forums etc.).
Degree-level is minimum, relevant Masters‚Äô degree is desirable.
Relevant working experience across a range of research projects
Fluent local office language and English required, other languages desirable
PowerPoint, Excel and Word skills required

Abide by Mastercard‚Äôs security policies and practices;
Ensure the confidentiality and integrity of the information being accessed;
Report any suspected information security violation or breach, and
Complete all periodic mandatory security trainings in accordance with Mastercard‚Äôs guidelines.

  • Complete all periodic mandatory security trainings in accordance with Mastercard‚Äôs guidelines.

Title: Data Office | Data Engineer
Description:
Company Description

At Devoteam, we believe that technology with strong human values can actively drive change for the better. Discover how Tech for People unlocks the future, creating a positive impact on the people and the world around us. We are a global leading player in Digital Transformation for leading organisations across EMEA, with a revenue of ‚Ç¨1B. We believe in transforming technology to create value for our clients, partners and employees in a world where technology is developed for people. We are proud of the culture we have built together. We are proud of our people at the service of technology. We are proud of our diverse environment. Because we are #TechforPeople. Join our multidisciplinary team of Cloud experts, Designers, Business consultants, Security experts, Engineers, Developers and other extraordinary talents, spread across more than 20 EMEA countries. Become one of our +10.000 tech and business leaders on cloud, data and cyber security. Let‚Äôs fuse creativity with technology together and build innovative solutions that actively change things for the better.


Job Description

In the context of the Data Office area ensure proper stability, performance and availability of the Data platform (Datalake, ETL pipelines, data orchestration, BI dashboards).

Collect, clean, and analyze data; creates reports, dashboards, and visualizations.


Qualifications


Bachelor‚Äôs degree or a postgraduate in IT, Data Science, or equivalent.
3-5 years of experience as a Data Engineer or similar, preferably in the context of a tech company.
Experience developing solutions in Tableau, Snowflake, Alteryx appreciated (but not mandatory).
Understanding and experience with SQL and Python programming is also appreciated.
Power Platform experience is valued.
Strong time management, meticulous attention to detail, and excellent communication skills.
Good level of English, spoken and written.


Additional Information

The Devoteam Group works for equal opportunities, promoting its employees based on merit and actively fights against all forms of discrimination. We are convinced that diversity contributes to the creativity, dynamism and excellence of our organization. All of our vacancies are open to people with disabilities.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Learn About Knok

At knok, we dare to lead and humanise the digital transformation of healthcare. We envision a world where everyone has timely access to quality healthcare through digital technology, creating a more equal society. We genuinely believe in it and you can recognise it in every person who embraces this mission.

Through a Digital Front Door strategy, knok connects patients, providers and healthcare professionals in one place. Our API-first white-label platform enables a continuous, engaging and personalised healthcare experience for all conditions through a cutting-edge Patient Journey Engine.

With regular clinical practice as our main source of knowledge, we leverage ready-to-use data to improve care automation and increase financial savings. Since 2015, we have enabled more than 2.5 million clinical interactions in over 12 countries. Our platform is scalable and AI-ready, enhancing the power of data-driven care to deliver better outcomes during all stages of life.

Are you ready to join us in revolutionising healthcare and making a tangible impact on people's lives?

About The Role

We are looking for a Junior Data Analyst to gather, analyse, and interpret business data from multiple sources to extract meaningful insights that drive business decisions. You will play a crucial role in maintaining and improving data processes, ensuring high data quality, and supporting different teams with analytical insights. If this sounds exciting, keep reading!

As a Junior Data Analyst, you will:


Collect, clean, and analyse data to generate valuable business insights,
Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and data visualisations to support strategic decision-making,
Automate recurring reports and data processes to improve efficiency,
Support forecasting activities for different services, ensuring accurate planning and resource allocation,
Ensure data integrity and quality, identifying and resolving inconsistencies or anomalies,
Work closely with cross-functional teams to provide data-driven recommendations,
Optimise and automate the medical hours allocation process to enhance operational efficiency


Here are the skills we're looking for:


Bachelor's degree in Management, Biomedical Engineering, Industrial Engineering, or a related field
1 to 2 years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or a similar role
Strong Excel skills (data manipulation, advanced formulas, VBA)
Experience with data visualisation tools (e.g., Power BI, Apache Superset, or similar)
Critical thinking and problem-solving mindset to translate data into actionable insights
Storytelling with data - ability to communicate findings clearly to different stakeholders
Strong collaboration and communication skills to work effectively with multidisciplinary teams


Nice to have:


Experience with SQL for querying databases
Familiarity with Apache Superset or similar business intelligence tools
Previous experience in healthcare analytics or the healthcare industry
