Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:


Decskill Talent: We believe that our people are key to our success.

Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.


Decskill Boost: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.


Decskill Connect: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.


At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.


We are looking for a Data Analyst for a project based in Porto (Hybrid work model - twice a week at the office).


Requirements:

‚Ä¢ BS/MS Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Applied Math, or a similar area;

‚Ä¢ Experience in data preparation and data reconciliation (mandatory);

‚Ä¢ Experience in Alteryx and VBA;

‚Ä¢ Power BI Experience;

‚Ä¢ Good knowledge of SQL (mandatory);

‚Ä¢ Good knowledge of Agile and Scrum methodologies;

‚Ä¢ Fluent English (mandatory);

‚Ä¢ The candidate must be living in Portugal (mandatory).


Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: Data Analyst (PowerBI)
Description:
Who are we:

Neotalent Conclusion is one of the leading Iberian specialists providing services in Information Technology and Engineering services. As part of the Netherlands-based organization Conclusion, which has an ecosystem of over 25 companies and 3,600 employees, we are focused on increasing the technological capacity of our clients and the digital transformation of their application ecosystems.

We are talent specialists, attracting the best people and combining them with the needs of the most ambitious projects, at the right time. Our success comes from our investments in innovation, our focus on results, and, above all, the guarantee that our people will have happy and rewarding careers.

With over 25 years of solid experience, Neotalent Conclusion has established its presence in key locations, including Lisbon, Porto, and Madrid. The company currently has more than 950 professionals in the different areas in which it operates.




Neotalent, the responsive people.




Find out more about us at www.neotalent.pt.




Role Overview:

We are looking for a Data Analyst (PowerBI) to join one of our biggest clients in the Porto area (Hybrid). A multinational financial services firm, one of the largest financial groups and among the 30 largest financial institution‚Äôs globally.




What you will do:

Create and update PowerBI Dashboards
Collect data (internal & external) and investigate their business value through data analysis and visualization
Create and adapt data analysis models and tools
Mount, execute and automate ETL processes for extracting data (with python and SQL) to serve analytical needs
Develop & improve data quality controls and standardize processes and analyses
Use previous experience in marketing topics to translate business needs
Collect and visualize KPIs on the performance of our in-house models
Basic knowledge of data python packages




What you are like:

At least 4 years of experience as a Data Analyst;
Experience with PowerBI;
Strong understanding of Agile methodologies and frameworks, particularly Scrum;
Excellent communication skills - English;




Why join us

Work on challenging projects for big clients
Learn more about emerging technologies
Possibility of working remotely
Design your career plan
Access to continuous training and certifications
Evolve through our internal mobility program
‚Ä¶ and much more!

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Miss√£o: Planear, monitorizar e participar nas atividades e projetos de An√°lise de Dados no √¢mbito da sua √°rea de atua√ß√£o. Integrar equipas multidisciplinares e √°geis, no contexto de Expertise Center, que tenham por objetivo resolver desafios e problemas de neg√≥cio, atrav√©s da tecnologia.


Principais Responsabilidades:

  • Desenvolvimento de Pipelines de ETL (Extract, Transform, Load): Criar processos para extrair dados de v√°rias fontes, transform√°-los conforme necess√°rio (por exemplo, limpeza e formata√ß√£o) e carreg√°-los em base de dados ou data lakes.
  • Automa√ß√£o de Fluxos de Dados: Automatizar o processamento de dados, assegurando que as informa√ß√µes s√£o disponibilizadas aos clientes internos em tempo √∫til.
  • Criar e atualizar bases de dados eficientes e escal√°veis, com dom√≠nio do SQL (Structured Query Language), permitindo que os dados sejam armazenados de forma estruturada e de f√°cil acesso.
  • Criar e manter data lakes e data warehouses, utilizando tecnologias como Microsoft Azure.
  • Identificar oportunidades para reduzir os custos associados ao armazenamento e processamento de um grande volume de dados (Big Data).


Perfil:

  • Licenciatura ou Mestrado em Engenharia Inform√°tica, Matem√°ticas Aplicadas ou Ci√™ncia de Computadores ou curso superior com especializa√ß√£o em an√°lise de dados;
  • 2-3 anos de experi√™ncia em fun√ß√µes semelhantes;
  • Conhecimentos avan√ßados de PowerBI;
  • Conhecimentos s√≥lidos de Azure Data (Datalake; Data Factory; Databricks; Integrations Services e Analysis Services);
  • Conhecimentos em MySQL, PostgreSQL e NoSQL (preferencial);
  • Conhecimentos b√°sicos de Python (preferencial);
  • Conhecimento em Google Data Studio (preferencial);

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We‚Äôre looking for the special, unique and amazing YOU!

@ KCS IT, we look for the ones that stands out, for those that always wants to be better and fight for it, and for those who has the same values that we do: dedication, energy, integrity, transparency, flexibility, trust, honesty, hard work, proactivity, team work.

At KCS we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills for the position are welcome!




We are looking for an Amazing: Data Analyst

Seniority: 3+ years

Location : Hybrid- Porto




Skills Needed?




Bachelor / Master in Computer Engineering or similar;
3+ years of experience in data analysis;
Strong proficiency in SQL for querying and data extraction;
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau, Looker);
Experience working with python;
Familiarity with databases such as MySQL, PostgreSQL, or Snowflake;
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills,
Good level of English and Portuguese;
Good level of french is a plus;
The candidate has to be in Portugal.







Why should you become part of our family?




You can develop a career that fits you: your career development is personalized, taking in consideration your needs and goals from a short to long term
Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity
Free training programs: Our training and certification programs in languages, tech, behavior and business will help you to reach your full potential faster
International projects in Benelux: you can gain international experience in Benelux and balance a new way of living with work
Type of projects (depending on the project you might find one of this types of projects):
In hybrid Systems: Is important to balance work with socialization, that¬¥s why a hybrid system works for us and for you
Full Remote projects: If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your home
Full Onsite projects: if you prefere the company of your colleagues!
Take care of your well-being: Enjoy our free nutrition, psicologist, general medicine appointments and our yoga and personal training days‚Ä¶ all remote!







Who are we?

Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Inovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto, Leiria and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Since 2018 we have been elected one of the 10 major companies in the ‚ÄúIndex of Excellence‚Äù, an initiative that aims to reward organizations that invest most in the development and satisfaction of their employees.We believe transparency, trust and integrity are the pillars of any business and relationship and that is what we promise our clients and employees who join our company KCS IT.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Back in 1966, in Marseilles, when the world was talking about Start Trek üöÄ, Sodexo was serving its first customers, initiating our journey in the Quality-of-Life Services leaded by the bold Pierre Bellon.




Since then, we continued our adventure of offering everyday need solutions, improving the life of our users across the globe üåé supported by more than 400 thousand dedicated and brave colleagues, in 64 countries, that lead us to where we are today.




üáµüáπ Portugal is no exception and 5 years ago, our shared service center ‚Äì Sodexo Business Services ‚Äì SBS, was born! In here, you will have the chance to be part of several üìäüßæFinancial teams like Record to Report, Order to Cash, Purchase to Pay, Financial Analysis, Master Data, among others, that support European markets, making sure the business continues to growth.







üí• Are you bold enough to join our crew, with your unique character and ideas, and make us even bigger?




üíº We are waiting for you! And so, your career!




In the meantime, check the opportunity below:




Senior Data Analyst




This position is responsible for gathering, analyzing, and interpreting complex data to help drive strategic decisions and optimize business processes. The role involves transforming raw data into actionable insights, developing reports and dashboards, and supporting the organization in identifying trends and opportunities for growth.




‚öô What will you do?

Primary tasks:

Create, restructure, and manage large datasets, files, and systems.
Develop clear and actionable visualizations through Power BI dashboards.
Filter, clean, and validate data, ensuring data accuracy and implementing performance indicators to identify and correct issues.
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex datasets with minimal guidance.
Present her/his findings to stakeholders in a clear and concise communication.




Secondary tasks:

Work closely with management to prioritize business and information needs.
Build stakeholder understanding of data usage and its impact on business decisions.
Apply business logic to guide analysis, synthesize findings, and deliver clear, actionable insights.
Follow standardized processes established by the Sodexo Data Factory.
Document data processing decisions and summarize data quality in technical memos.Support implementation of continuous improvement processes for stakeholders.
Continuously enhance technical skills and explore new technologies to stay current with industry advancements.




ü§ô What you'll need to succeed?:

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in statistics, mathematics, economics, education, social sciences, or related fields required with two or more years of relevant work experience. Master‚Äôs degree preferred.
5/8 years of experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar , with a record of analyzing large datasets and delivering actionable insights.
Strong experience in using business intelligence tools, especially Power BI for data visualization and reporting.
Proficient in data manipulation and query languages, particularly SQL.
Strong knowledge of DBT, Databricks, or other data transformation & pipeline tools.
Proven ability to translate business needs into data models and analytics solutions.
Prior experience working in a data-driven environment and contributing to decision-making through analytics
Strong analytical skills with attention to detail and accuracy.
Strong problem-solving abilities with the capacity to approach complex data challenges methodically.
Excellent communication skills to explain data insights and their business impact to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Ability to work independently and manage multiple tasks while maintaining clear focus on business outcomes.
A proactive mindset with a passion for continuous learning and staying updated on new technologies and methodologies.







üéâ What we have to offer you?

Hybrid working model;
Flexible working hours;
Health & Life Insurance;
Attractive Meal allowance paid in Meal Card;
Additional Days off: extra vacation day, employee‚Äôs birthday, volunteering day;
More than 6000 free online courses;
Opportunity to grow professionally inside the Company;
Possibility to participate in multicultural projects;
Several internal activities aiming to promote our team¬¥s wellbeing.




We are waiting for you!




Send us your CV to our email Recruitment.SBS.Portugal@sodexo.com with the title of the role on the subject and check all the opportunities on our career website (https://www.sodexo.com/en/contact-us/sbs-porto/porto-jobs)




Find out more about Sodexo: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XX7PoE9kazU




Sodexo is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment.

At Sodexo we believe in Privacy and your Privacy is very important to us that¬¥s why your personal data will only be used for the purpose of managing our recruitment process, will be processed in accordance to the GDPR and treated confidentially. For further information about how we process your personal data please reach out to privacy.sbs@sodexo.com.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:




DECSKILL TALENT: We believe that our people are key to our success. Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth
DECSKILL BOOST: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.
DECSKILL CONNECT: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.







At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.




We are looking for a Data Analyst to join us in Porto.




Requirements:

BS/MS Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Applied Math, or a similar area.
Experience in data workflow creation (data preparation and data reconciliation) in Alteryx or similar data analytics tools, for example Dataiku, Knime.
Experience with Business Intelligence - Data visualization tools, mainly Power BI
Experience to develop and maintain Power Apps and Power Automate solutions
Good knowledge about SQL.
Good level of English - minimum B2
Able to be quickly autonomous, proactive
Desire to learn more about new technologies as Power Platform and Dataiku.
A real passion for learning, doing things better and helping others;
Availability to travel abroad for short periods of time, as required.




If you‚Äôre interested in this job please send your CV in English to goncalo.delgado@decskill.com with reference ‚ÄúGD / Data Analyst‚Äù.







Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you driven by Technology?If so, it's at Red IT that you should embrace your next challenge!

We took our first steps in Innovation and Technology in 2016, and the desire to do more and better is always with us.Red.It stands as a key element within Group RIT, a collaboration of technological enterprises focused on accelerating business growth through digital transformation.

Our teams are experienced and certified IT professionals that work closely with clients, to provide fit-for-purpose solutions.

From software development, next-generation cloud services, support in IT projects across multiple technological stacks, IT outsourcing, and many more, Group RIT will use the most advanced technology to accelerate and unleash the full potential of our client's business.

With 6 Business Units, 11 offices in 8 countries and a global team of over 500 people, Group RIT is leading digital innovation, providing innovative solutions for multiple business sectors like Telecom, Healthcare, Finance, Retail and Manufacturing.Red.It is dedicated to fostering a workplace that embraces diversity and inclusion.

As an equal opportunity employer, it does not discriminate based on race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or any other legally protected status.

We believe in creating an environment where all individuals are respected and valued for their unique perspectives and contributions.Join the Wolfpack as a Data Analyst (Hybrid - Porto) !What skills do you need to have?Bachelor's degree in Engineering/Computing/Science or similar field.4 years' experience in data preparation and reconciliation.Proficiency in Alteryx, VBA and SQL.Availability for occasional travel.Fluency in English:French is highly valued.Some of your responsibilities will be:Collaborate with business users to solve business problems.Develop and maintain Alteryx workflows for data processing.Ensure compliance with software governance rules.Estimate and manage data project tasks.A team focused on achieving objectives, motivation will not be lacking!

Red Team!Red Training - We want to help you reach your potential.Continuous career support and advice.

Red Follow UpRed Change - You love what you do, but want to explore other areas?

No problem Wolf!There is time for everything, and fun is not left out.

Red HoursRed Spirit - If you want to go fast, go alone.

If you want to go far, GO TOGETHER!Keywords: Data Analyst, Alteryx.WHAT DRIVES YOU?Apply here or through ****** and find out what moves us at www.Redit.Pt

Title: Business/Data Analyst (Finance)
HTML:
Who are we:

Neotalent Conclusion is one of the leading Iberian specialists providing services in Information Technology and Engineering services. As part of the Netherlands-based organization Conclusion, which has an ecosystem of over 25 companies and 3,600 employees, we are focused on increasing the technological capacity of our clients and the digital transformation of their application ecosystems.

We are talent specialists, attracting the best people and combining them with the needs of the most ambitious projects, at the right time. Our success comes from our investments in innovation, our focus on results, and, above all, the guarantee that our people will have happy and rewarding careers.

With over 25 years of solid experience, Neotalent Conclusion has established its presence in key locations, including Lisbon, Porto, and Madrid. The company currently has more than 950 professionals in the different areas in which it operates.


Neotalent, the responsive people.


Find out more about us at www.neotalent.pt.


Role Overview:

We are looking for a Business/Data Analyst to join one of our biggest clients in the Porto area (Hybrid). A multinational financial services firm, one of the largest financial groups and among the 30 largest financial institution‚Äôs globally.


As a Business Analyst you will work in a Agile environment and you must be able to respond quickly and work on ad hoc requests from within and across teams regarding evolutionary maintenance tasks and production support.


What you will do:

  • Gather and analyze Business Requirements for new and ongoing projects;
  • Manage and respond to support requests;
  • Write specifications and user stories according to project requirements;
  • Define the plan for implementation of requests/projects;
  • Track and report project progress.


What you are like:

  • At least 2 years of experience as a Business Analyst;
  • Solid knowledge in financial products and market data;
  • Proven experience in IT Business Analysis or Analytics;
  • Knowledge in mathematics and statistics;
  • Good knowledge of Microsoft Excel (Python and R are a plus, but not mandatory)
  • Knowledge of Agile methodologies;
  • Knowledge of project management tools such as Jira and Confluence;
  • Good communication skills;
  • Ability to work in a team;
  • Good level of English ‚Äì minimum B2 (mandatory);


Why join us

  • Work on challenging projects for big clients
  • Learn more about emerging technologies
  • Possibility of working remotely
  • Design your career plan
  • Access to continuous training and certifications
  • Evolve through our internal mobility program
  • ‚Ä¶ and much more!

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Decskill was founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company and their main mission is to delivery value through the knowledge. We enable companies to meet the chalenges of digital world by providing our clients with business models that ensure technological capacity, flexibility and agility. We are more than 500 consultants with offices in Lisbon, Porto and Madrid.




DECSKILL operates in 3 main areas:

DECSKILL TALENT, through which we provide our clients with an extension to their IT teams;




DECSKILL BOOST, through which we provide our client with software development models to increase capacity and optimize Time-to-Market, where we create and manage teams that deliver according to their needs, at the desired speed;




DECSKILL CONNECT through which we provide our client with consulting services, as well as the implementation and management of information technology infrastructures.




Our practice results in the creation of value for our customers, either by delivering qualified and value-added services, or through highly qualified and motivated professionals, as well as technology solutions that allow us to operate and transform the business of our customers.




We are looking for an Data Engineer for a project in Lisbon!




Responsibilities:

Leverage large volumes of data from internal sources.
Develop, maintain, and support data pipelines.
Understand and be the point of contact for the business and assess its needs
Ensure architecture meets business requirements
Recommend ways to efficiently provide quality data and added value.
Communicate technical information to non-technical stakeholders, including data analysts, product managers, and business leaders
Prioritize and manage multiple projects simultaneously, meeting deadlines and delivering high-quality results.




Requirements:

Academic background in Engineering, Economics, Computing, Mathematics, Statistics or related fields
3+ years of experience in data engineering, with a strong background in data architecture
Availability to work in the hybrid model or in person in the Lisbon or Porto office
Professional experience in any data visualization tool such as Tableau or Power BI
Professional experience in data analysis with programming, preferably Python (Pandas)
Proficiency in SQL
Fluency in written and spoken English
Ability to analyze, synthetize and simplify.
Knowledge of descriptive statistics and hypothesis testing is a plus.
Knowledge in Big Data technology such as Pyspark, Presto and Airflow is a plus
Knowledge of Power Query and DAX is a plus
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams
Strong organizational skills, with the ability to prioritize multiple projects and meet deadlines
Fluency in English.
Tableau/PowerBI or other visualization tools is a plus.
CI / CD (Jenkins) is a plus.
Knowledge and interest in financial markets are a plus.




If you‚Äôre interested in this job, please send your CV in to cesaltina.abreu@decskill.com with reference ‚ÄúCA/DataEngineer‚Äù.




Thank You! :)




Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
HTML:
Company Description

Natixis in Portugal is a Centre of Expertise whose mission is to transform traditional banking by developing innovative solutions for the business, operations and work culture of Groupe BPCE worldwide.

Natixis in Portugal is part of the Global Financial Services division, where it applies technology for the development of financial expertise in its two global business lines ‚Äì Corporate & Investment Banking and Asset & Wealth Management ‚Äì and, transversally, for the entities of Groupe BPCE.

The Centre of Expertise, based in Porto, currently has more than 2,400 employees from over 30 nationalities, organised in three main departments: Information Technology, Banking Support Activities and Compliance. These teams work in an integrated, inclusive and transversal way, supporting and creating value for all the business lines and platforms of the group. The project in Porto is one of the biggest investments in Human Resources ever made by Groupe BPCE worldwide.

A disruptive mindset and a culture of proximity and agility identify Natixis in Portugal Team and reflect the company's mission to transform traditional banking at a global scale: a perfect match in the Portuguese dynamics and entrepreneurial ecosystem.

In 2024, Top Employers Institute has awarded Natixis in Portugal the Top Employer Portugal accreditation for the second time. This certification recognizes excellence in people practices, following the example of our head office, in France, who was certified Top Employer France for the eight year in a row.

Job Description

Team presentation and main goal:

Join the Data Sourcing Accounting Data team, within the Financial Data Integrity (FDI) division at Natixis, as part of the Finance Direction dedicated to upholding the integrity and accuracy of financial data across CIB activities (balance sheet and off-balance sheet). Our team is split between Paris and Porto, part of a department, of around 150 professionals, and is on the frontline of labelling financial data for both balance sheet and off-balance sheet activities.

Data Sourcing is split between Paris and Porto, and you'll be an integral part of a 10-member team.

You will be part of an integral part of a 10-member bi-localised team with a local manager and a functional manager based in Paris.

As a Data Analyst, for of a major French banking institution with international dimension, you will:

  • Support Data quality initiatives to meet both internal standards and regulatory requirements, with a particular focus on ensuring the accuracy, completeness, and reliability of Critical Data Elements (CDEs). These efforts are crucial for enhancing the integrity of financial reporting and analysis across the institution.
  • Engaging in comprehensive data monitoring activities for Corporate and Investment Banking (CIB) sectors, including Financing and Global Markets. Your analysis will support data-driven decision-making and operational excellence in these key areas.

You will be in contact with the Operations department (middle and back offices), the other teams of FDI & the internal Finance partners, and Finance IT teams.

Functions:

Monitoring and analysing data at the granular level to ensure the quality of the data required for all financial reporting or indicators (ALM, Solvency, Liquidity, FINREP,‚Ä¶):

  • Set up meetings with final internal partners to do a post-mortem of quarterly closing;
  • Study and propose new controls to be implemented or to evolve existing controls (especially completeness, existence, accuracy, consistency, or freshness controls):
  • Analyze the needs of the final internal partners;
  • Perform database queries to study the relevance of results;
  • Test and launch in production new controls.
  • Controlling the data acquisition & treatment on the financial chain inputs, along the flow;
  • Detecting anomalies & analyzing the root causes;
  • Reporting and alerting the management and the internal partners (accounting and ratio teams);
  • Defining remedial short and long term actions;
  • Writing and updating of operational procedures;
  • Support the data sourcing activities.

As a Data Analyst, you will be integral in ensuring the quality and integrity of data across all levels, crucial for financial reporting and compliance with indicators such as ALM, Solvency, Liquidity, and FINREP. Your responsibilities include:

  • Post-Mortem Meetings: Organize debrief sessions with key internal stakeholders after quarterly closings to review outcomes and identify improvement areas:
  • Control Evolution and Implementation:
  • Collaborate with internal partners to understand their data requirements and challenges;
  • Conduct database queries to assess the relevance of data and identify gaps, particularly focusing on Critical Data Elements (CDEs) to ensure their accuracy and completeness;
  • Develop, test, and deploy new controls or refine existing ones to enhance data completeness, existence, accuracy, consistency, and timeliness;
  • Data Acquisition & Treatment: Oversee the data collection and processing stages within the financial chain, ensuring smooth and error-free data flow.
  • Anomaly Detection: Proactively identify data discrepancies, delve into their root causes, and communicate findings with relevant teams, emphasizing the importance of managing CDEs effectively;
  • Communication: Report findings, anomalies, and recommendations to management and internal partners (accounting and ratio teams), fostering a culture of transparency and continuous improvement;
  • Action Planning: Develop both immediate and long-term remediation plans to address identified issues, ensuring the robustness of financial data;
  • Operational Documentation: Regularly review and update operational procedures to reflect current best practices and data management strategies;
  • Data Sourcing Support: Play a key role in assisting the Data Sourcing teams by:
  • Implementing automation strategies to streamline data retrieval and analysis processes.
  • Enhancing the efficiency and reliability of data sourcing activities, ensuring high-quality data is available for decision-making and reporting.

Additional information:

  • You will be part of a bi-localised team with a local manager and a functional manager Paris based, with regular interactions Paris team;
  • The ability to develop a network within the various teams of the Natixis ecosystem, and an aptitude for collaborative and group work are key factors of success in this position.

Qualifications

  • Strong Background/Education in a quantitative discipline, with a professional experience as a Data or Business Analyst, preferably in the finance department of a mid / large cap company or audit;
  • Data or Business Analyst (notions);
  • Financial Products (advanced knowledge);
  • Data Viz & Data Prep Tools (Power BI, Tableau, Quicksight, Google Analytics, ...) (advanced knowledge);
  • Python (advanced knowledge);
  • SQL (advanced knowledge);
  • Microsoft Office (Excel, VBA, PowerPoint,‚Ä¶) (advanced knowledge);
  • Project Management (advanced knowledge);
  • Other Programming Languages (notions);
  • Fluent English and Good Level of French (a big plus).

Soft Skills:

  • Rigor and accuracy;
  • Ability to analyse, summarise and report;
  • Critical thinking, flexible and problem solving;
  • Personal commitment and team spirit;
  • Autonomy, curiosity, and willingness to move the issues forward.

Additional Information

At Natixis, we are committed to fostering a working environment where each and every one of our people is treated with dignity and respect and where every voice is heard. Our differences make us collectively stronger and are a source of fulfilment, innovation and performance.

In the framework of its Diversity, Equity & Inclusion policy, Natixis in Portugal has implemented a Blind CV Screening process, with the purpose of reducing hiring bias. A blind CV excludes any personal details which refer to the applicant‚Äôs gender, age or ethnicity. When applying for our positions, please submit a blind CV, that is, with no picture, name, gender, age, nationality, ethnicity and address. Your personal statement, work experience, courses and certifications, education, skills and contact information is what matters to us.

#MuchMoreThanJustAJob

Early morning. Campo 24 de Agosto. In 4 minutes, you are clocking in at the office. Start your day having breakfast with the Team and grab fresh fruit on the way to your seat, in one of Porto‚Äôs most typical neighborhoods. This Purple Day is going to be a busy one: daily meeting ensuring all team members are on the same page regarding work status, priorities and blockers, language class and, just after, a Talent Management meeting with your manager, discussing your career path.

Lunch break. Today, your Team is onboarding newcomers, but also welcoming French colleagues: the perfect excuse to walk downtown and bond over a francesinha. When returning, inhale nature and peace of mind in Natixis Urban Garden (look at the crops; ready to harvest!).

Back inside. Brainstorming session on a new, exciting project in our disruptive and immersive Manaus Village. The afternoon went flying (tasks, meetings, some jokes with your teammates). End it on a high note: celebrating cultural diversity with a Diwali, the Indian festival of lights.

Tomorrow, you attend a conference led by influential speakers in your industry and, the day after, you will work from home, benefitting from some focus time to complete that report and soft skills course on LinkedIn Learning. Once you are done with your work for the day, strike the right note playing with Natixis band or be part of a board games session. If that is too steady for you, meet your colleagues to catch some waves or sail the Douro river during golden hour.

Title: Data Analyst (Alteryx)
Description:
Are you driven by Technology?If so, it's at Red IT that you should embrace your next challenge!

We took our first steps in Innovation and Technology in 2016, and the desire to do more and better is always with us.Red.It stands as a key element within Group RIT, a collaboration of technological enterprises focused on accelerating business growth through digital transformation.

Our teams are experienced and certified IT professionals that work closely with clients, to provide fit-for-purpose solutions.

From software development, next-generation cloud services, support in IT projects across multiple technological stacks, IT outsourcing, and many more, Group RIT will use the most advanced technology to accelerate and unleash the full potential of our client's business.

With 6 Business Units, 11 offices in 8 countries and a global team of over 500 people, Group RIT is leading digital innovation, providing innovative solutions for multiple business sectors like Telecom, Healthcare, Finance, Retail and Manufacturing.Red.It is dedicated to fostering a workplace that embraces diversity and inclusion.

As an equal opportunity employer, it does not discriminate based on race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or any other legally protected status.

We believe in creating an environment where all individuals are respected and valued for their unique perspectives and contributions.Join the Wolfpack as a Data Analyst (Hybrid - Porto) !What skills do you need to have?Bachelor's degree in Engineering/Computing/Science or similar field.4 years' experience in data preparation and reconciliation.Proficiency in Alteryx, VBA and SQL.Availability for occasional travel.Fluency in English:French is highly valued.Some of your responsibilities will be:Collaborate with business users to solve business problems.Develop and maintain Alteryx workflows for data processing.Ensure compliance with software governance rules.Estimate and manage data project tasks.Red Code:A team focused on achieving objectives, motivation will not be lacking!

Red Team!Red Training - We want to help you reach your potential.Continuous career support and advice.

Red Follow UpRed Change - You love what you do, but want to explore other areas?

No problem Wolf!There is time for everything, and fun is not left out.

Red HoursRed Spirit - If you want to go fast, go alone.

If you want to go far, GO TOGETHER!Keywords: Data Analyst, Alteryx.WHAT DRIVES YOU?Apply here or through ****** and find out what moves us at www.Redit.Pt

Title: Data Service - Dataviz (SCD)
Description:
At AXIANS we seek the right talent, for the right place. We work daily to involve our people in a collaborative and inclusive environment, with a culture of proximity. Also, part of our culture is our concern for the environment and the implementation of social and environmental corporate responsibility actions.

This could be your opportunity to join a company of international scope, with a project that needs you to meet the challenges of digital transformation.

üíª THE ROLE

We are looking for a #TechTalent to work as a Data Service ‚Äì Dataviz for an international project.

üôÇ YOUR DAY TO DAY


Get Knowledge over data visualization products, its features and several use cases.
Supervise and maintain Qlik Sense, BO and PowerBI applications.
Support users, manage and administrate Qlik Sense, BO and PowerBI applications.
Maintain operational readiness Qlik Sense, BO and PowerBI applications and their infrastructure ensuring technologic follow up roadmap (upgrade, security, availability, performance, volumes, solcing problem,‚Ä¶)
Contribute to the RUN tasks to maintain the Data Visualization products, and, above all, have a critical point of view to propose/implement the improvements needed to simplify/make the tasks more reliable
Get and keep informed about strategic plan of the Data Visualization products to define and lead actions to adapt the applications (Qlik Sense, BO, PowerBI)
Give advices and support to the IT developers and business lines users to build their projects and reports into Qlik Sense application
Contribute to migration project of BO dashboards to Qlik Sense or PowerBI
Contribute to implement PowerBI application and to define and deploy the service offering managed by the squad
Actively participate in projects by helping others squad members or business line users, managing, and doing building phases of dataviz
Write user guide and application support documentation
Contribute to all agile rituals


üí° WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR


Qlik Sense (expert including admistration)
Power BI (master, advanced administrator)
Relational data bases (Oracle, Exadata, PostGre, SQL,‚Ä¶) (master)
Fluency in French (C2) and English (B2)


‚≠ê WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT FROM US

Stable professional career

Working with Axians projects becomes an asset to those of us who want to offer stability through a secure career.

Prospects for career advancement

You can access training and new certifications that will further elevate your skills. The 360¬∞ evaluation from managers and peers will also allow you to evolve.

Work Life Balance

By collaborating with Axians, you will be able to reconcile work and family requirements without neglecting either area.

Attractive, Evolving Compensation

When working with Axians, you will have access to performance bonuses in addition to an attractive salary pack (base salary + benefits). You are also entitled to health insurance and free psychology consultations.

Do you identify with this position?

If you think this position is the right fit for you and you have the #TechTalent we are looking for, send us your resume, preferably in English and in Europass format, to recrutamento.axianspt@axians.com with the subject DSD/AS/MO‚Äù.

Learn more about Axians
Show more

Title: Junior Data & Analytics Consultant - French Speaker
Description:
Hitachi Solutions Europe is a global Digital, Data and Technology consultancy, Microsoft Solution partner and Cloud Services partner, specialising in end-to-end transformation.

As a global consultancy company working across the private and public sectors, we specialise in Dynamics 365 Business Applications, Power Platform, including Azure, Application Modernisation and Data & Analytics.

Our highly skilled team help drive improvements, creating efficiency and growth within organisations. We are committed to Microsoft technologies, with a mission to revolutionise modern businesses. To achieve this we employ the best, most dedicated talent to deliver outstanding technology solutions to both our local and global clients.

Be part of our Hitachi family

Hitachi Solutions Europe has several opportunities for graduates based in Portugal. Applicants should have a keen interest in technology, plus a desire to pursue an international career in consulting.

Hitachi Solutions Graduate Learning & Development (L&D) programme will inspire you to become our next generation of Hitachi Consultants. Working from our office in Porto, with the opportunity to work around Europe, this an exciting opportunity to be part of a company that believes in investing in people for the future. Our well-structured L&D programme is tailored to train you to become the best consultant you can be.

The programme fits perfectly with the Hitachi Solutions company vision of growth and our slogan Inspire the Next. Working with us offers a fantastic prospect to be part of a company that thinks ahead. As such, we actively encourage applications from graduates who are team players, adaptable, problem solvers and eager to learn.

Job Description

What to expect, your role


A Data & Analytics Consultant is responsible for supporting the capturing and detailing business processes and needs from our clients, through workshops, meetings, and documentation.
On a daily basis, you will be backing the team in developing data analytics solutions to support the effective operational, tactical and strategic decision making.
As part of this role consultants will be expected to:
Support the development of data solutions in Azure (using technologies such as Synapse Analytics, Fabric) to ingesting various sources into a unified data platform.
Design and deliver scalable PowerBI reports that provide actionable insights for a wide range of clients.


(throughout the L&D programme you will receive training to prepare you for these tasks)

Qualifications


Newly qualified graduates with less than three years‚Äô professional experience.
Degree in Data Science, Analytics, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics.
Fluency in English both written and oral.
Fluency in French both written and oral.
Credible client facing personality.
Strong presentation/communication/facilitation skills (oral and written).
Good problem solving and analytical skills.
Good knowledge of Microsoft Office productivity tools.
Knowledge of data systems and SQL (Preference).
Knowledge of BI tools e.g. Power BI, Tableau (Desirable).
Knowledge of programming languages e.g. Python, DAX/M, SQL, C#, R (Desirable).
Good organisational skills.
A strong sense of responsibility and autonomy.
Ability to work independently and well within a team.
Availability to travel abroad.
A demonstrable passion for technology.


Additional Information

What to expect, your benefits


Career development: we assign you a personal Career Development Mentor (CDM) to support. and guide you during your journey with us.
Flexible and friendly work environment (hybrid work model, work-life balance).
Competitive salary.
Health insurance.
25 annual leave days.
Mobile phone and public transport allowances.
Employee Assistance Programme.
Be part of one of the best IT consultancy companies in the world.


Beware of scams

Our recruiting team may communicate with candidates via our @hitachisolutions.com domain email address and/or via our SmartRecruiters (Applicant Tracking System) notification@smartrecruiters.com domain email address regarding your application and interview requests.

All offers will originate from our @hitachisolutions.com domain email address. If you receive an offer or information from someone purporting to be an employee of Hitachi Solutions from any other domain, it may not be legitimate.


Show more

Title: Data & Business Intelligence Officer
Description:
About The Job

Global Markets is BNP Paribas‚Äô capital markets business within Corporate & Institutional Banking (CIB), delivering solutions across asset classes, and industry-leading services for clients including Institutionals, corporates, private banks and retail distribution networks. Our Portugal Platform (Porto and Lisbon) is a major HUB in Europe and certainly unique in the country by its size and its scope of activity, with all Front Office roles present (Trading, Sales, Research, Structuring, Quant & Engineering, Business Dev and Support, Marketing & Client Support, Risk Management, Data Analytics and Machine Learning‚Ä¶). We are growing fast with the ambition to become even more relevant for the worldwide activity, which presents many short and long term opportunities.

Your Main Activities Are

The purpose of the role is to Drive the Business Intelligence for FX+, including (but not limited to) reporting on the activity, tracking of the business case, management of the Revenue Sharing Agreements, pricing and booking models enhancements, business development and tracking of the operational quality.


Monitor the FX Payments activity and the revenue sharing
Monitor activity KPIs (volumes, revenues, pricing ‚Ä¶) for all geographies / clients
Manage revenue sharing with TB / DM / IRB partners
Track the FX+ platform performance and operational quality
Support the business development with accurate ad-hoc data analysis (pricing analysis, campaigns targeting and follow-up‚Ä¶)
Build a state of the art industrial ‚ÄúClient Intelligence‚Äù solutio
Establish key metrics, reports and alerts and requirements in terms of digital business performance, in close collaboration with the businesses, to measure activity and revenues
Contribute to the management of the product roadmap for Client Intelligence (extension to new activities, new countries, new client segments and needs ‚Ä¶)


Profile And Skills To Success


Academic background in Engineering, Mathematics, Finance, Economics or similar areas (preferential)
Experience in a similar Business Intelligence
An overall understanding and interest in the financial world
Strong appetite for Digital technologies, support and foster a culture of continuous improvement
Experienced in defining and sponsoring projects and project management: business case and scoping study, management of the delivery along with Business Lines / IT / Operations
Fluency in English (mandatory)
Excellent communication skills and client focus
Strong team work while being able to work autonomously
Ability to work under tight deadlines and organisational skills
Strong Excel knowledge
Tableau, PowerBI and other IT coding Skills ‚Äì (Intermediate)
Contribute to the management of the product roadmap for Client Intelligence (extension to new activities, new countries, new client segments and needs Contribute to the management of the product roadmap for Client Intelligence (extension to new activities, new countries, new client segments and needs ‚Ä¶)


Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

  • Manage revenue sharing with TB / DM / IRB partners
  • Track the FX+ platform performance and operational quality
  • Support the business development with accurate ad-hoc data analysis (pricing analysis, campaigns targeting and follow-up‚Ä¶)
  • Build a state of the art industrial ‚ÄúClient Intelligence‚Äù solutio
  • Establish key metrics, reports and alerts and requirements in terms of digital business performance, in close collaboration with the businesses, to measure activity and revenues
  • Contribute to the management of the product roadmap for Client Intelligence (extension to new activities, new countries, new client segments and needs ‚Ä¶)

Profile And Skills To Success

  • Academic background in Engineering, Mathematics, Finance, Economics or similar areas (preferential)
  • Experience in a similar Business Intelligence
  • An overall understanding and interest in the financial world
  • Strong appetite for Digital technologies, support and foster a culture of continuous improvement
  • Experienced in defining and sponsoring projects and project management: business case and scoping study, management of the delivery along with Business Lines / IT / Operations
  • Fluency in English (mandatory)
  • Excellent communication skills and client focus
  • Strong team work while being able to work autonomously
  • Ability to work under tight deadlines and organisational skills
  • Strong Excel knowledge
  • Tableau, PowerBI and other IT coding Skills ‚Äì (Intermediate)
  • Contribute to the management of the product roadmap for Client Intelligence (extension to new activities, new countries, new client segments and needs Contribute to the management of the product roadmap for Client Intelligence (extension to new activities, new countries, new client segments and needs ‚Ä¶)

Why joining BNP Paribas?

  • Leading banking institution

BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.

  • Our presence in Portugal

In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.

  • International reach

Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions

  • Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
  • Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
  • Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
  • Diversity and Inclusion commitment

BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.

  • Commitment towards work/life balance

At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.

  • Remote Working Conditions

At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal

  • Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
  • In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Data Analyst with LLM and GenAI
Description:
Join our mission-driven team

We're looking for a Data Analyst to join our team and contribute to projects with our impact-driven clients and internal initiatives, with a special focus on conversational AI systems.

Requirements

What you'll do


Programming and software engineering, specifically with Python
Statistical analysis to uncover trends and insights
Data manipulation and visualization, defining and highlighting KPIs
Work with a cross-functional team to improve user experiences
Data architecture and management, capturing and organizing large volumes of data
Learn and grow in areas that interest you



Benefits

About Last Call Media

Welcome to Last Call Media, where we're all about building meaningful digital experiences. Since 2005, we've been the trusted partner for impact-driven organizations, marrying human-centered design with agile software development practices. We've earned a reputation for taking smart risks, tackling the toughest challenges, and delivering solutions that truly matter.

How We Work

Our cross-functional team of over 50 talented individuals spans the globe, thriving on open communication and self-accountability. We foster a culture where everyone can bring their full, authentic selves to work, balancing professional growth with personal well-being. Our fully remote setup means you can work from anywhere in the world, blending flexibility with productivity - we do bill for our time, after all.

At Last Call, we don't have traditional "people managers." We value self-starters who can work independently while knowing when to reach out for support. Collaboration is in our DNA, and we believe that diverse perspectives lead to better outcomes.

Our Values

If you're considering joining us, we hope you see yourself in our values:


Start with trust
Seek understanding
Think big
Say what you think and do what you say
Move forward
Bring the energy
Pursue Excellence
Commitment to Inclusivity


We're proud to be an equal opportunity employer, dedicated to creating an inclusive and accessible environment for all candidates and employees. Everyone deserves the chance to contribute and succeed.

What's Next?

We're offering a competitive salary between $80,000-150,000 annually that matches your skills and experience, along with a comprehensive benefits package. This includes a generous professional development budget, flexible PTO, health, dental, and vision insurance, and more!

If this sounds like the place for you, apply now. Applications must be completed in English, and AI use is welcomed throughout the hiring process, as long as you can explain your responses.

Our hiring process is straightforward:


Complete the application, including a brief questionnaire‚Äîno cover letters needed. Enter job ID 79 when prompted.
If selected, you'll be asked to send a short video answering a few questions
If selected, you'll be interviewed by members of LCM's Engineering Group
If selected, you'll be interviewed by members of LCM's Government Solutions Group


Should you receive an offer, we'll conduct a background check through a third-party vendor, adhering to the Fair Credit Reporting Act (FCRA) and other relevant laws. This ensures a safe and productive workplace for everyone. If you have questions, we're here to provide transparency and clarity.

Title: Senior Data Analyst - Fraud Prevention
Description:
Company Description

Hello! We're Teya.

Teya is a payment and software service provider, headquartered in London serving small, local businesses across Europe. Founded in 2019, we build easy to use, integrated tools that enable our members to accept payments and boost business performance.

At Teya we believe small, local businesses are the lifeblood of our communities. We‚Äôre here because we don‚Äôt believe there‚Äôs a level playing field that gives small businesses with a fighting chance against the giants of the high street.We‚Äôre here because we see banks and legacy service providers making things harder for them. We don‚Äôt think the best technology or the best service should be reserved for those with the biggest headquarters.We‚Äôre here to fight for a future where small, local businesses can thrive, and to commit the same dedication they offer all of us.

Become a part of our story. We‚Äôre looking for exceptional talent to join our mission. We offer a chance to create impact in a high-energy and connected culture, while benefiting from continuous learning opportunities, a supportive community which is proud to serve our mission, and comprehensive benefits.

Job Description

Become a part of our story:

We‚Äôre looking for exceptional talent to join our mission. We offer a chance to create impact in a high-energy and connected culture, while benefiting from continuous learning opportunities, a supportive community which is proud to serve our mission, and comprehensive benefits.

The Team

The Customer Risk Monitoring team, part of the Acceptance group, is responsible for implementing and maintaining the analytical intelligence that protects Teya and its customers from exposure to financial risks, including fraud and money laundering. Our goals are to minimise financial losses to Teya while maintaining customer trust and ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements. This team aligns very closely with the Ops teams investigating suspicious activities.

As a senior data analyst in fraud, you will work collaboratively with the data scientists building our in-house fraud intelligence, the engineers integrating it, the Ops investigators using this intelligence in the real world, and the team leadership aligning this work with roadmap goals and strategic planning. A key expectation for this role is to help shape the short-, medium-, and long-term direction of fraud detection, automated intervention, and risk monitoring at Teya, and we expect the ideal candidate to understand and be excited about this opportunity.

The Role

As a Senior Data Analyst in fraud, you will:


Deliver insights that lead to actionable and measurable outcomes such as improvement in the fraud detection rate, reduction in false positive rate, and decreased time to detect and investigate fraudulent activity
Be a key individual contributor to a diverse and innovative team, developing a deep understanding of data inputs and driving continuous improvement while addressing fast-moving risks and opportunities.
Work with senior product, business, and engineering leaders to analyse data, identify opportunities for building new models, develop and maintain real-time dashboards, and deliver insights through in-depth reports
Effectively manage business stakeholders and drive initiatives to promote actionable insights, identifying and prioritising requirements and owning a roadmap of deliverables
Build and maintain dashboards, documentation and reports in various environments, including Snowflake, Tableau and other visualisation tools
Build predictive models to forecast our fraud KPIs and evaluate against the budget and actuals
Collaborate with data engineering to build and maintain ETLs and data models relevant to the fraud and financial risk domain
Promote a data-driven culture across the business


Qualifications

Basic Requirements


3+ years of professional data analyst experience in a technical domain
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
Experience using a range of statistical methods, such as time series analysis, forecasting, hypothesis testing, A/B testing, ANOVA, regression analysis
Highly proficient in SQL and Tableau (or equivalent BI tool)
Experience working with large, unstructured and heterogeneous data sources, as well as the ability to write and understand complex SQL
Experience building ETL and/or using data transformation tools like DBT
Experience using Python for data analysis
Self-starter, comfortable in a fast-paced environment and able to adapt to changing circumstances quickly
Strong data storytelling skills, capable of translating complex data into understandable conclusions and recommendations
Ability to think creatively and insightfully about business problems
Excellent written and verbal communication skills


Nice to have


Experience with data analysis in the financial crime domain (fraud, AML, etc.)
Bachelor's degree in mathematics, statistics, or relevant experience in a related field


Additional Information

The Perks


We trust you, so we offer flexible working hours, as long it suits both you and your team;
Health Insurance;
Meal Allowance;
25 days of Annual leave (+ Bank holidays);
Public Transportation Card;
Frequent team events & activities in the office and outside;
Office snacks every day;
Friendly, comfortable and informal office environment.
Show more

Title: Marketplace Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Who we are

We are Metyis, a forward-thinking, global company that collaborates with business partners and clients to create and implement the capacities and capabilities required to improve future performance. We operate across a wide range of industries, and with our embedded partnership model we commit to driving sustainable growth for industry-leading organisations, elevating their potential with a long-term vision

At Metyis, we develop integrated solutions that enable growth by working within our business partners‚Äô organisations with diverse and multidisciplinary teams. This collaborative environment allows Metyis to build strategies and execute them through an ecosystem that combines Big Data solutions, Digital Commerce solutions, Marketing & Design solutions, and Advisory services.

Our teams are set up so that you have plenty of room to build bigger and bolder ideas by speaking your mind and being creative with your knowledge. Imagine the things you could achieve with a multidisciplinary team that encourages you to be the best version of yourself.

We are Metyis. Partners for Impact.

What We Offer


Opportunity to accelerate the pace of digitalization & eCommerce growth through advanced technology, business intelligence, and analytics.
Driving high-impact insights enhancing decision-making across the entire organization.
Driving brand equity and digital sales through enhanced digital experiences.
Interaction with senior business and eCommerce leaders on regular basis to drive their business towards impactful change.
Become part of a fast-growing international and diverse team.
Work in a strategic partnership with a world-renowned industry leader.



What You Will Do


The Ecommerce analyst will be responsible for reporting and providing insights and recommendations from data to drive strategic decision making, optimize sales and improve the overall efficiency and profitability of the brand's presence in marketplaces.
Collect, organize, and analyse e-commerce data from various sources, including marketplace platforms, web analytics, and sales reports.
Maintain and improve the existing reports and dashboards to communicate performance metrics, trends, and the effectiveness of trading on marketplaces.
Report on marketplaces activity and P&L and identify potential gaps towards the targe.
Analyse the impact of pricing strategies, promotions, and marketing campaigns on sales performance‚ÄØ.
Work closely with the commercial team to identify business needs and work as a pivot with the Data team to build new tolls and reports to support trading.
Utilize historical sales data and market trends to create sales forecasts and demand projections for various products and categories.
Work closely with cross-functional teams, such as marketing, content, and operations, to align e-commerce strategies with overall business objectives.
Present findings, reports, and actionable insights to stakeholders and management.



What You‚Äôll Bring


Minimum of 2-3 years of working experience in E-Commerce.
Completed a relevant degree in eCommerce, Computer Science/Engineering or Economics.
Deep experience in PowerBI Modelling, development and deployment.
Solid understanding and working experience of other BI tools.
Technical problem solving.
Microsoft Stack knowledge, mainly MS Fabric (or Databricks, Data Factory, synapse, other...).
Experience and knowledge in data modelling with Python/PySpark and SQL.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to deliver insights that drive solutions and strategies.
Proven ability to collaborate broadly with flexible, positive attitude and ability to get results.
Strong problem-solving skills. Capacity to use critical thinking and consider all the information that is provided to resolve issues that may arise.
A deep passion for E-Commerce and a thorough understanding of eCommerce websites and business models.
Experience in working with fashion marketplaces and platforms is a plus.
Ability to prioritize topics independently.
Ability to work in the English language with strong written and oral communication skills.
Fluency in other (European) languages besides English, such as French, Spanish, or German is a plus.
Experience within the retail and fashion industry.
Experience within international environments, consultancies, or a start-up environment.



In a changing world, diversity and inclusion are core values for team well-being and performance. At Metyis, we want to welcome and retain all talents, regardless of gender, age, origin or sexual orientation, and irrespective of whether or not they are living with a disability, as each of them has their own experience and identity.

Title: Data Analyst (Bangkok Based, relocation provided)
Description:
About Agoda

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with a global network of 4.7M hotels and holiday properties worldwide, plus flights, activities, and more . Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 7,100+ employees representing 95+ nationalities in 27 markets foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership,‚ÄØenhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.

Our Purpose ‚Äì Bridging the World Through Travel

We believe travel allows people to enjoy, learn and experience more of the amazing world we live in. It brings individuals and cultures closer together, fostering empathy, understanding and happiness.

We are a skillful, driven and diverse team from across the globe, united by a passion to make an impact. Harnessing our innovative technologies and strong partnerships, we aim to make travel easy and rewarding for everyone.

Get to Know our Team:

The Performance Marketing Team of Agoda is a world leader in online marketing. This department is highly data-driven and focused on developing at-scale marketing programs that improve the lifetime value of Agoda customers through measurable marketing programs and channels. The team is a blend of the best analysts, marketing strategists, and data scientists in the world. The marketing leadership at Agoda have deep experience in data science, product, strategy, and other marketing fields and have built an organization that thrives on data, creative ideas, and technology. The Performance Marketing Team also fosters a great learning environment. You will be able to learn and grow by working closely with experts from a variety of backgrounds from all over the world.

In this Role, you‚Äôll get to:


Search: Experiment with text ads, bidding, and campaign structures on Google, Bing, Baidu, Naver, and other search engines. Adapt to new product features and roll out changes from successful tests
Display: Test, analyze, and optimize campaigns on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and others
Modeling: Analyze the vast amounts of data generated by experiments, develop models we can use for optimization, and build dashboards for account managers


What you‚Äôll Need to Succeed:


Bachelor‚Äôs Degree or higher from top university in a quantitative subject (computer science, mathematics, engineering, statistics or science)
Ability to communicate fluently in English
Exposure to one or more data analysis packages or databases, e.g., SAS, R, SPSS, Python, VBA, SQL, Tableau
Good numerical reasoning skills
Proficiency in Excel
Intellectual curiosity and analytical skills


It‚Äôs Great if you Have:


Experience in digital marketing
Academic research experience

Equal Opportunity Employer

At Agoda, we pride ourselves on being a company represented by people of all different backgrounds and orientations. We prioritize attracting diverse talent and cultivating an inclusive environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. Employment at Agoda is based solely on a person‚Äôs merit and qualifications. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity regardless of sex, age, race, color, national origin, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, citizenship, veteran or military status, and other legally protected characteristics.

We will keep your application on file so that we can consider you for future vacancies and you can always ask to have your details removed from the file. For more details please read our privacy policy .

To all recruitment agencies: Agoda does not accept third party resumes. Please do not send resumes to our jobs alias, Agoda employees or any other organization location. Agoda is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with a global network of 4.7M hotels and holiday properties worldwide, plus flights, activities, and more . Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 7,100+ employees representing 95+ nationalities in 27 markets foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership,‚ÄØenhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.

Our Purpose ‚Äì Bridging the World Through Travel

We believe travel allows people to enjoy, learn and experience more of the amazing world we live in. It brings individuals and cultures closer together, fostering empathy, understanding and happiness.

We are a skillful, driven and diverse team from across the globe, united by a passion to make an impact. Harnessing our innovative technologies and strong partnerships, we aim to make travel easy and rewarding for everyone.

Get to Know our Team:

The Performance Marketing Team of Agoda is a world leader in online marketing. This department is highly data-driven and focused on developing at-scale marketing programs that improve the lifetime value of Agoda customers through measurable marketing programs and channels. The team is a blend of the best analysts, marketing strategists, and data scientists in the world. The marketing leadership at Agoda have deep experience in data science, product, strategy, and other marketing fields and have built an organization that thrives on data, creative ideas, and technology. The Performance Marketing Team also fosters a great learning environment. You will be able to learn and grow by working closely with experts from a variety of backgrounds from all over the world.

In this Role, you‚Äôll get to:

  • Search: Experiment with text ads, bidding, and campaign structures on Google, Bing, Baidu, Naver, and other search engines. Adapt to new product features and roll out changes from successful tests
  • Display: Test, analyze, and optimize campaigns on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and others
  • Modeling: Analyze the vast amounts of data generated by experiments, develop models we can use for optimization, and build dashboards for account managers

What you‚Äôll Need to Succeed:

  • Bachelor‚Äôs Degree or higher from top university in a quantitative subject (computer science, mathematics, engineering, statistics or science)
  • Ability to communicate fluently in English
  • Exposure to one or more data analysis packages or databases, e.g., SAS, R, SPSS, Python, VBA, SQL, Tableau
  • Good numerical reasoning skills
  • Proficiency in Excel
  • Intellectual curiosity and analytical skills

It‚Äôs Great if you Have:

  • Experience in digital marketing
  • Academic research experience

Equal Opportunity Employer

At Agoda, we pride ourselves on being a company represented by people of all different backgrounds and orientations. We prioritize attracting diverse talent and cultivating an inclusive environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. Employment at Agoda is based solely on a person‚Äôs merit and qualifications. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity regardless of sex, age, race, color, national origin, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, citizenship, veteran or military status, and other legally protected characteristics.

We will keep your application on file so that we can consider you for future vacancies and you can always ask to have your details removed from the file. For more details please read our privacy policy .
